Full Job Description

We are looking for a college student studying QA, computer science, graphic design or anything else technical that wants to get work experience this summer in a collaborative and multi cultural learning environment.

This internship starts on July 5 for 5-6 weeks for 4 days each week and will give you hands on experience with different QA techniques, opportunities to learn how software QA and help desks run and the ability to lean how to maneuver through proprietary systems.

Our office is located in Fort Lee, NJ and this is an In-Office internship only. So please do not apply if you are unable to easily commute to Fort Lee.

Although it is an unpaid position, we provide our interns with a $200 weekly stipend to cover transportation and lunch.

Full Job Description

Department: Information Technology
Location: Orlando, FL
Reports to: Director of Project Management and Interns
Peers: IT Support Specialist, IT Systems Analyst
Exemption Status: Non-Exempt

Who You Are

First, you're a committed Christian who wants to use your technical skills to serve the Lord. You are also an aspiring IT technician who likes to solve problems and learn new things. You enjoy helping people use technology and you have the patience required when the solutions are hard to find. You enjoy the feeling that comes with helping people get back to work after their computer gives them trouble. You aren’t afraid to own a technology upgrade project from start to finish.

Who We Are

A group of about twenty-five Christian software and infrastructure techs, working at an aggressively growing non-profit that is helping to make the Bible available to everyone, everywhere. God has blessed us with the resources to pay for high performance team-members. You can learn more about our organization at https://www.wycliffeassociates.org/. This is the kind of place that rewards intensity, ambition, drive, and creativity.

The Job You'll Do

The infrastructure help desk intern position is a uniquely important because the person who fills this role will act as the face of IT to the rest of Wycliffe Associates. Customer service skills are equally as important as technical skills. Working with senior help desk and application support staff, this intern will be responsible for resolving simple to medium complexity issues.

What We'll Do For You

  • Enable you to serve God through your talents in fellowship with other believers
  • We’ll give you a place where you can learn about all kinds of technology that is used to keep an organization running
  • We’ll give you opportunities to grow, stretch, flex, and learn
  • Provide help desk best practices guided by seasoned professionals
  • Create an environment to learn from mentors and each other
  • Have you contribute to real-world projects with meaningful impact

Job Responsibilities And Duties

  • Responding to help desk phone calls, emails, and walk ups
  • Resolving computer and IP telephony hardware issues
  • Solving network connectivity issues
  • Resetting forgotten passwords
  • Setting up new user accounts
  • Imaging computers and servers (Windows & Linux)
  • Helping end users with common Microsoft software such as Windows and Office 365
  • Learning basic troubleshooting of some in house applications
  • Assisting with and potentially taking ownership of project work such as hardware refreshes, network upgrades, or major software rollouts

Your Skills

  • You have at least a basic understanding of common PC and network troubleshooting concepts and a desire to learn more.

*

  • You should be able to install Windows and Office on a computer from scratch

*

  • You should be able to tell what the IP address of a computer is and how the computer got it
  • You should be comfortable supporting users over the phone, email, and in person
  • Nice to have (experience):
  • Windows Server
  • Linux
  • Active Directory

Your Education & Experience

  • You are currently enrolled or recently graduated, studying either Computer Science, Information Technology, or Information Systems at an accredited college or university
  • An overall GPA of 3.0 or above
  • If you are still in school, you are or will be a Senior by Fall of 2021

Personal Qualifications

  • Have a personal relationship with Jesus Christ and live a life in full alignment with our Core Beliefs. https://wycliffeassociates.org/about/core-beliefs/
  • Should sense a call from God to ministry and have a genuine caring for people.
  • Should have personal warmth that invites confidence and possess a personal integrity that never forfeits the trust that is offered.
  • Ability to be at ease with people from diverse cultures and backgrounds.
  • Demonstration of the attitudes of a servant leader.
  • Highly self-motivated and directed.
  • Keen attention to detail.
  • Ability to communicate effectively in oral and written form.
  • Ability to work effectively with a virtual team.
  • Can keep commitments.
  • Ability and desire to learn new technologies, improve skills, and adapt to change.

Job Types: Full-time, Internship

Pay: $12.00 - $20.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • Professional development assistance

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift

COVID-19 considerations:
We are sanitizing surfaces and social distancing in the office.

Education:

  • Bachelor's (Preferred)

Experience:

  • IT Helpdesk: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location:

  • One location

Work Remotely:

  • No

Full Job Description

The Research and Development department at DigiStream Investigations Inc. is looking for a curious, organized and motivated individual to join the team on a part-time basis as the R&D Intern.

DigiStream Investigations
Venture Management Specialists, Inc

Position: Research & Development Intern (paid internship)

Starting Hourly Rate: $16.00 per hour

Work Status: Part-time hours, and flexible weekly work schedule to accommodate your weekly school schedule

Office Location: West Sacramento, CA

*Great opportunity to gain work experience, and for career advancement!

Job Summary:

DigiStream Investigations is a national investigative firm with twenty affiliate offices and growing. By joining this exciting and fast-paced team, the R&D Intern will get a chance to participate in cutting-edge research projects, provide critical assistance in investigations, and learn about how technology impacts and enhances the investigative tradecraft. This individual should be currently working towards their Bachelor’s degree.

Responsibilities:

With guidance from all R&D Specialists, the R&D Intern will be expected to:

· Assist with research projects and experiments in the field

· Help extract key insights from data entry, analysis, and visualization

· Learn and utilize current R&D programs and software used for investigations

· Provide essential support and insight to R&D Specialists regarding investigations, projects, and special affiliate requests

· Assess experimental software and hardware for effectiveness and report all results to the team

· Track all completed advanced assignments in established R&D logs

· Preserve and deliver confidential evidence as requested

· Fulfill requests from department employees and affiliate offices

· Create and manage auxiliary open-source intelligence resources, such as investigative social media accounts

· Attend operations meetings to discuss ideas and project findings with the team

· Other duties as needed

Requirements:

· Strong research and writing skills

· Strong organizational and communication skills

· Working towards a degree in an applicable field such as Criminal Justice, Computer Science, Psychology, History, Political Science or Journalism

· Ability to work independently and meet deadlines

· Willingness to learn basic investigative methodology and practices

· Willingness to learn and use new software and hardware

· Ability to interpret, analyze, and distill information from databases, social media, and government/private entities

· Maintain confidentiality of subject and client information, as well as DigiStream’s investigative methods and technology

· No prior hardware/software experience is required, however a demonstrated history of successful troubleshooting is preferred

**Please provide a Resume and Cover Letter when applying for this position!

Full Job Description
If you are looking for an internship opportunity that delivers much more than a traditional internship, this opportunity may be for you! Training, mentoring, real-world assignments, collaboration, and certifications are all possibilities.

At Yellow, Salesforce.com is a key technology that provides business capabilities to Sales, Customer Service, Operations, Pricing, and many other areas.

Don’t know much about Salesforce.com? That’s ok . . . you will by the time your internship comes to an end. You’ll find that Salesforce.com is the world’s #1 CRM solution. It’s a SaaS based ecosystem that provides a wholistic view of the customer, enables analytics to make better and more timely business decisions, and customizes and scales for any size company.

Why would you want an internship with the Yellow Salesforce team? Here are just a few reasons:

Paid internship that could be year-round until you graduate.
Time commitments flex from 15 – 20 hours per week during semesters to full-time during breaks and summer.
Training on a world class CRM solution.
Mentoring from technology professionals at one of the largest transportation companies in North America.
Opportunities for certifications on Salesforce.com.
Exposure to and inclusion in an Agile delivery model delivering assignments and responsibilities for real world capabilities.
Develop your skills as well as interact with vendors (Salesforce.com) and solution partners.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Under direct supervision of a mentor, learn and develop skills in field of study.
Gain exposure to the business environment.
Perform basic tasks and administrative duties such as
Maintenance and monitoring of technical platforms and applications
Technology configuration
Analyze technical data and prepare conclusions
What responsibilities would a graduate student have that might be higher level?
Assist in report preparation and analysis.
Participate on group projects.

COMPETENCIES

Adaptability - Maintaining effectiveness when experiencing major changes in work responsibilities or environment (e.g., people, processes, structure, or culture); adjusting effectively to change by exploring the benefits, trying new approaches, and collaborating with others to make the change successful.
Building Trusting Relationships - Using appropriate interpersonal styles to establish effective relationships with customers and internal partners; interacting with others in a way that promotes openness and trust and gives them confidence in one’s intentions.
Collaborating - Working cooperatively with others to help a team or work group achieve its goals.
Communication - Conveying information and ideas clearly and concisely to individuals or groups in an engaging manner that help them understand and retain the message; listening actively to others.
Continuous Learning - Actively identifying new areas for learning; regularly creating and taking advantage of learning opportunities; using newly gained knowledge and skill on the job and learning through their application.
Initiating Action - Taking prompt action to accomplish work goals; taking action to achieve results beyond what is required; being proactive.
Work Standards - Setting high standards of performance for self and others; assuming responsibility and accountability for successfully completing assignments or tasks; self-imposing standards of excellence rather than having standards imposed.

BENEFITS

Competitive pay based on experience

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS

Grade point average 3.0 or better.
Demonstrated strong interpersonal communication skills.
Strong listening skills and ability to follow directions.
Effective oral, written and interpersonal skills.
Currently enrolled and pursuing undergraduate (at least second year student) or graduate degree in Management Information Systems, Computer Science or like discipline.

WORKING CONDITIONS

This job operates in a professional office environment indoors. Routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets, and fax machines.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS

The position requires the ability to spend long hours sitting or standing while using office equipment and computers. Ability to perform repetitive tasks such as typing and keying. Occasional lifting, pushing/pulling, carrying 10 lbs of supplies and materials is required.

Yellow Corporation, along with all subsidiary companies, are an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer

position: SAP iXp Intern - Product Management for FinOps
description:
Full Job Description
Requisition ID: 286133
Work Area: Finance
Expected Travel: 0 - 10%
Career Status: Student
Employment Type: Intern

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.
SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

About the SAP Internship Experience Program

The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, strategic, paid internship program that provides university students with opportunities to find purpose in their careers.

Three reasons to intern at SAP:
Culture of collaboration: meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
Project-driven experience: gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
Gain visibility: with SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.

About the team

SAP SuccessFactors is SAP’s largest Cloud Business and we are looking for an experienced and energetic intern to help us realize our vision of Next Generation Cloud Delivery! This is an incredible opportunity to advance your career and gain invaluable experience in cloud cost transformation and management program.

What you’ll do

Position title: SAP iXp Intern - Product Management for FinOps
Location: Virtual – USA
Expected start date to end date: May 2021

In this role, you’ll:
Get actively involved, experience personal development opportunities and expand your technical skills within a corporate culture with highly motivated and friendly colleagues
With One Strike, we are ramping Product Financials Track to work with Engineering and Product Management teams to create transparency and visibility on cost of cloud infrastructure spend by product, build dashboards and democratize the datasets for teams create actionable insights.
As a product management Intern, you will be working with Financial Operations track to interview and run design sessions with product management, engineering, cloud operations and business operations to build the dashboards and insights.
Gather requirements from product management, engineering, cloud operations and business operations, and write detailed product specifications for the Cost Utilization Dashboards.
Work with large datasets to support on cloud cost management, financial modeling and change of processes with focus on continuous improvement and in collaboration with the involved stakeholders
Creation, review and update of product requirements on Cost Utilization Dashboards with migration to Public Cloud
Work on technical and non-technical topics regarding architecture and services
Communicate Cost Utilization Dashboards capabilities and plans to internal audiences
Support in preparation and coordination of project tasks

Learning & Development Opportunities

Get deep insides into the methods, processes and tools related to cloud cost management.
Learn from subject matter expert on category management across SAP organizations
Business requirements gathering and refinement
Project management
Expand your network into different board areas and teams

Who you are

We’re looking for someone who takes initiative, perseveres, and stay curious. You like to work on meaningful innovative projects and are energized by lifelong learning.

Educational Requirements

Current student or recent graduate of a Bachelor's, Master's or MBA degree program
Field of study: Engineering, Computer Science, MBA
Computer skills: Microsoft Office

Soft skills

Desire to always be learning
Interest in defining software products
Collaborative team-player attitude
Fast Learner with aptitude to gain end user and customer IT perspective and distill the knowledge to drive product enhancements
Reliability and focus on high quality of work
Excellent presentation, oral, and written communication skills
Ability to work in a global, agile and diverse organization
Possess analysis skills to take data as input and output actionable recommendations
Ability to multi-task and work in a fast-paced environment

Desired Work experience

First experiences and knowledge in process management would be beneficial
Practical experiences on IT/ business processes (like ITIL) gained through other IT internships would be an asset

Follow @SAPiXp on Instagram and don’t miss anything about our experiences worldwide!

WHAT YOU GET FROM US
Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own.
A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.

SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team. (Americas:Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com). Requests for reasonable accommodation will be considered on a case-by-case basis. Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability:
Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status or disability.

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.
Additional Locations: Virtual - USA

Full Job Description
Agency: Department of Innovation and Technology

Job Type: Salaried Full Time
County: Sangamon
Number of Vacancies: 1
Plan/BU: RC063

Collective Bargaining Agreement language applies to this requisition:
We are currently transitioning away from a paper application process to an electronic application process. This position has not been transitioned. Please follow the directions below when applying to this position.

DO NOT APPLY ONLINE

**DO NOT CLICK THE APPLY BUTTON**

CMS100/B Employment Application and all applicable documentation should be submitted to the Agency contact listed below.

Posting Identification # DoIT 29780

Job Responsibilities

Under immediate supervision, for a period of 12 months, but up to a maximum of 24 months where target position requires additional training and experience, participates in Information Technology (IT) training opportunities for the purpose of supporting the agency's Governance, Risk and Compliance (GRC) program as directed by the Risk manager; assists in the daily operation of risk management programs. Receives on- the-job training regarding best practices for risk management and the use of the Risk Management Framework (RMF). Assists with the gathering, reporting and response to risk issues as guided by technical personnel and managers. Assists with governance, risk and compliance activities and receives formal and on- the-job training regarding these activities. Travels to attend meetings and training sessions.

(Job Responsibilities continued)

Participates in on-the-job training to understand all activities associated with the Risk Management program. Participates in the planning and deployment of risk management policies, procedures, assessments and programs. Assists with, but not limited to, the following tasks: security reviews, identifying gaps in security architecture, and developing a security risk management plan; assessing threats to and vulnerabilities of computer system(s) to develop a security risk profile; performing information security risk assessments and designing security countermeasures to mitigate identified risks. As part of a team, travels to attend meetings and training to support risk management and risk assessment requests.

Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities

Requires completion of four years of college, preferably in computer science, IT security, auditing, risk management or a related field, or completion of two years of technical school in computer science, IT security, auditing, risk management or a related field, or active enrollment in college with satisfactory completion of 24 semester hours in computer science. Requires a valid driver's license and/or the ability travel.

Specialized Skills: Requires elementary knowldge of security designs, approaches to resolve vulnerabilites and methods to mitigate risks, Requies good oral and written communication skills to present technical information to non-technical decision makers with clarity and precision.

Requires:
Ability to learn and interpret Risk Management Framework Requirements
Ability to take directions from supervisors and/or lead workers
Ability to analyze observations and clearly communicate observations to others
Ability to utilize agency supplied materials/equipment (e.g., cell phone, laptop, etc.)

This class is included as an Upward Mobility Program credential title.

Requires ability to satisfactorily complete fingerprint-based background check as defined in the Department of Justice, Federal Bureau of Investigation Criminal Justice Information Services (CJIS) Security Policy, Internal Revenue Service Publication ac 1075 and background check done by the Illinois State Police.

Work Hours: 8:30 am - 5:00 pm
Work Location: 120 W Jefferson St Springfield, IL 62702-5170

Although work is currently being performed remotely due to COVID-19, remote work status is subject to change. Individuals selected for these positions may eventually be required to report to the physical work location, noted above, upon adequate notification.

The Department of Innovation & Technology (DolT) is the state's IT agency delivering an enterprise approach to statewide technology, innovation and telecommunication services, as well as policy and standards development, lifecycle investment planning, and cybersecurity services. With over 1,500 employees, DolT delivers IT services and innovative solutions to customer agencies to improve services provided to Illinois residents, DolT offers employees the opportunity to advance their careers, develop new skills and reach their potential, both personally and professionally. DoIT is committed to promoting and preserving a workplace culture that embraces diversity and inclusion. We welcome and value employees with different backgrounds, life experiences and talents. It is the collective sum of our individual differences that provides a broad perspective, leading to greater innovation and achievement. In recruiting for our team, we recognize the unique contributions of each applicant regardless of culture, ethnicity, race, national origin, sex, gender identity and expression, age, religion, disability, and sexual orientation

Full Job Description

The Freedonia Group, a division of MarketResearch.com, is one of the leading global suppliers of off-the-shelf industrial research studies, specializing in plastics, chemicals, construction, industrial components, packaging and other topics. Located in Cleveland, Ohio, the company has been in business for over twenty-five years. In addition, The Freedonia Group’s industry market research is considered an authoritative source by the world’s leading publications and has been featured in nearly every relevant trade publication.

We are currently looking to hire a tech-related intern, to help provide remote and on-site support for our employees. The successful candidate will also gain a wide variety of hands-on experience in a multitude of areas.

Responsibilities:

· Remote and on-site support of end users in all company and remote locations.

· Support the Tech Team in maintaining hardware, software and other systems

· Organize and maintain IT Resources.

· Assist in maintenance of IT inventory and accessories

· Lend IT support in areas such as cybersecurity, programming, analytics, and data management

Requirements:

· Working towards or recently completed a degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or Management Information Systems (Or related)

· Minimum 3.0 GPA

· Familiar with Windows 10, Windows Server 2008 and newer, Desktop and Laptop hardware, and basics of wired and wireless networking

· Comport oneself in a professional manner at all times

· Strong verbal and written communication skills

· Strong problems-solving skills

· Ability to work in an isolated environment and in teams

· Strong worth ethic, discipline and attention to detail

Benefits

· Gain hands-on experience in an IT position that is both on-site AND remote.

· Opportunity to attend events and meetings with company management and executives

· Flexible schedule for students

· A chance to move the technology of a company from one site to another

· Compensation available

Besides the excellent learning opportunity, interns are welcome to participate in the day-to-day activities of Freedonia - including attending holiday parties, board-game nights, organized hikes, annual cooking competitions, etc.

Interns with The Freedonia Group will maintain a work schedule as determined by Freedonia and the intern. We are willing to work around school and activities schedules.

Full Job Description

Responsibilities

  • Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
  • Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
  • Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems
  • Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
  • Filter and "clean" data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems
  • Work with management to prioritize business and information needs
  • Locate and define new process improvement opportunities
  • Use Tableau to build and publish customized interactive reports, data visualizations, and executive level dashboards that are in support our development team operations
  • Take ownership and enhance existing tableau visualizations that our business is dependent on, such as road mapping and agile metrics dashboards.
  • Analyze and integrate complex data coming in from multiple disparate sources; Use SQL to create published data sources that enable you, your stakeholders, and internal customers to retrieve key data/metrics/reports.
  • Work closely and build relationships with data engineers in other teams in Tableau to communicate requirements and drive dependency completion.
  • Validate telemetry analysis with internal customers and power users
  • Draw insight from data and have the ability to visually present and communicate data, analyses, and findings orally and in writing.
  • Troubleshoot data issues with Tableau reports and dashboards.
  • Contribute to expanding the Tableau data science

Requirements

  • Understanding of data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
  • Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel or Python)
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
  • Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings
  • Background in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics

Full Job Description
Who We Are:
We reward shoppers for digitizing their shopping experience.

Our mission is to delight the world's shoppers with a free smartphone app that is easy, smart and fun.

Why Join the Fetch Family?

We make it better for users even when that's difficult for us

We empower people with information and trust

We challenge ideas, not people

We think bigger and keep building

We find ways to bring the fun to Fetch!

We're committed to building an empowered and inclusive community of innovative and passionate people. As a growing organization, we need team players who can go above and beyond their individual responsibilities to help our company build towards its vision. If you are a creative, hard-working, and fun-seeking person interested in working with a close-knit group of highly talented people, this is the right place for you.

Fetch Rewards is an equal employment opportunity employer.

The Role!

Fetch's next step in evolving the shopping experience will require a Cloud Engineer, Internship/Apprenticeship. You will build and improve the tools used at Fetch to deploy, manage and monitor highly performant cloud resources. Using Infrastructure as Code your team will improve the security, resiliency and scalability of Fetch's microservices. Success in this role requires the ability to take on challenging problems and design & develop an appropriate solution with limited assistance. (We seek interns that can work full time once the 3 month internship is complete!)
In your tool-bag

Familiarity with AWS or other cloud providers
Demonstrated success with functional or object-oriented programming. (Fetch is broadly language agnostic, but our existing IaC framework is a combination of Ansible and Python)
Experience building extendable applications/systems for internal engineering teams
Effective communication, strong listening and strategic thinking skills including the ability to translate and explain technical issues to non-technical team members.
Ability to learn quickly and apply learning to problems or activities.

You have experience with

Required: Modern cloud architecture (virtualization, databases, message queueing)
Developing and operating software applications (Python, boto3)
Infrastructure as Code (Ansible, CloudFormation, CDK)
Building highly available, scalable, fault-tolerant infrastructure

Bonus Points

Comfort with the use of a variety of programming languages and data stores (Python, Java, Go, MongoDB, Postgres, MySQL, Redis)
Experience managing highly available and scalable hosting solutions in a microservice environment
Undergraduate or graduate degree in computer science, engineering or mathematical field of study

Full Job Description

Experienced Backend Engineers and Data Engineers : Our company client has one of the most economically influential platforms to launch in 2021. We're Looking for (Fullstack) Backend Engineers and Data Engineers / Data Analysts living in the New Jersey or New York area.

COMPANY OVERVIEW: This is an economically sustainable on-demand platform, which was evaluated at $125 Million during Forbes Summit '2019. The platform had six offers up to $25 Million, PRE-revenue and Pre-Launch.

It will be the first economically sustainable on-demand platform to generate up to 20 streams of income and host seven markets that generate up to $900 Billion in revenue annually; profitable within a pandemic or recession.

Our Lead Engineer Advisor, S. Thomas Credentials: He Previously the lead backend security engineer for Venmo/Paypal. Lead the team in response to Venmo’s January 2018 scamming debacle. Currently the Lead Commerce Engineer at Spotify.

  • NJIT Master's Degree, Data Science, 4.0

Engineers (frontend or backend) MUST be fluent and experienced with using the following to build an APP; NO EXCEPTIONS.

  • Proficient in API Development
  • React Native (Frontend)
  • Django (Backend)
  • Github
  • AWS

Starting in June 1, 2021: This platform has a lot of data and visualization for geography, gps, sales, and more.

There are currently 6 engineers on the team working remotely, and 40 team members with advisors who are managers at Ernst & Young (NYC), Spotify, Venmo/Paypal, and Madison Square Garden.

Legal action may be taken if an applicant provides false information for interview or orientation; this includes but is not limited to their current living location. Full Job Description

About the Company:

Epiphany Management Group is GROWING! Epiphany Management Group is a fast-growing trusted technology partner delivering excellent service in the Health and Government sector. We are a multi-division company with fast growth on the immediate horizon. Our innovative management approach and focus make us very effective & unique in this market. Through technology we help improve outcomes, collaboration, management, and efficiency.

POSITION SUMMARY

Earn money and gain valuable business experience to boost your resume. The internship will center around Data & Analytics, specifically focused on Business Intelligence utilizing Microsoft Power BI. The selected candidate will work with the leadership team to achieve assigned project goals and deliverables including management reports and dashboards.

The candidate will gain exposure to business, get experience developing requirements, utilizing blends of data architecture and structure while building relationships and meeting project deadlines. Our business is focused on providing call center services for tier 1 technical support, so the data and the output you develop will center around writing scripts and queries to access and summarize call and agent data.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Includes, but is not limited to the following:

  • Codes application interfaces and data transfer mechanisms as required to support and integrate business applications.
  • Assists in the design of Power BI data models to deliver Business Intelligence reporting.
  • Writes scripts and queries for business applications, and/or ad-hoc data analysis.
  • Transform manual queries ad reports into daily generated reports and dashboards.
  • Interprets code to write user documentation

Required Qualifications:
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.

  • Some previous exposure to SQL and Power BI through either schooling or practical experience.
  • Current or previous enrollment in an accredited college or university obtaining a degree in Computer Science or related discipline.
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a larger team.
  • Demonstrate a high level of personal integrity and strong work ethic and ability to learn quickly.
  • Ability to present a clear, concise, visual message through data, both in summary and detail.
  • Orientation toward detail and thoroughness.
  • Excellent communication (verbal and written) and interpersonal skills.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • An understanding of transactional and data warehouse database design patterns.
  • Technical knowledge regarding data models, database design & development, data mining and analysis.
  • Familiarity with various database querying language, report development, presentation tools and techniques.
  • Working knowledge of data warehousing and analytic reporting and of the following tools, applications and programming language: SQL, Microsoft SQL Server Management Studio, Microsoft Power BI, ad Excel

Work Environment
This job operates in an office setting. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines.

position: Exciting PR Internship with Sports AI Startup - Fall 2021
description:
Full Job Description

Sparrow is an early-stage startup that uses artificial intelligence (AI) to help athletes improve.

We are offering a valuable Public Relations & Business Marketing Spring internship for a bright, motivated, resourceful college student or recent college graduate looking to learn the ins and outs of the startup, A.I., and sports worlds.

You’ll work closely with the company’s serial-entrepreneur CEO & core business marketing team to strategize and execute the 2021 Agenda and related Public Relations, including:

  • Sparrow's App Store Launch
  • Sparrow's upcoming Equity Crowdfunding Campaign
  • Email Marketing Campaigns
  • Social Media Presence
  • Public Relations
  • Influencer Outreach
  • And much more!

Person sought must:

  • Be a student at or a recent graduate of a reputable 4-year college, with either a business, communications or marketing related degree and/or experience
  • Be able to work an 8 hour work day (-40 hours per week) end of May through end of August 2021 or longer
  • Be uber-productive, able to switch between different kinds of tasks, and comfortable taking on all jobs complex or mundane.
  • Be experienced and comfortable using online tools like G Suite, email marketing platforms and social media outlets like Youtube, Instagram, and Twitter.
  • Be very detail-oriented and thoughtful when executing a task or initiative
  • Be able to figure out how things work, or how to get things done when a solution isn’t obvious or involves multiple steps or tools
  • Be someone excited to learn
  • Be able to outreach to other companies and professionals

This position represents a unique opportunity to:

  • Work closely with the company founders, successful serial entrepreneurs who have started numerous companies, raised over $20 million in venture capital for them, and have 2 successful exits. (check out our founders here: https://youtu.be/r82gufgzltg)
  • Gain Experience in the PR and Business Marketing Fields
  • Learn the ins-and-outs of running a startup with tremendous potential that is just getting started
  • Receive a $50 weekly stipend, college credit and potentially earn an equity bonus (stock options), and more importantly gain relationships in the tech, AI, and sports industry

Testimonials from Sparrow’s Intern Classes

* My time at Sparrow has been great! I’ve learned the ins and outs of what it takes to successfully run a business + gained valuable insight from the founders. -Gabriel R., Yale University (Men’s Varsity Golf, Econ)

* I was given real responsibilities while working alongside people who really exemplified what it means to be a part of a team. - Georgia L., Williams College (Women’s Varsity Soccer, Psych Major)

*I definitely feel as though I’m honing important skills and experience for when I enter the job market.” said the rising senior. - Abby E., Pomona College in CA (Women’s Varsity Golf, Psych Major)

*At Sparrow I assisted with fundraising rounds, analyzing consumer/user data & conceptualizing macro marketing schemes - experiences that will help me for years to come. - Nick S., USC (Business Major)

* I loved getting exposure into the fast paced start-up world - my internship with Sparrow was awesome!

- Rebecca R., Brown University (Women’s Varsity Soccer, Applied Math major)

* Interning at Sparrow was so valuable! I got to work with the founders and see first hand how a successful company is made! - Annie M, Lehigh (Womens’ Varsity Lacrosse, Business Major)

* My internship with Sparrow was great! I worked on an investment and PR project that contributed to the launch of the company. - Colette M., Columbia University (Women's Varsity Soccer)

** My internship with Sparrow was a valuable one. I worked closely with the co-founders & gained valuable insight into the inner workings of a great startup. - Adam X., Harvard University (Men’s Varsity Golf)

* I worked with an expert machine learning advisor, got my name on a patent and had an all around amazing experience with Sparrow! Trevor J., University of Michigan (Computer Science Major)

Job Types: Full-time, Internship

Pay: $50.00 per week

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Education:

  • High school or equivalent (Required)

Experience:

  • Social media management: 1 year (Preferred)
  • Public relations: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location:

  • Fully Remote

Full Job Description
This position allows college students to gain real world experience in a field while collaborating with their studies. As the job progresses the individual will be allowed more freedom and responsibility which could lead to a full-time position upon completion of the internship.

Job-shadow various employees in assigned department.
Assist with assigned duties.
Ask questions and offer input when supervisors deal with more complex problems.
Learn and understand any regulations related to departmental tasks.
Help department stay abreast of latest developments in the field and in any changes related to educational practices.

Education:
Electronics or Computer Science field of study is essential for this role

Itron is an Equal Opportunity, Affirmative Action Employer. Qualified applicants are considered without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, citizenship, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, medical condition, veteran status, disability, genetic information, gender identity or other characteristics protected by law. If you require an accommodation in order to apply to this position, please contact your local recruiting representative at 1-800-635-5461 or email Accessibility@itron.com.

Itron enables utilities and cities to safely, securely and reliably deliver critical infrastructure services to communities in more than 100 countries. Our portfolio of smart networks, software, services, meters and sensors helps our customers better manage electricity, gas and water resources for the people they serve. By working with our customers to ensure their success, we help improve the quality of life, ensure the safety and promote the well-being of millions of people around the globe. Itron is dedicated to creating a more resourceful world. Join us: www.itron.com.

Flexible schedule.

Full Job Description
at Rivian Automotive
United States, Illinois, Normal

Rivian is on a mission to keep the world adventurous forever. This goes for the emissions-free Electric Adventure Vehicles we build, and the curious, courageous souls we seek to attract.

As a company, we constantly challenge what’s possible, never simply accepting what has always been done. We reframe old problems, seek new solutions and operate comfortably in areas that are unknown. Our backgrounds are diverse, but our team shares a love of the outdoors and a desire to protect it for future generations.

We operate development centers in Plymouth, Michigan; Southern California (Irvine, Carson & LA); Silicon Valley (San Jose and Palo Alto); Vancouver, British Columbia; and Surrey, England; as well as a manufacturing facility in Normal, Illinois.

Disclaimer: Applying to this requisition will place you into consideration for an internship on our Manufacturing Engineering team. Exact Team Allocation will be discussed during the hiring process.

Internship Term: Fall 2021
Rivian internships are experiences optimized for student candidates. To be eligible, you must be an undergraduate or graduate student in an accredited program during the internship term. If you are not pursuing a degree, please see our full time positions at Rivian.com/careers

The Financial Management System for California (FI$Cal) is seeking an undergraduate or graduate student intern to support the implementation of the FI$Cal system, a billion-dollar statewide project.

The student would work within the Project Management Division and report to the Governance and Reporting Manager. The student will work with a variety of teams and staff in the Project Management Office, including the Governance, Schedule and Quality and Testing units. The student will support and be responsible for work activities and products within these given areas.

Conditions of Employment

This is a part-time, temporary, non-benefited, student position. Employment in all positions with University Enterprises, Inc. is dependent upon the mutual consent of University Enterprises, Inc. and the employee. This means that either University Enterprises, Inc. or the employee can, at any time, terminate the employment relationship at will, with or without cause.

UEI is not a multi-state employer. UEI only employs candidates who live and work in the state of California. If selected for the position you must reside in California and all worked must be performed in the state of California.

Depending on the type of position you are applying for, a pre-employment background check consisting of one or more of the following may be conducted, employment history, professional references, criminal check, educational verification (i.e., degree, license, or official transcript) and physical exam and drug urinalysis test. Applicants will be required to pass required pre-employment checks to the satisfaction of University Enterprises Inc., (UEI) and the hiring Agency or Department.

Work Schedule

Flexible, Monday through Friday from 8:00am to 5:00pm. Final schedule will be determined by the supervisor.

  • Due to COVID-19, student will be required to work according to the current UEI remote workplace policy and sign a UEI telework agreement.
Additional Work Schedule

Student Assistant and Graduate Assistant employees generally work up to 20 hours per work week (Sunday – Saturday) during the academic year and up to 40 hours per work week during breaks; Winter, Spring & Summer.

Area Sacramento
On/Off Sacramento State Campus Off Campus
Worksite City Sacramento, CA

FI$Cal enables the State of California to combine accounting, budgeting, cash management, and procurement operations into a single financial management system. This eliminates the need for hundreds of independent legacy systems and state-entity- specific applications that support the state’s internal financial management operations.

To learn more about FISCAL please visit their website at www.fiscal.ca.gov.

Value Proposition:
Our values define us and our culture inspires us to change lives for the better. Our employees are the heart and soul of our company and every success we experience begins with them. Our Internship Development program is designed to provide Interns with real-world experience in the banking and financial services industry. An internship with Fulton Bank provides opportunity to explore a career path that matches your interests, while helping you gain valuable insights into the working life at Fulton Bank. Under close supervision with a designated Supervisor, you will be responsible for observing the policies and procedures within a specific area/department of the Bank, while acquiring knowledge through on-the-job training and building essential skills.

In addition, you will have the opportunity to build your professional network, engage in professional development opportunities, and participate in a variety of team-based activities and Fulton Bank events or initiatives. No matter the location of your internship, we will give you the tools to succeed in a real-world setting!

POSITION HIGHLIGHTS:

Verstand AI (www.verstand.ai) is seeking interns with an interest in building custom data product and artificial intelligence solutions for clients in the financial services industry. Armed with knowledge of data science applications and machine learning algorithms, the machine learning intern will be instrumental in building high quality datasets to fine tuning models (building and retraining models) for maximizing performance. Along with the management of cloud environments,
Verstand interns will be responsible for ensuring data quality, scoring and evaluation of models, and continuous model operations. Additionally, support will be handed to Data Engineers to build ETL pipelines and BI Designers to design visualizations and dashboards. Knowledge of capital markets and trading strategies an advantage.

Most importantly, Verstand AI's interns will get an opportunity to work with cutting edge technologies and be part of data teams that help clients harness the power of artificial intelligence. Verstand’s interns will shape and build efficient and self-learning applications.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Work with product owners, data engineers, and BI designers to understand product requirements, data needs, and model design
  • Acquire data and build custom datasets using web-scraping or NLP tools
  • Perform data analysis on large structured or unstructured datasets, using machine learning to enrich data features and data quality
  • Design and build data extraction, transformation, and loading processes by writing custom data pipelines
  • Design, implement and support platforms that can provide ad-hoc access to large datasets and unstructured data
  • Perform model parameter and hyperparameter fine tuning to optimize model learn rates and maximize model performance
  • Participate in feature engineering planning sessions
  • Develop multiple model scoring and evaluation methodologies
  • Design visualizations and dashboards for reporting and rich storytelling

JOB REQUIREMENTS:

Minimum Experience, Skills and Education:

  • Knowledge of machine learning algorithms, their application for problem solving and MLOps
  • Strong Python, Java, R and SQL skills with understanding of software development
  • Deep knowledge of math, probability, and statistics
  • Experience with cloud platforms such as Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, or Google Could Platform (GCP)
  • Working knowledge of Python Machine Learning libraries (SciKit Learn, TensorFlow, Pytorch, Keras)
  • Experience with base level data Python libraries (Pandas, NumPy, SciPy, Scapy, NLTK)
  • Working knowledge of scoring and evaluating machine learning models
  • Working knowledge of ETL pipelines and data ingestion methodology
  • Working knowledge of data visualization tools such as Power BI, Looker and Tableau
  • Effective written/spoken communication skills and strong problem-solving skills
  • Currently enrolled in Bachelor's degree from four-year College or university in Computer Science, Data Science or related field

Experience That Sets You Apart:

  • Experience with capital markets, time series analysis, trading strategies and algorithms
  • Experience and interest in ESG reporting, data points, and standards

Verstand AI is a fast-growing firm that believes in ongoing training and development for its staff. The firm's mission is to help both its commercial and public sector clients resolve data management challenges and move to delivering insight and benefits for stakeholders, customers and constituents.

Based out of Tysons Corner, VA, Verstand does business across the United States and is moving into Europe and Asia. If you're interested in working with us and have a desire to tackle challenging data problems, we welcome your interest and encourage you to apply.

position: Intern - MAGNet Program @ University of Georgia (Fall 2021)
description:
Full Job Description
Overview:
Intern- MAGNet Program @ University of Georgia (Fall 2021)

State Farm has developed a unique internship opportunity for graduate students at the University of Georgia (UGA) - the Modeling and Analytics Graduate Network (MAGNet). MAGNet interns apply their statistical modeling and analytic skills to a wide variety of business problems faced by the State Farm organization.

Most MAGNet interns are graduate students in the Statistics Department, but graduate students in other highly quantitative disciplines may also be considered. While participating in the MAGNet program, students are evaluated and given consideration for full time, post-graduate employment at various State Farm locations: Atlanta, GA; Bloomington, IL; Dallas, TX; or Champaign, IL.

MAGNet interns apply their predictive modeling and data analysis skills to a variety of data science problems, in many different lines of business and departments (e.g., marketing, insurance, and process optimization) including:
  • Pricing and Underwriting Risk Predictive Modeling
  • Claims Automation Predictive Modeling
  • Sales/Growth Forecasting, Econometric and Predictive Modeling
  • Data mining applications for Claims and Competitive Analysis
  • Evaluating new statistical methods and tools for potential use by State Farm data scientists
Responsibilities:
What You Can Expect:
  • Logistics:
During Fall Semester, MAGNet interns work 20 hours a week
Duration: Fall Semester (8/18/2021 to 12/8/2021)
Convenient location: Downtown Athens, just a block off UGA's main campus

  • Experience:
Direct experience you can leverage for your future career
An opportunity to learn and network with industry-leading influencers
A learning environment: mentoring and development to help you succeed
A culture that embraces Diversity and Inclusion

Qualifications:
We Are Looking For:
Applicants accepted to or currently enrolled in one of the following graduate programs at UGA:
Statistics
Mathematics
Computer Science
Epidemiology & Biostatistics
Economics

Applicants with experience in:
Statistical modeling and/or data mining
Data analysis and database tools
Computer programming (specifically Python, SAS, or R)
Communicating and presenting technical work

What’s In It For You:
MAGNet is similar to a 50% graduate assistantship offered by the University. Interns receive hourly pay comparable to that offered by the University for graduate assistants as well as full tuition assistance for the duration of the internship. Some State Farm benefits may also apply, including the following:

  • 401k Eligible
  • Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance
  • Paid Time-Off, including specific leave for community service
****Applicants are required to be eligible to lawfully work in the U.S. immediately; employer will not sponsor applicants for U.S. work authorization (e.g. H-1B visa) for this opportunity*****

Software AG is looking for ambitious, energetic, and motivated students or recent graduates looking to apply what they’ve learned in Information Technology, business, sales, and or project management as a Business Value Engineering (BVE) intern in our Reston, VA or Denver, CO office.

The role will provide a unique and exciting opportunity to start a career in Enterprise Software supporting some of the most advanced and industry leading technologies in the world.

This internship will be a 3-6 month part-time opportunity to grow and master your key analytical, sales, & project management skills - helping the North American Presales organization at Software AG.

Due to current circumstances, the internship will start out remotely and you will not be required to go into the office.

What you get to do each day:
Learn the Software AG suite of software including ARIS, webMethods Integration and Cumulocity IoT

Be a member of a collaborative team working on customer facing business cases, financial analysis, and other sales BVE related activities.
Work on quantification of business value delivered through our software solutions in Excel models.
Build out ARIS process models that capture our customers Goals, Key Business Requirements, impediments and solutions.

We have an open-minded culture and many exciting projects where you have the freedom to “be your best you”. We are in an innovative market and offer future-proof products. Most importantly, an overall a pleasant team-oriented working atmosphere.

Full Job Description
About Monarch:
At Monarch, we are leading the digital transformation of farming. Monarch Tractor augments both muscle and mind with fully loaded hardware, software, and service machinery that will spur future generations of farming technologies.

With our farmer-first mentality, we are building a smart tractor that will enhance (not replace) the existing farm ecosystem, alleviate labor availability, and cost issues, and provide an avenue for competitive organic and beyond farming by providing mechanical solutions to replace harmful chemical solutions. Despite all the cutting-edge technology we will incorporate, our tractor will still plow, till, and haul better than any other tractor in its class. We have all the necessary ingredients to develop, build and scale the Monarch Tractor to digitally transform farming around the world.

Job Description

As a Network Engineer Intern, you will have hands-on experience in our company's computer network maintenance. You will need to be comfortable in a fast-paced startup environment where collaborating across various teams is expected. The ideal candidate would have knowledge of hardware, and software infrastructure protocols. You will also need to be able to implement, administer, and troubleshoot network devices, firewalls, and routers. Above all, we're looking for someone who's creative and has a can-do attitude, a lot of grit, and a sense of fun.

Network Engineer Responsibilities:
Maintain our company's computer networks, hardware, software, and other related systems.

Contribute to the development of the communication systems within our products, including vehicles, base stations and repeaters.

Implement advanced network configurations including VPNs, routing rules, QoS rules, tunnels, port forwarding, Etc.

Implement network security, including configuring firewalls, mac filters, Etc.

Create accurate network diagrams and documentation for design and planning of wired and wireless communication systems.

Provide field testing and benchmarks on our communication bandwidths/coverage.

Troubleshooting and resolving network and connectivity issues.

Identify production cost saving solutions on communication components, including routers, switches, radios, access points and antennas.

Additional responsibilities and tasks as needed.

Preferred Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in information technology related field of study with a network engineering focus.

CCNA certifications, including routing and switching, security, cloud, wireless, Etc.

Strong understanding of network infrastructure and network hardware.

Strong understanding of RF engineering, antenna specifications, Etc.

Ability to implement, administer, and troubleshoot network infrastructure devices, including wireless access points, firewall, routers and radios.

Ability to quickly learn new or unfamiliar technology and products using documentation and internet resources.

Ability to work with all levels of staff within and outside of IT and outside the organization.

A self-starter able to work independently but comfortable working in a team environment.

Good analytical and problem-solving skills.

Dependable and flexible when necessary.

Network security experience.

What you'll get:
At Monarch Tractor, you'll play a key role on a capable, dedicated, high-performing team of rock stars. This role offers a total immersion into a busy tech startup culture. A successful candidate may work closely with customers, collaborate with engineers, developers, and designers, to learn more about deploying a highly innovative product in the Agtech environment.

In addition to building outstanding products, we're building an outstanding company with culture to match. Part of what we do is be in our element, which means being on the farm. We will be spending lots of time in Napa, Sonoma, Monterey, and the central coast of California—perfecting our craft, mastering our environment, building our team camaraderie, and also taking time to enjoy the fruits of our labor.

At Monarch, we cherish and celebrate every individual's difference. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, gender identity, veteran status, and disability, or another legally protected status.

LOCATION: Remote and/or Tysons Corner, VA

POSITION HIGHLIGHTS:

Verstand AI (www.verstand.ai) is seeking interns with an interest in building custom data product and artificial intelligence solutions for clients in the financial services industry. Armed with knowledge of data science applications and machine learning algorithms, the machine learning intern will be instrumental in building high quality datasets to fine tuning models (building and retraining models) for maximizing performance. Along with the management of cloud environments,
Verstand interns will be responsible for ensuring data quality, scoring and evaluation of models, and continuous model operations. Additionally, support will be handed to Data Engineers to build ETL pipelines and BI Designers to design visualizations and dashboards. Knowledge of capital markets and trading strategies an advantage.

Most importantly, Verstand AI's interns will get an opportunity to work with cutting edge technologies and be part of data teams that help clients harness the power of artificial intelligence. Verstand’s interns will shape and build efficient and self-learning applications.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Work with product owners, data engineers, and BI designers to understand product requirements, data needs, and model design
  • Acquire data and build custom datasets using web-scraping or NLP tools
  • Perform data analysis on large structured or unstructured datasets, using machine learning to enrich data features and data quality
  • Design and build data extraction, transformation, and loading processes by writing custom data pipelines
  • Design, implement and support platforms that can provide ad-hoc access to large datasets and unstructured data
  • Perform model parameter and hyperparameter fine tuning to optimize model learn rates and maximize model performance
  • Participate in feature engineering planning sessions
  • Develop multiple model scoring and evaluation methodologies
  • Design visualizations and dashboards for reporting and rich storytelling

JOB REQUIREMENTS:

Minimum Experience, Skills and Education:

  • Knowledge of machine learning algorithms, their application for problem solving and MLOps
  • Strong Python, Java, R and SQL skills with understanding of software development
  • Deep knowledge of math, probability, and statistics
  • Experience with cloud platforms such as Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, or Google Could Platform (GCP)
  • Working knowledge of Python Machine Learning libraries (SciKit Learn, TensorFlow, Pytorch, Keras)
  • Experience with base level data Python libraries (Pandas, NumPy, SciPy, Scapy, NLTK)
  • Working knowledge of scoring and evaluating machine learning models
  • Working knowledge of ETL pipelines and data ingestion methodology
  • Working knowledge of data visualization tools such as Power BI, Looker and Tableau
  • Effective written/spoken communication skills and strong problem-solving skills
  • Currently enrolled in Bachelor's degree from four-year College or university in Computer Science, Data Science or related field

Experience That Sets You Apart:

  • Experience with capital markets, time series analysis, trading strategies and algorithms
  • Experience and interest in ESG reporting, data points, and standards

Verstand AI is a fast-growing firm that believes in ongoing training and development for its staff. The firm's mission is to help both its commercial and public sector clients resolve data management challenges and move to delivering insight and benefits for stakeholders, customers and constituents.

Based out of Tysons Corner, VA, Verstand does business across the United States and is moving into Europe and Asia. If you're interested in working with us and have a desire to tackle challenging data problems, we welcome your interest and encourage you to apply.

Full Job Description
The National Security Agency (NSA) Science of Security (SoS) Summer Internship Program offers paid research internship opportunities for undergraduate and graduate-level university students pursuing STEM degrees. The 12-week program starting mid-May/June offers interns the opportunity to gain hands-on experience working with full-time NSA researchers on innovative cybersecurity research and technology. NSA/CSS Research Directorate (RES) is home to a highly technical and talented workforce that performs cutting-edge research and creates breakthroughs in mathematics, computer science, engineering, cybersecurity, physics, neuroscience, and linguistics that lead to creative solutions to NSA's most challenging problems.

At the end of the intern's tour, they will provide a presentation of their work to their fellow interns and researchers.

The NSA facilities are located in and around Fort Meade, Maryland.

Job Summary

The National Security Agency (NSA) Science of Security (SoS) Summer Internship Program offers paid research internship opportunities for undergraduate and graduate-level university students pursuing STEM degrees. The 12-week program starting mid-May/June offers interns the opportunity to gain hands-on experience working with full-time NSA researchers on innovative cybersecurity research and technology. NSA/CSS Research Directorate (RES) is home to a highly technical and talented workforce that performs cutting-edge research and creates breakthroughs in mathematics, computer science, engineering, cybersecurity, physics, neuroscience, and linguistics that lead to creative solutions to NSA's most challenging problems.

Qualifications

' Must be a U.S. citizen.
' Must be eligible to be granted a security clearance.
' Must be available for an operational interview and other applicable processing between the months of November 2021 and March 2022.
' Applicants should have demonstrated superior STEM aptitude and problem-solving skills. Evidence of successful work on an independent STEM project is desirable. Applicants may be at any stage in their undergraduate or graduate careers and working, or intending to work, in any STEM area.
' Desired majors include, but not restricted to, computer science, cybersecurity, engineering, information technology, mathematics, and psychology.

Pay, Benefits, & Work Schedule

  • Students are paid a competitive salary commensurate with their education level.
  • Receive annual leave, sick leave and paid federal holidays.
  • Participation in agency-wide extracurricular programs.
  • Students who attend schools in excess of 75 miles from Ft. Meade, MD, are eligible for a round trip airfare ticket to and from school or mileage reimbursement up to the cost of a government-issued airline ticket.
  • Daily transportation to and from work is not provided. Students participating in the program are highly encouraged to bring a vehicle. Carpooling with other students MAY be available but NOT guaranteed.
  • Subsidized housing accommodations are available upon request if school is located in excess of 75 miles from NSA main HQs campus.
How to apply

Submit an online application on or before 31 October 2021.

Send an applicant package to sos.research@nsa.gov; you will receive an email confirmation upon receipt.

Applicant packages should include:
' Resume,
' One page essay on the applicant research experience and/or interests,
' Most recent transcript(s) that show academic performance - Unofficial copies are accepted, and
' A letter of recommendation (LOR) from a faculty member or research mentor who can speak to your research experience/background (LORs attached to the application package or sent directly from the recommender to sos.research@nsa.gov are accepted).

Early Acceptance Incentive;
The application period runs until 31 October 2021. However, the Agency will determine selections for early acceptance into the program on a rolling basis throughout the application period and anticipates filling approximately 1/3 of the available positions prior to the closing of the application period.

If you have questions about the Science of Security Intern Program, please contact us at the email address above or call 1-844-ICHIRES. You may also e-mail Summer_Interns@nsa.gov for application questions.

***PLEASE NOTE:
U.S. Citizenship is required for all applicants. Reasonable accommodations provided to applicants with disabilities during the application and hiring process where appropriate. NSA is an equal opportunity employer and abides by applicable employment laws and regulations. All applicants and employees are subject to random drug testing in accordance with Executive Order 12564. Employment is contingent upon successful completion of a security background investigation and polygraph.

This position is a Defense Civilian Intelligence Personnel System (DCIPS) position in the Excepted Service under 10 U.S.C. 1601. DoD Components with DCIPS positions apply Veterans' Preference to eligible candidates as defined by Section 2108 of Title 5 USC, in accordance with the procedures provided in DoD Instruction 1400.25, Volume 2005, DCIPS Employment and Placement. If you are a veteran claiming veterans' preference, as defined by Section 2108 of Title 5 U.S.C., you may be asked to submit documents verifying your eligibility.

DCIPS Disclaimer

The National Security Agency (NSA) is part of the DoD Intelligence Community Defense Civilian Intelligence Personnel System (DCIPS). All positions in the NSA are in the Excepted Services under 10 United States Codes (USC) 1601 appointment authority.

SUMMARY

Ansys empowers the world's most innovative companies to design and deliver transformational products by offering the best and broadest engineering simulation software to solve the most complex design challenges and engineer products limited only by imagination. Thus, through our enriching internship program, we help develop the next-generation of engineers and technologists. Must be a Junior or Senior in Computer Science or a related major, currently enrolled in a full-time degree program and maintaining a GPA of 3.0 or higher.

Excellent written and verbal communication
Team player, responsible, and motivated

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS

Additional experience applying machine learning and artificial intelligence algorithms, TensorFlow, and Tesseract to the solution of data extraction problems is a plus.

CULTURE AND VALUES
Culture and values are incredibly important to Ansys. They inform us of who we are, of how we act. Values aren't posters hanging on a wall or about trite or glib slogans. They aren't about rules and regulations. They can't just be handed down the organization. They are shared beliefs - guideposts that we all follow when we're facing a challenge or a decision. Customer focus

Innovation

Mastery
Inclusiveness

With the prestigious reputation in servicing well-known, world-class companies, standards at Ansys are high, met by those willing to rise to the occasion and meet those challenges head-on. Because at Ansys, it's about the learning, the discovery and the collaboration. It's about the "what's next" as much as the "mission accomplished". It's about the melding of disciplined intellect with strategic direction and results that have, can and will impact real people in real ways, forged within a working environment built on respect, autonomy and ethics.

At Ansys, you will find yourself among those eager to drive the world towards the next best thing with hands planted firmly on the wheel.
Our team is passionate about pushing the limits of world-class simulation technology so our customers can turn their design concepts into successful, innovative products faster and at lower cost. As a measure of our success in attaining these goals, Ansys has been recognized as one of the world's most innovative companies by prestigious publications such as Bloomberg Businessweek and FORTUNE magazines.

Ansys is an S&P 500 company and a component of the NASDAQ-100.

Job Description

Company Information

Smarter Grid Solutions (SGS) is a fast-growing technology company that delivers products and services to enable utilities and developers to integrate distributed and renewable energy resources into our electric grid. Our unique Active Network Management (ANM) technology is the only technology of its kind to provide real-time, autonomous control of distributed energy resources, and is the result of over ten years of developing, deploying and proving this unique approach to managing the Smart Grid.

Overview

SGS is seeking a Software Analytics Intern to join our smart grid analytics team. The team is responsible for developing practical paths to operationalizing advanced power systems analytics; this could be battery optimization techniques, ML-based forecasting, or integration with advanced network-model based approaches based on load flow, optimal power flow, or state estimation. All of these power systems techniques can be used to help manage the grid more optimally and pave the way for deeper de-carbonization.

We are looking for a highly motivated student or graduate with excellent software development skills to help build out our analytical capabilities. In this group, you will sit between the world of software development, power systems, and advanced analytics. Your focus will be on helping develop and test software frameworks that give us and our customers confidence that these complex analytics can be safely operationalized. You will be involved in end-to-end software development in a multi-disciplinary environment.

Qualifying Criteria

**Please note we cannot consider applications from candidates who do not meet these criteria.**

You must be either a NY State resident attending or having attended any college or university, regardless of location, within the last 12 months

or

an out of state student, attending or having attended a College or university located in New York State within the last 12 months.

Required Skills

· Strong academic track record in Electrical/Electronic Engineering, Computer Science, or similar

· Familiarity with high-level power and energy systems concepts

· Solid experience in modern analytics-friendly languages like Python, Scala, or R

Desired Skills

There are a number of additional desirable attributes that would complement the required skillset:

  • An understanding of power systems analysis
  • Optimization using AMPL, GAMS, or similar
  • AI and ML techniques
  • First principles understanding of algorithms, data structures, and time/space complexity

Anticipated Start Date: Summer 2021.

Duration: Minimum of 6 months.

Salary: Competitive

Location: New York

Pay: $17.00 per hour
