Custom Computer Specialists is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other protected characteristic.

Full Job Description
Rapid7 is a leading provider of security data and analytics solutions that enable organizations to implement an active, analytics-driven approach to cyber security. We combine our extensive experience in security data and analytics and deep insight into attacker behaviors and techniques to make sense of the wealth of data available to organizations about their IT environments and users. Our solutions empower organizations to prevent attacks by providing visibility into vulnerabilities and to rapidly detect compromises, respond to breaches, and correct the underlying causes of attacks. Rapid7 is trusted by more than 9000 organizations across the globe, including 48% of the Fortune 100. To learn more about Rapid7 or get involved in our threat research, visit www.rapid7.com.

Role Overview

Rapid7 is seeking a Data Engineering intern to join the Business Intelligence team. The intern will work closely with data engineers, data scientists and business stakeholders to deliver on key data engineering projects. The intern will work across Rapid7's data engineering tech stack of Snowflake, Airflow, AWS, Fivetran and Tableau to deliver data-models, ETL pipelines and data infrastructure. The ideal candidate has experience working with databases, modeling data and developing high quality code, as well as strong communications skills and an attention to detail.

Essential Responsibilities

Build highly scalable data pipelines that power key business analysis and metrics using SQL, Python, Javascript and Airflow.

Write efficient queries to transform raw data sources into easily accessible models for our teams and reporting platforms

Perform data profiling and exploration on new data sources

Develop data-models to support projects from data analysts, data scientists and business stakeholders

Implement unit-testing, SLA-testing and statistical testing frameworks

Assist with the monitoring and development of data infrastructure

Communicate results and ideas to key stakeholders

Qualifications:
Candidate for Bachelor or Master Course in Computer Science, Analytics, Engineering or other related field.

Strong written and verbal communication skills

Highly collaborative in working teammates and stakeholders

Experience working with relational databases (Snowflake, Redshift, BiqQuery, Postgres, MySQL etc.) and SQL

Proficiency in one scripting language such as Python, R, Ruby etc.

Experience with version control systems such as Git

Experience working with a major cloud provider such as AWS, Azure or GCP

Proficiency in data-modeling concepts such as dimensional,, normalization/denormalization and their application

Working knowledge of data architecture, data warehousing, and metadata management

Full Job Description
We are looking for AI/ML software interns to participate in building industry-leading AI computing accelerating engine and platform, developing the most cutting–edge artificial intelligence and applied machine learning systems and infrastructures which combine inference and training software and hardware to apply in the AI datacenters and clusters.

We focus on managing and optimizing artificial intelligence and machine learning algorithms and workloads (for Cloud Computing, Search, Ads, News Feed, Autonomous Driving, Photos, Computer Vision, Speech, NLP, etc), improving computing efficiency and utilization, optimizing performance, identifying next generation AI computing-systems and platform design.

Responsibilities

Participate in large-scale AI heterogeneous computing cluster/platform design and acceleration

Participate in AI workload performance acceleration, including profiling, analyzing, tuning, and optimization on GPU

Participate in software and hardware co-design to optimize AI/ML workload performance using heterogenous AI accelerators and to increase accelerator device utilizations

Qualifications

Currently pursuing a MS or PhD Degree in Computer Science/Computer Engineering related Machine Learning field

Understanding on Computer System and Architecture, Operating System, Parallel Computing, Distributed Tracing

Familiar with AI/ML algorithm and at least one of the major frameworks (Tensorflow, Pytorch, PaddlePaddle, MXNet, etc.)

Familiar with heterogenous computing performance profiling tools and analyzing methods, including AI model, framework, CUDA library, GPU kernel and hardware

Experience with DL workload programming & optimization on various hardware accelerators, as GPU/ASIC/FPGA/ ARM-GPU

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills

Culture Fit:
Mission alignment: If you want to be part of a team to accomplish this great mission, we will provide you the best possible platform to do that.

Self­-directed: We work best with people that are driven, motivated, and aspire to greatness. Are you the sort of person that, if you had time on your hands, will independently find interesting and useful things to do?

Hungry to learn: We are eager to see you learn new skills and grow. But learning is hard work and this is something we hope you want to do.

Team orientation: We work in small, fast­-moving teams. We don't believe in lone wolves. We watch out for each other and go after big goals together as a team

description:

Imagine New Horizons.

The 3DExperience Platform Server team is responsible for the qualification and industrialization of kernel, Server, Exalead Search and File Collaboration Server.

We build functions that are enablers for all of upstream Application products.

Do you enjoy challenges? Do you have dreams? Here at Dassault Systèmes, we empower people with passion to change the world. Shape your career with3DS! #WeAre3DS

Activities include, but are not limited to working within the Quality Engineering team:

Creating and building new automation scripts using Java for 3D Experience Platform server and Search components
Building new API level tests to validate and qualify the Search component
Providing support to the team on day to day activities within the industrialization team
Performing Quality Engineering functional and Performance level validation for 3DExperience Platform

Researching and gathering documentation, incorporate some of new test automation tools within the Quality organization.
Working with QE team and learn to build strong technical skills and be part of new software development projects.

The Challenges Ahead

Learn to work in a fast-paced environment, handling multiple tasks and assignments.
Ability to work effectively both in a collaborative team structure and independently.
Contribute towards Design and implementation of new Test strategy and work towards the overall objectives of the team.
Interact with other teams such as Development, Product Definition, Release Engineering and Documentation.
Ability to handle frequent design and requirement changes during development cycles

Your Key Success Factors

Minimum GPA 3.0
Exhibits proficiency in programming languages such as Java and Python

Strong analytical problem solving and debugging skills.

Possesses strong communication skills in English, both orally and in writing.

Full Job Description
Meet MedPro Group. We’re an industry-leading Berkshire Hathaway insurance company with a passion for our clients and our team. We are hundreds of professionals with varied backgrounds and experience levels who came together to achieve one goal: protecting those who have made it their mission to serve and care for others. Never considered the insurance industry before? We think you should.

In this role, you will…

Develop and support the implementation of configurations in Duck Creek Suite Distribution Management and integrations with other applications
Plan, execute, and document unit testing.
Participate in peer reviews.
Support the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and participate in the development sprints.
Develop and support Proof of Concept (POC) projects as required.
Provide product support and maintenance for products in production.
Participate in developing documentation and job aid documents.

We are looking for candidates with…

A minimum of a sophomore in college pursuing a BS degree, with a 3.0 or better GPA.
A computer science related major.
Year round availability: part-time up to 20 hours during school, full-time during summer if not taking classes.
Experience with XML, XSLT, XPath and JSON.
Experience in development with the Java programming language and an Integrated Development Environment (i.e. Eclipse).
Experience with SQL Database queries and stored procedures.
Experience with SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) is preferred.
Experience with Azure or AWS hosted Cloud environments and Web Services is preferred.
Experience with a version control management system (i.e. Git) is preferred.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
Excellent organizational, leadership and communication (verbal and written) skills.
Ability to work effectively in a team environment or independently.
Proficient in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
Authorization to work in the United States without requiring visa sponsorship, both now and in the future.

Why MedPro?
MedPro Group’s mission is built on a century-old legacy of protecting those who protect others. From our roots in our hometown of Fort Wayne, Indiana, we've worked diligently to become the nation's premier healthcare liability coverage provider, currently insuring more than 300,000 customers. With that growth, we've built a significant presence in all 50 states and internationally. Our team works across the country to provide the best strategies to mitigate risk and preserve the reputations of those who have entrusted their good name to us. That passion – built on a foundation of a culture that values uncompromised integrity, obsessive client focus, great teamwork, and a long-term mindset – make MedPro a preferred employer that many call their career home.

position: Solutions Engineer Intern - San Mateo, CA
description:
Full Job Description
About Verkada
At Verkada, we’re rethinking what it means to be physically safe. Today, we build security cameras that detect action, identify danger and help keep people and places safe and secure. Using a combination of software and hardware, we’re transforming an industry that has seen little innovation for decades—and we already support thousands of customers. But this is just the beginning. We envision a world in which security systems feel as seamless and modern as the organizations they protect and our enterprise solution becomes a model for not just business security, but public security as well.

Verkada is seeking Solutions Engineer Interns, based in San Mateo, CA, to own and enhance the customer experience, from the proof-of-concept to the final decision. This individual will provide technical support to the sales team, become a trusted advisor to customers, assist the sales team in designing security systems and quotes, and create solutions for unique customer challenges. You will join a team of highly motivated people delivering impactful results for the company. We are looking primarily for people who can match our fast pace and learn quickly, but prior experience with video security systems, IoT devices and access control systems is certainly helpful.

Responsibilities:
Work alongside Solutions Engineers to design and deliver technical solutions for our customers and key stakeholders
Collaborate with Engineering and Product teams to test new products and identify bugs
Communicate complex technical matters both verbally and written
Influence product direction with your unique understanding of customer needs
Prepare required project documentation (floorplans, scope of work, assumptions, etc.)
Research and document hybrid cloud security trends in the industry which includes IoT, networking, and cybersecurity

Qualifications:
Third or Fourth year college student working towards a Bachelor's or Master’s degree in a related discipline: Networking, Telecommunications, Systems Administration, Information technology, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Cybersecurity
Strong background in IT fundamentals: Experience with TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, and routing/switching devices; No experience with products related to physical security or cloud-based video necessary: we can teach you
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills in order to clearly and efficiently articulate technical matters with customers and partners
Excellent time management, follow-through, and attention to detail
Experience working with APIs, Python, and other coding languages is a plus
Experience working with Linux operating systems preferred
Genuine excitement for software and hardware products and can speak comfortably about how they work
Entrepreneurial and positive attitude with a strong desire to learn
Industry certifications are a plus: AWS, CCNA, MCSE, CEH, Security+, A+, Network+
Must be authorized to work in the U.S (Position does not provide sponsorship)
About our team
Behind the scenes, we’re a team of computer scientists, hardware engineers and experienced founders who saw a chance to make a real impact. We’re united by the challenge of building beautiful products, designed for real people—and by our commitment to using technology responsibly. We believe keeping data private and secure is core to our safety as individuals, businesses and communities and we put great care into building systems that embody our values as people. Likewise, many of Silicon Valley’s top investors believe in us: we’re backed by Sequoia Capital, FirstRound, Meritech and Siemens (Next47).

Verkada is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status, and encourage all qualified applicants to apply.

Full Job Description
Ocient is searching for Software Engineers with strong problem-solving skills and a passion for computer science to help build and test the next generation OLAP database system. You will work closely with some of Chicago's most talented software engineers to solve complex problems involving distributed systems, query optimization, metadata storage, web services, and more.

We are offering an internship (Winter 2020, Spring/Summer/Fall 2021) and are located in downtown Chicago.

Qualifications:
Currently enrolled in a BS, MS, or PhD program in computer science, computer engineering, or related technical field

Strong understanding and application of data structures and algorithms

Authorization to legally work in the United States

Ability to speak and write in English fluently

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with systems software development on Linux

Experience with full-stack web development

Experience with high performance, parallel computing

About Ocient:
Ocient is a Chicago-based, venture-funded startup building a SQL compliant, exabyte-scale database platform that achieves better performance than Hadoop and NoSQL systems. It is a distributed system optimized for NVMe drives, RDMA networks and high core count processors and is written in C++. We are led by a management team with seven successful startup exits, including Cleversafe which was one of the largest software startup exits in Chicago's history.

description:
Full Job Description
ABOUT YOU

You believe in a culture of inclusive excellence and value the differences that make us each unique. You are professional and kind; curious and passionate about your work and studies; seek a stimulating and rewarding internship; and, sincere in your desire to help others. Join our internship program and gain valuable learning and working experience at a leading nonprofit organization.

ABOUT UNITED WAY WORLDWIDE

United Way brings people, organizations, and communities together around a common cause, a common vision, and a common path forward. In many communities, we're the only nonprofit building up the cornerstones of education, financial stability and health—and the only nonprofit bringing people together from all walks of life to be a part of local solutions. We're engaged in nearly 1,800 communities across more than 40 countries and territories, where people are powering big ideas and big action by donating, volunteering and speaking out through United Way.

United Way Worldwide is located in Old Town Alexandria, VA. Our culture is People First—we take it seriously and, because of that, we take good care of people. We encourage growth and upward mobility—and want you to succeed in a diverse, inclusive, and ethical workplace. Take action, join our Internship—apply now.

INTERN EXPERIENCE AT UNITED WAY WORLDWIDE

Interns at United Way Worldwide gain valuable learning and working experience at a leading nonprofit organization. Our goal is to make every intern who works with us feel included, valuable, and productive. In addition to the hands-on experience you’ll receive working at the largest nonprofit in the world, you will be provided with weekly professional development workshops.

APPLICANT REQUIREMENTS

The internship opportunities are open to current students of a college program, or within 2 years of graduating. Applicants must be authorized to work within the United States and have all required documentation proving their authorization at the time of their application.

POSITION SUMMARY

Join United Way Worldwide as we refine our data security and privacy program in response to evolving privacy standards (such as GDPR and other US State laws (e.g. CCPA)). We are seeking an IT intern with a passion for both understanding and implementation of security/privacy practices who can bring their current classroom knowledge into practice. This position will provide real world experience related to strategic choices between balancing current critical needs with long term planning and design.

This Internship will contribute to two focus areas: 1. An inward focus on UWW Salesforce environment, Shared CRM, and 2. An external focus to enhance webinars and tools to the United Way network of 1100+ independent Local United Ways across the globe to educate and prepare the local United Ways by establishing standards along with accompanying guidance.

Through technology, collaboration, and creative problem-solving, the IT Security and Privacy intern will actively contribute to meaningful projects and work closely with a mentor as well as UWW leaders.

PRIMARY PROJECTS

Support the IT team in streamlining data security and privacy

Assists with the following:
Mapping data flows
Data classification

Vendor Assessment ProcessOther potential projects include:
Automation of UWW IT Security and Privacy Toolkit for Local United Ways
Documenting security design
Lend IT support in areas such as cybersecurity, programming, analytics

REQUIRED SKILLS

Computer Science, Information Technology, or Management Information Systems major with a focus in IT security and privacy.
Minimum GPA of 3.0
Strong verbal and written communication
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong Excel skills
Optional: Salesforce experience
Ability to work well in teams
Strong work ethic and attention to detail

PERKS

Weekly professional development workshops provided onsite
Chance to meet and work with top nonprofit experts in the country
Completely remote internship experience
Gain hands-on experience
Shadowing and trained experiences with knowledgeable professionals
Opportunity to attend organizational meetings
Flexible schedule for students

LOCATION

This internship takes place 100% remote.

EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER

United Way Worldwide seeks diverse, qualified professionals who want to make a difference in the world. We are an equal opportunity employer and recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, creed, disability, veteran status, marital status, age, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin or ancestry, genetic information, and other legally protected characteristics, in accordance with applicable laws. The EEO is the Law poster is available here: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf. If you need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process, please e-mail aaron.gibson@uww.unitedway.org and provide the nature of your request and your contact information.

We are a charter member of Employers of National Service and encourage AmeriCorps, Peace Corps, and other national service alumni to apply.

DIVERSITY & INCLUSION STATEMENT OF PRINCIPLE

We take the broadest possible view of diversity.

We value the visible and invisible qualities that make you who you are.

We welcome that every person brings a unique perspective and experience to advance our mission and progress our fight for the health, education, and financial stability of every person in every community.

We believe that each United Way community member, donor, volunteer, advocate, and employee must have equal access to solving community problems.

We strive to include diversity, equity, and inclusion practices at the center of our daily work.

We commit to using these practices for our business and our communities.

Join us in embracing diversity, equity and inclusion for every person in every community.

LIVE UNITED.

Thank you for your interest in an internship opportunity with United Way Worldwide. You will be contacted if your qualifications are a good match and you are selected for an interview.

Full Job Description
Job Overview:
Applied Systems, Inc., a worldwide leader in insurance technology, is currently searching for a Software Engineer in Test Intern to join us for the summer. You will join the Quality Assurance team to focus working within an automated QA environment, assisting with testing, and work on highly impactful QA projects. All roles will provide a summer of valuable, hands-on technology experience in a professional environment.

Applied’s internships are full-time, Monday through Friday positions, that run from May to August. Start dates and end dates are determined by both the department and the intern's availability. These internships will be 100% remote and interested applicants must reside in the United States or Canada. Equipment is provided for the internship program.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Work side-by-side with other technology professionals that are designing, coding, and testing software applications that revolutionize the global business of insurance
Create new tools and/or processes that impact our employees and clients, making a difference every day
Exposure to professional documentation/design, QA, and development processes
Experience in an Agile Scrum environment
Work within an Agile Scrum team to deliver high technical solutions that provide business value

QUALIFICATIONS FOR THIS JOB

Pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, CIS, or equivalent
Must be enrolled full-time at the college/university level for the Fall 2021 semester
Basic understanding of any OOP languages (C#, Java, C++, Python, etc.)
Any relevant projects or previous internship experience working with OOP languages a plus
Basic understanding of web development languages (HTML, CSS, JavaScript)
Experience working with databases (SQL Server, MySQL, etc.)
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
Ability to work with others in a team-oriented environment
Detail-oriented; self-motivated, able to work independently
Must be able to work full-time (40 hours per week), Monday through Friday
Internships run from May to August
Ability to work 100% remotely
Must be authorized to work in the United States without sponsorship / eligible to remain and work in Canada for any employer

WHO WE ARE

LEADING GLOBAL PROVIDER OF CLOUD-BASED INSURANCE SOFTWARE- Applied Systems develops the top two Insurance Agency/Broker Management software products in the world. In addition, we also provide innovative mobile apps, Data Analytics, Customer Self-Service, Insurer Connectivity & Rating, eServicing, Benefits Design, and CRM software products. By automating the insurance lifecycle, Applied’s people and products enable millions of people around the world to safeguard and protect what matters most.
CLOUD SOLUTIONS & PROFESSIONAL SERVICES- We offer cloud solutions, 24x7 technical support, consulting, implementation, and education services.
AWARD WINNING TECHNOLOGY- We have been voted
2020 Company of the Year (Stevie Award)
2020 New Product or Service of the Year- 2 awards (Stevie Award)
2019 Best Cloud-Based Software Solutions Provider in the insurance industry (2019 Corporate Excellence Awards)
2019 Digital Service Provider of the Year (Business Excellence Awards)
2019 Best Broker Software Management House (Insurance Times)
GOOGLE’S INVESTMENT IN APPLIED- Google/CapitalG made a minority investment in Applied that will spur AI, machine learning, and digital marketing innovation in the global insurance industry.
CLIENTS- We provide technology to over 160k users within insurance agencies, brokerages, and carriers throughout the US, Canada, the UK, and Ireland.
EMPLOYEES- Applied currently has 1,800+ employees across the US, Canada, the UK, and Ireland.

COMPANY CULTURE & PERKS

JOIN A GREAT TEAM- We believe that success comes from a dynamic working environment that offers professionals an opportunity to grow and succeed alongside extraordinary people. We encourage idea sharing, problem solving, and teamwork in our environment.
DIVERSITY MATTERS- We strive to create a positive workplace culture for those of different thinking, backgrounds, experiences, expertise, and individual qualities across our organization. We want the best and the brightest to be a part of a growing culture that embraces a sense of belonging.
RELAXED DRESS CODE- Applied allows for a relaxed dress code where jeans are permitted; we call this “Dress for your Day”.
FUN PARTIES & PERKS- Fun perks are a staple at Applied, including holiday parties with games and contests, summer celebrations employee appreciation events, art contests, employee discount programs, and more!
OPPORTUNITIES FOR ADVANCEMENT- We are a growing company that offers career opportunities, and not just “another job”. Applied believes in growing our employees and promoting from within, offering many opportunities for professional advancement along the way!
CAREER STABILITY & LONGEVITY- Our average employee tenure is 9 years.
CULTURE OF RECOGNITION- Applied provides a culture of employee recognition with our Circle of Excellence program, and our internal social network recognition program.
APPLIED CARES- We have a culture that embraces and promotes volunteerism. Applied encourages our employees to help local charities and communities through the ‘Applied Cares’ program

BENEFITS & REWARDS

Full Job Description

Machine Learning Engineering Intern: Environmental, Social, Governance (ESG) Investment Model Development

LOCATION: Remote and/or Tysons Corner, VA

POSITION HIGHLIGHTS:

Verstand AI (www.verstand.ai) is seeking interns with an interest in building custom data product and artificial intelligence solutions for clients in the financial services industry. Armed with knowledge of data science applications and machine learning algorithms, the machine learning intern will be instrumental in building high quality datasets to fine tuning models (building and retraining models) for maximizing performance. Along with the management of cloud environments,
Verstand interns will be responsible for ensuring data quality, scoring and evaluation of models, and continuous model operations. Additionally, support will be handed to Data Engineers to build ETL pipelines and BI Designers to design visualizations and dashboards. Knowledge of capital markets and trading strategies an advantage.

Most importantly, Verstand AI's interns will get an opportunity to work with cutting edge technologies and be part of data teams that help clients harness the power of artificial intelligence. Verstand’s interns will shape and build efficient and self-learning applications.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Work with product owners, data engineers, and BI designers to understand product requirements, data needs, and model design
  • Acquire data and build custom datasets using web-scraping or NLP tools
  • Perform data analysis on large structured or unstructured datasets, using machine learning to enrich data features and data quality
  • Design and build data extraction, transformation, and loading processes by writing custom data pipelines
  • Design, implement and support platforms that can provide ad-hoc access to large datasets and unstructured data
  • Perform model parameter and hyperparameter fine tuning to optimize model learn rates and maximize model performance
  • Participate in feature engineering planning sessions
  • Develop multiple model scoring and evaluation methodologies
  • Design visualizations and dashboards for reporting and rich storytelling

JOB REQUIREMENTS:

Minimum Experience, Skills and Education:

  • Knowledge of machine learning algorithms, their application for problem solving and MLOps
  • Strong Python, Java, R and SQL skills with understanding of software development
  • Deep knowledge of math, probability, and statistics
  • Experience with cloud platforms such as Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, or Google Could Platform (GCP)
  • Working knowledge of Python Machine Learning libraries (SciKit Learn, TensorFlow, Pytorch, Keras)
  • Experience with base level data Python libraries (Pandas, NumPy, SciPy, Scapy, NLTK)
  • Working knowledge of scoring and evaluating machine learning models
  • Working knowledge of ETL pipelines and data ingestion methodology
  • Working knowledge of data visualization tools such as Power BI, Looker and Tableau
  • Effective written/spoken communication skills and strong problem-solving skills
  • Currently enrolled in Bachelor's degree from four-year College or university in Computer Science, Data Science or related field

Experience That Sets You Apart:

  • Experience with capital markets, time series analysis, trading strategies and algorithms
  • Experience and interest in ESG reporting, data points, and standards

Verstand AI is a fast-growing firm that believes in ongoing training and development for its staff. The firm's mission is to help both its commercial and public sector clients resolve data management challenges and move to delivering insight and benefits for stakeholders, customers and constituents.

Based out of Tysons Corner, VA, Verstand does business across the United States and is moving into Europe and Asia. If you're interested in working with us and have a desire to tackle challenging data problems, we welcome your interest and encourage you to apply.

Full Job Description

This is a one year internship with a flexible work schedule!

BACKGROUND

Whether you are seeking a second job, a part-time position while you are in school, or looking for a full-time challenging position, the City of Auburn Hills offers flexible opportunities for everyone. Our seasonal workers get to enjoy variety working throughout the City. Best of all, you can make a difference in the community.

The Mission of the City of Auburn Hills to be stewards for the community through a connected, transparent, and efficient government. The Vision of Auburn Hills is to be a community with the heart of a small town that operates with the excellence of a world class city. The organizational Values are Attentive Service, Diversity, Excellence, Fiscal Responsibility, Humility and Safety.

The Department of Public Works (DPW) is made up of six divisions including Facilities, Grounds, Water, Sewer, Fleet and Roads. The DPW has just over 40 full-time personnel, augmented with various part-time staff and seasonal employees. All DPW employees are expected to approach each day with a focus on the City’s Mission, Vision and Values.

GENERAL PURPOSE

Provides assistance in a variety of data digitizing projects to support and update the Department’s GIS database. Will also provide support in various mapping projects for the Department and other City Departments.

SUPERVISION RECEIVED

Works under the supervision of the GIS Asset Management Specialist.

SUPERVISION EXERCISED

None.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

· Georeference as-built record drawings and digitize utility features.

· Create field data collection applications for use in Collector, Survey123, and Quick Capture for ArcGIS.

· Create multiple web mapping applications and Story Maps for DPW website.

· Verify GIS data in the field both independently and with field crews.

· Scan various paper files into Laserfiche and organize.

· Assist with cleaning GIS data as directed by GIS Specialist.

· Assist other city departments as needed with GIS tasks.

· Provide general support for the GIS Specialist.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

Education and Experience:

· Student enrolled in an accredited college or university seeking a degree or certificate in Geographic Information Systems, Computer Science, Geography, Engineering, Surveying, or a directly related field.

· Recent graduate from any field above.

Necessary Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:

· Familiarity with Esri Desktop 10.3-10.8.

· ArcGIS Pro desired.

· Familiarity with ArcGIS Online and related applications such as Collector, Survey123, and Quick Capture.

· Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite.

· Familiarity with reading as-built drawings a plus.

· Basic knowledge of GPS equipment a plus.

· Must possess and maintain a valid driver’s license and the means to travel to/from the City of Auburn Hills Department of Public Works Building to an established location.

Job Types: Part-time, Temporary, Internship

Pay: $14.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Work Location:

  • One location

Work Remotely:

  • No

description:
Full Job Description

Are you ready to kickstart your cybersecurity career? Are you analytical and a problem solver by nature? Do you value working in a positive culture where you action big ideas? Are you excited to work in a collaborative security operations environment?

If you answered YES, you might be just the person we are looking for.

We are CyberForce|Q and we protect the cyber realm as a collective force for good. For over 25 years we have provided innovative cybersecurity solutions to our clients. Our TEAM is growing, and we are looking for an aspiring cybersecurity professional to join us! 

What You’ll Do

  • Actively respond to real-world cyber-attacks.
  • Triage incoming tickets to the SOC.
  • Work with best-of-breed vendor technologies.
  • Work with SIEM & SOAR platforms.
  • Interact regularly with business owners, CISO's, and vendors as needed to see tickets through resolution.
  • Collaborate with other IT security professionals to provide exceptional support and problem resolution as a member of our SOC.
  • Participate in team initiatives.

Schedule

  • Our SOC operates 24x7x365.
  • Part-time team members must work a minimum of 24 hours a week.
  • We will find out your scheduling restrictions (i.e. class schedules, professional groups and other obligations) and the schedule will be built around your availability and the team's needs for coverage.
  • Shifts do not rotate and do not change weekly.

Location

  • This position is 100% remote.
  • You must live within a reasonable distance to travel to the Greater Phoenix, AZ area.
  • Candidates applying who do not reside in Arizona will not be considered for this role.

What You Bring to the TEAM

  • Ability to easily and effectively communicate technical information, written or verbally.
  • Desire to work as a part of a highly interactive team; regularly communicating with other team members and clients.
  • Ability to stay calm under pressure.
  • Ability to manage time effectively and complete projects on time.
  • Ability to differentiate between a significant event, a true positive, and a false positive.
  • Understanding of OSI model and ability to apply to troubleshooting issues.
  • Knowledge of networking, packet flow, TCP/UDP traffic, and firewalls.
  • Modem, router, reliable internet and dedicated workspace at home to support remote work.

Things We Love to See But Aren't Requirements

  • Ability to write scripts/code using Python, Perl, PowerShell, or an equivalent language.
  • Studying for or achieved certifications such as CompTIA Security+, Cisco CCENT, or Certified HIPAA Security Professional (CHSP)
  • Technical help desk, technical troubleshooting, or information security role experience.
  • Pursuing or completed Associate's or Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Assurance, Information Security, Cyber Defense, Cybersecurity or a related discipline from an accredited institution.
  • Splunk or Qradar knowledge/experience.

Why Join Us

  • Make a Difference. Work in a flourishing industry where the work we do helps people.
  • Upgrade Your Skills. As a member of our security operations, you’ll gain exposure to many networks and tools as well industry professionals inside and outside of CFQ.
  • Opportunity for Promotion. Join our team in an entry level role and work towards cybersecurity analyst skills! Team members that excel in this role may be eligible to join our team full-time. You are in the driver's seat of your own career development!
  • Get School Credit: This role can fulfill internship requirements. Please contact your college or university directly to determine if our role can satisfy your internship requirement.

Job Types: Part-time, Internship

Pay: Up to $15.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Professional development assistance

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Weekend availability

Application Question(s):

  • What classes or projects have you done related to networking, cybersecurity, or information assurance?

Work Location:

  • One location

Work Remotely:

  • No

Full Job Description
Quality-Obsessed. People-Centered.

Are you looking for an Internship opportunity in Supply Chain Strategy & Digital Transformation with a trusted advisor in digital end-to-end supply chain strategy and operations?

Look no further!

At Supply Chain Wizard we strive to be the premier supply chain services company that attracts, develops and empowers highly talented people. Our success depends on this.

The Role

The Supply Chain Strategy Intern participates in all aspects of the Customer Success lifecycle, primarily supporting manufacturing clients and their digital factory & supply chain transformation journey.

We take an innovative approach to Supply Chain Transformation. SCW leverages BI dashboards, IoT devices, Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning to monitor and predict potential issues and provide proactive and preventive support for our Manufacturing clients to support their digital transformation journey. Therefore, this role requires a “can do”, “can learn”, “can support” attitude.

We are looking for an energetic Supply Chain Strategy Intern, who will:

Continuously monitor strategic clients to ensure issue-free usage of our products in the Digital Factory Suite i.e. OEE Tracker, Digital Logbook, Scheduler.
Understand business challenges and cases, directly solve problems or translate them into internal mechanisms to resolve problems.
Be proactive in identifying issues and cases on behalf of clients to maximize the value they get out of our products.
Advocate client requirements among internal teams and support internal product development lifecycle.
Create and organize documentation to maintain a knowledge base, user manuals and training materials.
Prepare and present periodic business reports
Take part in SCW's strategic initiatives and support executive team in digital transformation projects
Take part in select supply chain strategy and/or transformation client projects and support client services teams

This is an excellent opportunity to leverage your coursework with practical industry experience while being an integral part of a high-growth, high-impact start-up organization.

Your work will matter!

Desired Skills and Experience

Ideal candidates will have the following attributes:
Working towards or recently obtained a bachelor’s or master’s degree in the following curricula: Industrial Engineering, Computer Science, Business Administration, Economics or a similar discipline
Excellent communication skills in English
Strong collaboration and presentation skills
Strong organizational and detail oriented analytical problem-solving skills
Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint)
Previous experience with software product support is a plus
Proficiency in BI Tools is a plus

About Us

Supply Chain Wizard, a two times Inc. 5000 honoree in Americas Fastest Growing Private Companies List (2018, 2019), Financial Times Top 500 Americas' Fastest Growing Companies honoree (2020) and a Gartner Cool Vendor in 2019 Supply Chain Execution Technologies, is a management consulting, digital innovation and solutions firm, and a global leader specializing in serialization and traceability, supply chain strategy and operational transformation programs with the presence in North America, Latin America, Europe, Middle East and Asia. Headquartered in Princeton, NJ, Supply Chain Wizard partners with organizations in designing, developing and implementing digital solutions using state-of-the-art technologies such as Internet-of-Things (IoT), Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning (ML) and Blockchain through its Cloud Platform to enable end-to-end Digital Supply Chain Transformations in Life Sciences & Pharmaceutical industry. Serving some of the world's largest pharmaceutical manufacturers, contract manufacturers and packagers, Supply Chain Wizard is dedicated to adding sustainable value through data-driven decision making from Shop Floor to Executive Boardrooms. This is the place to learn and grow.

Full Job Description
About Tecton

Tecton is building an enterprise Feature Store that is transforming the way companies solve real-world problems with machine learning at scale. Our founding team created Uber's Michelangelo ML Platform, which has become the blueprint for modern ML platforms in large organizations. We recently received Series B funding from Sequoia Capital and Andreessen Horowitz, have paying enterprise customers, and have growing engineering teams in SF and NYC. The team has years of experience building and operating business-critical machine learning systems at scale at places like Uber, Google, Facebook, Airbnb, Twitter, and Quora.

About the Role:
Software Engineering Interns at Tecton will be paired with a mentor and will have the opportunity to work directly with the engineering team on projects than span across our feature store product. Our engineering team is less than 25 people and each engineer has a high sense of ownership around their work. We are looking for exceptional computer science students who are driven to find simple solutions to complex challenges and who are passionate about accelerating their careers by learning from those around them. Ideally, you have an interest in cloud architectures, distributed systems, data, or machine learning infrastructure.

What we are looking for:
Experience with Java, Go, Python, or Javascript
Knowledge of data structures and algorithms
Strong problem solving and ability to adapt and learn quickly
Previous software engineering experience via an internship, work experience, school projects, or coding competitions

Qualifications:
For Fall '21 or Spring '22 internship, must be a rising Senior currently pursuing a B.A/B.S degree in Computer Science or a related technical field, or a 2nd year Masters or PhD student with an anticipated graduation date in 2022 or sooner
Ability to commit to a 10-12 week full time paid internship program

Responsibilities

  • Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
  • Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
  • Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems
  • Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
  • Filter and "clean" data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems
  • Work with management to prioritize business and information needs
  • Locate and define new process improvement opportunities
  • Use Tableau to build and publish customized interactive reports, data visualizations, and executive level dashboards that are in support our development team operations
  • Take ownership and enhance existing tableau visualizations that our business is dependent on, such as road mapping and agile metrics dashboards.
  • Analyze and integrate complex data coming in from multiple disparate sources; Use SQL to create published data sources that enable you, your stakeholders, and internal customers to retrieve key data/metrics/reports.
  • Work closely and build relationships with data engineers in other teams in Tableau to communicate requirements and drive dependency completion.
  • Validate telemetry analysis with internal customers and power users
  • Draw insight from data and have the ability to visually present and communicate data, analyses, and findings orally and in writing.
  • Troubleshoot data issues with Tableau reports and dashboards.
  • Contribute to expanding the Tableau data science

Requirements

  • Understanding of data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
  • Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel or Python)
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
  • Adept at queries, report writing and presenting findings
  • Background in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics

Full Job Description
Meet MedPro Group. We’re an industry-leading Berkshire Hathaway insurance company with a passion for our clients and our team. We are hundreds of professionals with varied backgrounds and experience levels who came together to achieve one goal: protecting those who have made it their mission to serve and care for others. Never considered the insurance industry before? We think you should.

In this role, you will…

Develop and support the implementation of configurations in Duck Creek Suite Distribution Management and integrations with other applications
Plan, execute, and document unit testing.
Participate in peer reviews.
Support the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and participate in the development sprints.
Develop and support Proof of Concept (POC) projects as required.
Provide product support and maintenance for products in production.
Participate in developing documentation and job aid documents.

We are looking for candidates with…

A minimum of a sophomore in college pursuing a BS degree, with a 3.0 or better GPA.
A computer science related major.
Year round availability: part-time up to 20 hours during school, full-time during summer if not taking classes.
Experience with XML, XSLT, XPath and JSON.
Experience in development with the Java programming language and an Integrated Development Environment (i.e. Eclipse).
Experience with SQL Database queries and stored procedures.
Experience with SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) is preferred.
Experience with Azure or AWS hosted Cloud environments and Web Services is preferred.
Experience with a version control management system (i.e. Git) is preferred.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
Excellent organizational, leadership and communication (verbal and written) skills.
Ability to work effectively in a team environment or independently.
Proficient in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
Authorization to work in the United States without requiring visa sponsorship, both now and in the future.

Why MedPro?
MedPro Group’s mission is built on a century-old legacy of protecting those who protect others. From our roots in our hometown of Fort Wayne, Indiana, we've worked diligently to become the nation's premier healthcare liability coverage provider, currently insuring more than 300,000 customers. With that growth, we've built a significant presence in all 50 states and internationally. Our team works across the country to provide the best strategies to mitigate risk and preserve the reputations of those who have entrusted their good name to us. That passion – built on a foundation of a culture that values uncompromised integrity, obsessive client focus, great teamwork, and a long-term mindset – make MedPro a preferred employer that many call their career home.

Are you a recent graduate looking to enter the fast-paced world of digital marketing and e-commerce? Want to learn how to craft digital marketing strategies for clients spending thousands per day on Facebook, Google, and through other programmatic online ad exchanges?

Eager to know how a multi-million dollar ecommerce agency is run and help real clients grow their business on day 1?

If so, you might be a fit for our internship program at Amasa. This internship will involve both remote work, and some socially-distant collaboration at our Gaslamp district office downtown. The office is regularly cleaned and sanitized, and we are following all CDC protocols for social distancing and safe reopening.

We are looking for smart, data-driven and creative young talent to train, then hopefully hire FULL TIME for our growing agency, in the role of either an Junior Account Manager or a Junior Facebook Media Buyer

In this role, you will:
Plan, manage, and execute digital media buys on Facebook and Instagram
Develop a collaborative relationship with internal and external creative teams to develop cutting-edge media assets.
Constantly learn and experiment new effective bidding, ad placement, and management techniques
Prepare research and insights to inform ongoing media recommendations
Learn to continuously monitor campaign performance and return-on-ad-spend (ROAS), while suggesting and executing ongoing optimization strategies to hit and exceed assigned KPIs
Learn project management tools and software
Assist with developing custom marketing proposals to both startups and global brands
Brainstorm and suggest marketing angles for clients
Perform administrative duties for meetings and other client related tasks
Learn how to A/B test ad creatives and various website components
Help with video and creative shoots
Create and analyze campaign performance reports to inform relevant teams at Amasa.
Perform other related duties as required or assigned

REQUIREMENTS:
Degree in one of the following subjects preferred: Business, Marketing, Statistics, Computer Science, Finance/Accounting, Psychology, Public Relations
Ability to come into the office 2x per week, and work remote (20-25 hours per week total)
Must be creative and have the desire to sell somebody something
Enjoy wearing many hats and managing several projects at one time
Strong communication skills
Computer proficiency
Social media savvy

BENEFITS:
Company issued Macbook Pro or PC
Office stocked with snacks, drinks, and beer
Work alongside awesome young talent and learn real world skills that are transferable to dozens of high earning jobs in a number of fields
Free parking

ADDITIONAL INFO:
Full-time employment potential after 3 months
Position Opening Date: Immediate

Please submit your resume and a short cover letter telling us a bit more about yourself and what makes you qualified here.

Full Job Description
Overview:
We are not just offering a job but a meaningful career! Come join our passionate team!

As a Fortune 50 company, we hire the best employees to serve our customers, making us a leader in the insurance and financial services industry. State Farm embraces diversity and inclusion to ensure a workforce that is engaged, builds on the strengths and talents of all associates, and creates a Good Neighbor culture.

We offer competitive benefits and pay with the potential for an annual financial award based on both individual and enterprise performance. Our employees have an opportunity to participate in volunteer events within the community and engage in a learning culture. We offer programs to assist with tuition reimbursement, professional designations, employee development, wellness initiatives, and more!

Visit our Careers page for more information on our benefits, locations and the process of joining the State Farm team!

Responsibilities:
State Farm has developed a unique internship opportunity for graduate students at the University of Illinois - the Modeling and Analytics Graduate Network (MAGNet). MAGNet interns apply their statistical modeling and analytic skills to a wide variety of business problems faced by the State Farm organization.

Most MAGNet interns are in the Statistics Department's graduate program, but graduate students in other highly quantitative disciplines may also be considered. While participating in the MAGNet program, students are evaluated and given consideration for full time post graduate employment at various State Farm locations: Bloomington IL, Atlanta GA, Dallas TX or Champaign IL.

MAGNet interns apply their predictive modeling and data analysis skills to a variety of business problems, in many different lines of business and departments (e.g., marketing, insurance and banking) including:
 Pricing and Underwriting Risk Predictive Modeling
 Claims Automation Predictive Modeling
 Sales/Growth Forecasting, Econometric and Predictive Modeling
 Data mining applications for Claims and Competitive Analysis
 Evaluating new statistical methods and tools for potential use by State Farm Modelers

Qualifications:
Interns are assigned based to a wide variety of departments for experience, based on major and interest area.

Majors considered:
 Statistics
 Mathematics
 Computer Science
 Finance
 Economics
 Actuarial Science
 Data Science

We Are Looking For The Following:
 Applicants must be accepted or currently enrolled in an approved Graduate program at University of Illinois
 Statistical modeling and/or data mining experience
 Data analysis and experience with database tools
 Computer programming (specifically SAS, R, or Python) skills
 Communication and presentations skills

What You Can Expect:
 During the academic year, MAGNet interns will work 20 hours a week
 Internship duration: Fall 2021 semester 8/23/2021 to 12/10/2021

What’s In It For You:
MAGNet is similar to a 50% graduate assistantship offered by the University and interns receive hourly pay comparable to that offered by the University for graduate assistants, as well as full tuition assistance for the duration of the internship. As with an assistantship, tuition costs are covered.

Some State Farm benefits may also apply, including the following:
 Relaxed dress code
 Direct experience you can leverage for you future career
 An opportunity to learn and network with industry-leading influencers
 A Learning Environment: Mentoring and Development to help you succeed
 We love to give back! Being involved in volunteer opportunities to give back to the community
 A culture that embraces Diversity and Inclusion - it is simply the right thing to do!

Full Job Description

Local Unit & Position Description: Are you a student that's passionate about ensuring that sustainable energy be available to areas beyond the main power grid? Are you excited to contribute to the planning and perform technical analysis on microgrids, stationary energy storage, or solar + storage pojrects? Are you really excited about batteries? This internship may be for you!

DNV - Energy Systems is seeking an Energy Storage Intern to join its Energy Storage Engineering (ESE) and/or the Storage & Grid-edge Intelligence (SAGE) section. This unit specializes in supporting analysis and engineering of stationary energy storage projects, microgrids, and Energy Access projects.

This internship is based remotely but will be focused on supporting project work in Portland, OR and Chalfont, PA locations.

*
Tasks May Include*

  • Supporting energy storage project developers and battery manufacturers in reviewing their systems
  • Performing preliminary microgrid designs for rural solar+storage grids
  • Converting data sets into site reports for analysis
  • Implementation of quality control (QC) best practices to ensure accurate data collection with field partners
  • Other duties to support production work, including, but not limited to: report writing, remote troubleshooting, critical reviewing
  • Developing tools and processes to continuously improve quality and value of delivery

Position Qualifications: Requirements

  • Currently in a Bachelor’s or Masters degree program with an emphasis in Electrical, or Mechanical Engineering, Computer Science, Geography, Environmental Science, or Mathematics/Physics required.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, and Word
  • Strong written and verbal English language commnication skills
  • We conduct pre-employment drug and background screening

*
Preferred Skills*

  • Educational focus on Renewable Energy Engineering preferred

*
**Immigration-related benefits, such as visa sponsorship, are unavailable for this position***

*
Opportunities Beyond Business*

Our mission is to safeguard life, property and the environment. By joining us, you will work towards our meaningful vision: to make a global impact for a safe and sustainable future. DNV GL offers a congenial working environment, competitive salaries, and an exceptional benefits package.
DNV GL is an Equal Opportunity Employer and gives consideration for employment to qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. For more information about your rights under the law, see:

http://www1.eeoc.gov/employers/upload/eeoc_self_print_poster.pdf

Please visit our website at www.dnvgl.com

Company & Business Area Description: DNV is the independent expert in risk management and assurance, with almost 12,000 employees operating in more than 100 countries. Through our broad experience and deep expertise we advance safety and sustainable performance, set industry benchmarks, and inspire and invent solutions.

We provide assurance to the entire energy value chain through our advisory, monitoring, verification, and certification services. As the world's leading resource of independent energy experts and technical advisors, we help industries and governments to navigate the many complex, interrelated transitions taking place globally and regionally, in the energy industry. We are committed to realizing the goals of the Paris Agreement, and support all stakeholders to transition faster to a deeply decarbonized energy system.
Equal Opportunity Statement: DNV is an Equal Opportunity Employer and gives consideration for employment to qualified applicants without regard to gender, religion, race, national or ethnic origin, cultural background, social group, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, age or political opinion. Diversity is fundamental to our culture and we invite you to be part of this diversity!

description:
Full Job Description
Overview:
The IT Ops Intern supports our users in-person and remotely to reset passwords, move computers and printers, help remote users with VPN and email support, etc.

About Rogue Fitness

Rogue Fitness is the leading manufacturer of strength and conditioning equipment, including barbells, power racks, sleds, and accessories
Founded in a garage in 2006, the company has grown to 800+ team members at its 600,000 sq. ft. headquarters near downtown Columbus, Ohio
Rogue is the official equipment supplier of the CrossFit Games, USA Weightlifting, the Arnold Strongman Classic, and the World’s Strongest Man competition
The company remains dedicated to serving the needs of serious athletes at every level, from the garage to the arena
Read more about The Rogue Way

Our Values

We work until it’s done
Everyone puts their boots on the same way
High Speed, Low Drag

Responsibilities:
Performs routine preventive maintenance on hardware systems
Provides direction to users to resolve technological issues
Determine computer problems and coordinates hardware, software, and/or network solutions
Communicates technical guidance and instruction to users on the use of PC and/or mainframe applications and systems
Analyzes and resolves basic computer problems

Qualifications:
Students enrolled in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems or related field preferred
1+ years of End User support experience preferred
Manufacturing and Warehouse experience a plus
Minimum of 3.0 grade point average is required

Benefits Overview:
Healthcare: Rogue offers competitive medical, dental and vision coverage options through Anthem Blue Cross Blue Shield for Rogue team members and their eligible family members, including domestic partners
Financial Protection: Life insurance, AD&D insurance, short-term disability, long-term disability and workers’ compensation are offered for eligible team members
Compensation: We like to reward Rogue team members for their hard work and commitment to our company. Rogue has a competitive pay structure that offers team members room to grow. We conduct annual compensation reviews to ensure Rogue team members are receiving compensation commensurate with their performance
Bonus & Retirement: Team members are eligible to earn a Performance Compensation Bonus each quarter. In addition, Rogue offers 401(k) with matching company contributions and Profit Sharing
Parental Leave: Parental Leave is available to new Mothers and Fathers to help assist team members welcome a new child to their family. Rogue offers up to 12 weeks of paid leave to parents to enjoy with their newest addition to the family. This is available to all team members with the length of leave determined by years of service, the team member’s role and whether they are the birth or non-birth parent
Vacations & Holidays: Everyone needs some time off from work to take care of personal business, enjoy a well-earned vacation, or just unwind from the demands of everyday life. At Rogue, we offer Paid Time Off benefits in addition to paid company holidays
Work Attire Program: Rogue Fitness recognizes the importance of helping all team members acquire the proper apparel and equipment to create a safe workplace. We provide Rogue apparel, uniforms, and personal protective equipment to all Rogue team members working in our facilities at no cost. Additional reimbursements are in place for work boots and prescription safety glasses
Rogue Team Member Perks: Merchandise Discounts, Employee Gym Membership, Exclusive Access to Special Events, Professional Development Programs and more

description:
Full Job Description
Overview:
The SAGE Publishing Technologies Digital Accessibility Internship offers the opportunity to learn more about the academic publishing industry while developing the skills needed to succeed in digital accessibility and technology positions.

The role will allow someone to gain hands-on experience and learn about digital accessibility and general academic publishing. They will engage in work pertaining to digital educational products that is project-based, multifaceted, fast-paced, intellectually exciting, and above all, collaborative. This position assists, maintains, and helps drive a range of accessibility testing and documentation activities.

This role is best suited for self-starters who are curious, organized, take initiative, ask questions, share feedback, participate in meetings, and are passionate about digital accessibility in higher education.

This internship is paid, part-time (16–25 hours per week during normal office hours) position for the fall 2021 academic semester with the possibility of extending into future semesters and/or the summer based on performance and continued interest. Interns will work remotely and, in the SAGE Washington, DC, office on a mutually agreed schedule.

Essential Job Functions & Responsibilities:
Job functions include, but are not limited to, the following:
Assist accessibility specialist in conducting automated, manual, and screen reader testing on SAGE platforms and content
Record test results for incorporation into SAGE accessibility documentation
Support digital resource and assessment development
Provide user feedback on new products and platforms
Conduct research
Participate in regular and ad hoc meetings

Qualifications & Education:

Legrand has an opportunity for a Software Engineer Intern with the Building Control Systems Team in Carlsbad, CA. We develop and manufacture the most advanced lighting and automation systems for residential and commercial markets.

About Legrand

Every single day, Legrand brings power, light and data to millions of spaces around the world. Legrand is a global, publicly-traded company listed on the Euronext (Legrand SA EPA: LR) with 36,000 employees worldwide, a market cap of $16B, revenue of more than $5 billion, with products sold in 180 countries. Legrand is listed on the Forbes Global 2000 as one of the world’s best employers. For more information, visit legrand.com.

Legrand North and Central America (LNCA) employs over 5,000 associates in 60 locations, working in 6 product categories (Electrical Wiring Systems, Building Control Systems, AV, Data Communications, Power Distribution and Control, and Lighting). LNCA is an employee-centered, growth company with tremendous opportunity. For more information, visit legrand.us.

Legrand’s Building Control Systems (BCS) division includes the Wattstopper and Solarfective product lines. Wattstopper offers the most comprehensive line of simple, scalable and flexible energy efficient lighting controls and solutions for commercial and residential applications. These products, programs, and services have been helping customers save energy, meet green initiatives and comply with energy codes for more than 30 years. Full Job Description
Overview:
UW Credit Union has a great opportunity for an individual aspiring to pursue a career in the information technology field. The IT Desktop Support Intern will be used to augment the IT End User Services staff. The IT Desktop Support Intern will primarily be responsible for assisting the IT End User Services team with receiving, preparing, and deploying client devices, such as laptops, desktop computers, monitors, and other peripheral devices. This may include installing and testing computer equipment, relocating hardware, and hands-on troubleshooting. This person will also be supporting various department projects and activities.

This position is Limited Term. The internship will last 6 months with the opportunity to extend an additional 6 months based on organization/team needs. The individual will work up to 40 hours a week during the summer months and approximately 15-20 hours a week during the school semester. These hours can be flexible to meet your school needs.

The IT Desktop Support Intern must effectively carry out the essential duties of this position in a manner that consistently demonstrates the core values of the Organization in a positive manner.

Responsibilities:
1) Preparing and deploying IT hardware - 50%

Assist the End User Services team by receiving new hardware, tracking inventory, imaging laptops and desktop computers, installing and testing hardware. This includes scheduling and coordinating with end users, following a tested process of updating the Operating System, installing required applications, following provided instructions, testing and troubleshooting as needed. Working with the end user to validate that everything is working to their satisfaction.

2) Office Moves - 20%

Assist with moving staff from one location to another and move staff from one area of a building to another following a move plan and move schedule. This includes disconnecting and reconnecting PCs, monitors and peripherals as well as documenting cable and switchport details.

3) PC Replacements - 30%

Assist with the replacement of Desktop hardware. Coordinate and schedule with end users, the replacement of their desktop PC and decommission the old PC following documented procedures. Work with the end user to validate that everything is working to their satisfaction.

Qualifications:
Pursuing associates or bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field preferred.
A comprehensive working knowledge of Microsoft Windows, Microsoft Office applications, and Outlook preferred.
Experience in providing customer service or support preferred.
The ability to demonstrate strong interpersonal skill, communicate clearly and interact professionally with other employees preferred.
Minimum of 6 months experience in customer service or support required.

UW Credit Union is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer of Minorities, Protected Veterans, Women, and individuals with Disabilities. We strive to cultivate an inclusive workplace that is home to a diverse workforce where employees at all levels model knowledge of, belief in and a commitment to cultural competence.

Description:
Providence St. Joseph Health is calling a Quantitative Investment Intern to our location in Renton, WA or Irvine, CA.

We are seeking a Quantitative Investment Intern to assist the Manager of Investment Risk in assessing our internal tools for assessing and managing investment risks, and creating management reports summarizing the key themes and risks in the existing investment portfolio, focused on $5.5 billion of long term investment assets and $1.5 billion of pension assets. As an integral member of the System's investment team, the Quantitative RIsk Analyst will assist in enhancing and maintaining the System investment models and tools used to monitor portfolio performance, asset allocation and exposures, cash flows and liquidity. Additionally, the intern will prepare reports and support analysis for recommendations to senior management as well as to contribute to general reporting and control processes. In particular, the candidate is expected to assist the Manager of Risk in working with one or more outside vendors to implement a comprehensive risk management architecture for the system, which will cover $10bn plus of assets and over 100 external investment managers.

In this position you will have the following responsibilities:

Assist with managing, maintaining, and organizing various reports and documentation related to portfolio analytics.
Utilizes investment related software and applications to generate portfolio analysis and perform reconciliation and other reports, including but not limited to monthly, quarterly reports, and other ad hoc requests.
Ensures accuracy of data and timeliness of reporting for the system/region/entity/division.
Assists with creating and maintaining financial models.
Assists in preparing and compiling various reports, templates and analysis to support annual reporting and audit work.

Required qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree in Finance/Accounting/Computer Science.
3 months Finance/Computational Finance role in a financial institution or related entity.

Master's Degree in Computational Finance/Financial Engineering or equivalent education/experience.

Currently enrolled or recently graduated from a college program focused on Computer Science, IT, Data Analysis/Development

Video Editor Interns work with directors and producers, being the tool that winds the story together, demonstrating the ability to jump from project to project, to find the shot that captures the moment, and to separate compelling content from filler.

The ideal candidate will have the following experience:
Completed final year of a 4-year film, video production, broadcast journalism or related degree program.
A reel and/or work samples demonstrating strong technical proficiency as well as creative and storytelling ability.
A willingness to learn and work within a team environment.
Proficient in Adobe Premiere Pro and related programs.
Proficiency with videography and photography also a plus.

DIGITAL DEVELOPERS

Digital Development Interns get immersed into all aspects of development. They will see projects from front-end to back-end, the creation phase to the testing phase. They find what will work for a program and all its quirks. They are a problem-solver who loves finding that missing piece of the puzzle. The quicker, the better.

The ideal candidate will have the following experience:
Completed a 4-year computer science or engineering degree
Ability to work in a fast-paced, demand driven environment.
Basic experience with HTML5, XML, Ajax, jQuery and JavaScript.
Strong communication skills, including proficiency in developing technical documentation
A willingness to learn and work within a team environment.

PROJECT MANAGERS

Project Management Interns work directly with creative directors, account teams, and clients to see campaigns develop from start to finish. They demonstrate leadership qualities but operate best working with others. This position teaches the intern how to manage several tasks at once, oversee projects, and value the importance of being a collaborative leader.

The ideal candidate will have the following experience:
Completed a 4-year business, marketing, or related degree program.
Ability to work under aggressive deadlines.
Strong leadership, management, communication and analytical skills.
A willingness to learn and work within a team environment.
Proficient in Microsoft Office.

Qualifications:
Qualified candidates will have at least a 3.2 GPA, previous relevant internship experience(s) and completed their junior year of college, though recent graduates are preferred. All candidates must also exhibit a desire and motivation to learn and the ability to work as part of a team.

Your Application Submission Must Include All of the Following:

Cover letter expressing interest in the internship program
Resume
Portfolio
Letter of recommendation from a former teacher, employer, supervisor, or personal reference (teacher or employer are preferred)
Transcript (can be unofficial)

Who We Are:
MicroVision, Inc. (NASDAQ: MVIS), a leader in MEMS based solid state automotive lidar for advanced driver safety (ADAS) and autonomous driving sensor and micro-display technology for augmented reality is the pioneer and creator of PicoP® scanning technology, an ultra-miniature laser projection and sensing solution based on the laser beam scanning methodology. The technology is well suited to support a wide array of applications including interactive projection, robotics, industrial applications, and Augmented and Virtual Reality (AR/VR). MicroVision is an independently recognized leader for its formidable intellectual property portfolio. The company is based in Redmond, Washington.

Required Experience:
Completion of sophomore year in an engineering degree program BS or higher; Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Mechanical Engineering, Optical Engineering, Physics or similar.

Puget Sound Energy is looking to grow our community with top talented individuals like you! With our rapidly growing, award winning energy efficiency programs, our pathway to an exciting and innovative future is now.

PSE's Resource Acquisition & Risk Control team is looking for qualified candidates to fill an open Financial Data Analyst Internship position!

Job Description

Puget Sound Energy is seeking a Financial Data Analyst intern to support Puget Sound Energy’s Resource Acquisition team in enhancing standardized and dashboard reporting and analysis to support resource acquisition decisions and regulatory filing documentation. This position primarily focuses on creating meaningful data representations using spreadsheets, SQL and PowerBI with an emphasis on governance functions for quality, consistency, and efficiency in Resource Acquisition team’s RFP evaluation reporting and documentation.

Job Responsibilities
Design and create standardized PowerBI based dashboard reporting and summarize RFP proposal quantitative and qualitative evaluation analysis, metrics and results
Create and implement data auditing processes to ensure report accuracy

Partner with other team members to develop business metrics for senior management reviews
Collaborate with other internal stakeholders to effectively prioritize new initiatives, issues, and related reporting processes

Currently enrolled as a sophomore of higher in finance, business analytics, computer science, statistics, economics, or a related field
Desired Qualifications
Strong computer skills including MS Excel, PowerPoint, and data visualization software especially PowerBI
Advanced written, verbal, and quantitative skills
Solid ability to work under time constraints and meet tight deadlines
Ability to work independently in a multifaceted fast paced environment, with minimal supervision
Experience with SQL and other data visualization tools a plus
Experience working in a regulated utility company a plus

Work Environment:
This position allows for a hybrid in-office and at-home work approach along with a flexible work schedule (must be located in WA state)
