Full Job Description
Stonebranch builds dynamic IT automation solutions that transform business IT environments from simple IT task automation into sophisticated, real-time business service automation, helping organizations achieve the highest possible Return on Automation. No matter the degree of automation, Stonebranch software is simple, modern and secure. Using its universal automation platform, enterprises can seamlessly orchestrate workloads and data across technology ecosystems and silos. Headquartered in Alpharetta, Georgia with points of contact and support throughout the Americas, Europe, and Asia, Stonebranch serves some of the world's largest financial, manufacturing, healthcare, travel, transportation, energy, and technology institutions.

Your Part in this Growth Story:
Stonebranch is searching for a Project Management Intern who’s interested in playing in the explosive IT automation market. In this role you will support one or more Project Managers in managing scope, cost, schedule, internal staffing and outside vendors, and contractual deliverables. You will help manage and direct the work of a project team. You will help and support the preparation of project plans, communication plans, kick-off meetings, status meetings, produce status-reports, among others.

The ideal candidate will be interested in understanding how work is coordinated, controlled and carried out when big teams and large infrastructure is involved, is interested in advancing his/her practical experience by following directions from senior resources and dedicating him/herself to the development and knowledge of Project Management practice. Dexterity in dealing with MS Office suite of applications would be highly desired including (MS Word, MS Excel, MS PowerPoint and MS Project).

Your Impact on The Organization:
Create, maintain, and communicate project and communication plans and processes.
Plan, communicate and execute kick-off meetings with client and internal resources.
Support the definition and communication of project responsibilities with stakeholders (sponsors, clients, technical staff among others).
Support and carry out the defined Project Plan in terms of resource and budget.
Manage the project tasks, and their individual assignees to ensure they are accomplished in the allotted time.
Manage the project budget reporting on the project progress along with its expenditures.
Manage the project scope, triggering the change control process whenever necessary and carrying the process through until completion.
Maintain project time frames, budgets, and status reports.
Coordinate meetings among team members including multiple stakeholders having the ability of documenting them in writing so as to follow up on the decisions and action items agreed upon.

What You Will Bring to the Team:
Full-time student pursuing undergraduate degree in one of the following fields or related studies: Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, or Business Management.
Excellent facilitation skills with the ability of clearly communicating ideas, tasks, deadlines, and other information related to projects.
Strong sense of urgency to act in a timely manner on the multiple different events of a project.
Good understanding of the Project Management discipline. Some experience participating in a project managed initiative would be a plus.
Superior written and verbal communication skills.
Knowledge of the applications of the MS Office Suite (MS Word, MS Powerpoint, MS Excel and MS Project.
A customer-oriented service attitude and the ability to interact with customers in professional, courteous, and objective manner.

Why You’ll Love Stonebranch:
Competitive compensation
Workforce fitness program / gym reimbursement
Excellent health benefits
401k to help you save for your future
Regular social events
Paid holidays and generous time off policy to rest and recharge
Convenient North-Atlanta location

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against applicants due to race, ethnicity, gender, veteran status, or on the basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

position: College to Corporate IT Internship - Risk & Security
description:
Full Job Description
Bring courage and clarity to risk and security

At Vanguard, we’re changing the way the world invests by always doing the right thing for our clients. That means security is more than a priority; it’s fundamental to our purpose. Protecting our investors from risk requires clear goals, big ideas and resolute action. As part of our College to Corporate Internship Program in the Risk and Security track, you’ll build solutions that keep Vanguard safe day in and day out – protecting twenty million investors from ever-evolving threats by staying one step ahead. Make it count.

In this program you will:
Help to drive security strategy for a people-centric organization
Develop your technical skills and business knowledge
Learn by working side by side with industry authorities on high-profile projects and through coaching with our Risk, HR, and IT leadership teams
Gain exposure to the latest thinking on digital ethics, online security, risk analysis, fraud mitigation, system modification and threat detection
Learn not only the technical components of risk and security, but how to effectively communicate risk and security topics to our business partners

What it takes:
In pursuit of a bachelor's or master's degree with a concentration in computer science, computer engineering, IST, IT, CIS, Security Risk Analysis or related technical/engineering discipline required
Cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher preferred
Proven leadership skills
Effective analytical, communication skills

Special Factors

Vanguard is not offering sponsorship for this position

This position will begin in the summer of 2022 and last approximately 10 weeks.

About Vanguard

We are Vanguard. Together, we’re changing the way the world invests.

For us, investing doesn’t just end in value. It starts with values. Because when you invest with courage, when you invest with clarity, and when you invest with care, you can get so much more in return. We invest with purpose – and that’s how we’ve become a global market leader. Here, we grow by doing the right thing for the people we serve. And so can you.

We want to make success accessible to everyone. This is our opportunity. Let’s make it count.

Inclusion Statement

Vanguard’s continued commitment to diversity and inclusion is firmly rooted in our culture. Every decision we make to best serve our clients, crew (internally employees are referred to as crew), and communities is guided by one simple statement: “Do the right thing.”

We believe that a critical aspect of doing the right thing requires building diverse, inclusive, and highly effective teams of individuals who are as unique as the clients they serve. We empower our crew to contribute their distinct strengths to achieving Vanguard’s core purpose through our values.

When all crew members feel valued and included, our ability to collaborate and innovate is amplified, and we are united in delivering on Vanguard's core purpose.

Our core purpose: To take a stand for all investors, to treat them fairly, and to give them the best chance for investment success.

Full Job Description
Typical Day in the Life

A typical day as an Audit Intern (full-time, August through November)﻿ -- SOC (System and Organization Control) at Eide Bailly might include the following:

  • Attend client meetings with a service organization to determine the testing plan for their internal controls, including operation and information technology controls.
  • Prepare a SOC report through a paperless environment.
  • Attend meetings with Eide Bailly staff, managers and partners regarding planning for future SOC engagements, performing current SOC engagements and wrapping up prior SOC engagements.
Who You Are

  • You are inquisitive and enjoy learning about various client business processes and traveling to different locations to help clients (25-50 percent travel is required in the role).
  • You like the challenge of working on SOC engagements and helping clients succeed.
  • You are a multi-tasking master, and there has never been a deadline you could not meet.
  • You have interest in a variety of industries.
  • You hold yourself to the highest professional standards and maintain strict client confidentiality.
  • In addition to all of this, you are working toward a bachelor's degree in Accounting and/or Information Technology - and are on track to sit for your CPA license.
What To Expect Next

We'll be in touch! If you look like the right fit for our position, one of our recruiters will be reaching out to schedule a phone interview with you to learn more about your career interests and goals. In the meantime, we encourage you to check us out on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, LinkedIn or our About Us page.

#LI-DNP

Who We Are

Eide Bailly is one of the top 25 CPA and business advisory firms in the nation. We have over 40 offices in 14 states across the Midwest and western United States, and offer our staff and Partners the opportunity to serve a variety of industries. Founded in 1917, our culture is the foundation of who we are, and we pride ourselves on supporting our employees to help them achieve their goals and pursue their interests both in the office and at home. At Eide Bailly we are passionate about the clients we serve, the work we do, and most importantly, having fun while we do it!

Why You'll Love Working Here

At Eide Bailly we believe respect is how to treat everyone, not just those you want to impress. Our culture focuses on collaboration to achieve career growth. We promote happy employees by making work/life balance a priority along with being actively involved in our communities. Our dedication to service can be seen through the Firm's decision to match charitable donations made by employees, as well as providing opportunities to volunteer throughout the year. Most importantly, we like to have fun! We offer a professional and fun work environment with frequent free lunches, snacks, lunch and learns, socials, contests, outings and other events.

Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

Full Job Description
Meet MedPro Group. We’re an industry-leading Berkshire Hathaway insurance company with a passion for our clients and our team. We are hundreds of professionals with varied backgrounds and experience levels who came together to achieve one goal: protecting those who have made it their mission to serve and care for others. Never considered the insurance industry before? We think you should.

In this role, you will…

Develop and support the implementation of configurations in Duck Creek Suite Distribution Management and integrations with other applications
Plan, execute, and document unit testing.
Participate in peer reviews.
Support the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and participate in the development sprints.
Develop and support Proof of Concept (POC) projects as required.

Participate in developing documentation and job aid documents.

We are looking for candidates with…

A minimum of a sophomore in college pursuing a BS degree, with a 3.0 or better GPA.
A computer science related major.
Year round availability: part-time up to 20 hours during school, full-time during summer if not taking classes.
Experience with XML, XSLT, XPath and JSON.
Experience in development with the Java programming language and an Integrated Development Environment (i.e. Eclipse).
Experience with SQL Database queries and stored procedures.
Experience with SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) is preferred.
Experience with Azure or AWS hosted Cloud environments and Web Services is preferred.
Experience with a version control management system (i.e. Git) is preferred.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
Excellent organizational, leadership and communication (verbal and written) skills.
Ability to work effectively in a team environment or independently.
Proficient in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
Authorization to work in the United States without requiring visa sponsorship, both now and in the future.

Why MedPro?
MedPro Group’s mission is built on a century-old legacy of protecting those who protect others. From our roots in our hometown of Fort Wayne, Indiana, we've worked diligently to become the nation's premier healthcare liability coverage provider, currently insuring more than 300,000 customers. With that growth, we've built a significant presence in all 50 states and internationally. Our team works across the country to provide the best strategies to mitigate risk and preserve the reputations of those who have entrusted their good name to us. That passion – built on a foundation of a culture that values uncompromised integrity, obsessive client focus, great teamwork, and a long-term mindset – make MedPro a preferred employer that many call their career home.

Full Job Description
Job description – IT Data Science Intern

Summary

Ascend is seeking motivated students to join the IT Data Science team working from our Houston headquarters location. Interns will work with the data science team members and subject matter experts (SMEs) in the business to implement solutions to operate assets and processes more safely and efficiently. This is a hands-on internship. Interns will have the opportunity to apply functional skills and safety principles in a manufacturing environment while working on projects under the guidance and assistance of experienced team members. These projects may include process improvement, identifying and troubleshooting issues and developing the business’ big data platform. Through these hands-on experiences, interns will further develop their skill set and build relationships with data science and IT professionals.

To be eligible, candidates must be enrolled in an accredited college or university and preferably with 36 semester hours in a Computer Science, Statistics, Math or related STEM discipline or demonstrate equivalent experience. They must be in good academic standing and have a cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher.

This position requires strong interpersonal skills and drive for customer satisfaction. The successful candidate must be able to follow direction, ask for clarification, demonstrate business aptitude, solid analytical and problem-solving skills. They must have good written and verbal communication skills and be able to learn and adapt with new technologies.

Successful completion of the internship program will follow with a presentation to the team and fellow interns. The presentation will include an overview of what the intern learned from the program, the projects worked, and the intern’s overall experience.

Key Responsibilities

Perform data science projects targeted at process improvement within operations; i.e., increase efficiency, reliability (up-time) and stable operations.
Help translate SME requirements into practical solutions to problems or challenges in manufacturing assets or processes
Perform validation and testing to ensure solutions meet customer needs
Maintain models & data to ensure continued performance and to improve performance over time
Provide technical and administrative support for systems and related applications and services
Perform other duties as assigned by supervisor
Communicate technical concepts at a level appropriate for the audience
Students in this role must be local to Houston and have reliable transportation daily to get to and from our downtown headquarters location (1010 Travis St).

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

Experience applying big data tools in Python, R, Matlab or similar coding environments
Exposure to deep learning frameworks such as PyTorch or Tensorflow.
Experience and demonstrated technical skills in machine learning: regression medeling and forecasting.
Experience working in big data platforms, such as, Microsoft Azure a plus.
Ability to translate real-world manufacturing & process challenges into data & model solutions that address customer needs
Demonstrated proficiency with Microsoft desktop applications and various analytical products; such as, Excel, PowerBI or similar products
Understanding of fundamental big data concepts, processes and tools.

Employees in this position must possess mobility to work in a standard office setting and to use standard office equipment, including a computer; stamina to sit or stand and maintain attention to detail despite interruptions; may occasionally lift/carry/push/pull up to 25 pounds; may require occasional walking, climbing, stooping, crouching, and/or bending; and vision to read printed materials and a computer screen, and hearing and speech to communicate in person and over the telephone. May require the ability to travel by air or auto. May require the use of personal protective equipment such as safety glasses, safety shoes, and shop coat.

Skills Summary:
About Us:
Ascend Performance Materials is the premium provider of high quality chemicals, fibers and plastics. With world scale integrated manufacturing facilities we are able to develop new products from our core technologies, and provide flexibility to respond to the expanding needs of customers. Ascend has global sales and distribution facilities across the globe and six manufacturing facilities globally. As a privately-held company, our people do big things and make big decisions, often much earlier in their careers than at larger companies. Ascend Performance Materials offers team members the opportunity to contribute in big, meaningful ways—all within a stable and growing business.

Why work at Ascend?

Our vision is to be the recognized leader in the nylon 6,6 value chain, creating new possibilities with PA66 for everyone, everywhere, every day. We achieve that through living our Ascend values.

We care . We operate safely with high integrity for our employees, our customers and our communities. Our people are our greatest assets, and our Total Rewards Program extends beyond traditional benefits to include access to on-site medical clinics at our U.S. facilities, a global wellness rewards program and Performance Matters, an employee-driven recognition plan. Our Commitment to Zero demonstrates our belief that is it possible to operate with zero personal injuries, zero process safety incidents and zero environmental releases. And the Ascend Cares Foundation, led by Ascend employees, supports Ascend families in times of need, provides inspiring opportunities for community engagement and facilitates community leadership.

Customer-focused . We exist for our customers; they drive our actions. Their success is our success. Our plastics and chemicals are building blocks that help make everyday essentials safer and more sustainable, and we constantly strive to develop new and innovative products to meet the future needs of our customers. And that customer focus doesn’t only apply to the marketplace – it also applies to how we treat our colleagues and our fellow community members.

Better every day . We invest in our people and our processes to improve every day. A2E, our continuous improvement program, guides the way we do business. And this way of problem solving applies not only to our manufacturing practices but also to our commitment to developing our people. You’ll see it during your career at Ascend in our leadership development, skills training and mentoring programs

Agile . We think broadly and lead proactively in a constantly evolving organization and industry. Agility doesn’t mean simply working quickly – it means critical thinking, creative problem solving and novel approaches to everyday challenges.

One Ascend . All together, with a common set of goals and an eye toward the future. We don’t accept silos. We look for ways to share across departments, sites and geography. This means you won’t be boxed into a single role at Ascend – you could get the chance to work with teams across the globe to improve the way we serve our people, our customers and our communities.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, national origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status, citizenship, genetic information or other protected status under federal, state or local laws.

position: 2022 Trading and Portfolio Finance Summer Analyst
description:
Full Job Description
AQR Capital Management

AQR is a global investment firm built at the intersection of financial theory and practical application. We strive to deliver concrete, long-term results by looking past market noise to identify and isolate the factors that matter most, and by developing ideas that stand up to rigorous testing. By putting theory into practice, we have become a leader in alternative strategies and an innovator in traditional portfolio management since 1998.

At AQR, our employees share a common spirit of academic excellence, intellectual honesty and an unwavering commitment to seeking the truth. We're determined to know what makes financial markets tick – and we'll ask every question and challenge every assumption. We recognize and respect the power of collaboration and believe transparency and openness to new ideas leads to innovation.

The Internship Program

Our 10-week summer program puts real work of the firm in your hands. You will work alongside brilliant people, gain insights and know-how from our Quanta Academy Summer Term curriculum, and experience what it's like to work at the pinnacle of global, systematic investing.

Learning is the cornerstone of our culture and plays an active role in the internship experience — through daily collaboration and interaction with employees at all levels, in workshops and classes, and most significantly by working on projects that matter to the many clients we serve. Our unique AQR Quanta Academy: Summer Term learning series, a structured program, consists of over 40 hours of educational, skill-building and networking events.

The Team

The Trading and Financing team is responsible for efficient trade execution of AQR's investment strategies. The team is comprised of traders, trading assistants, trading infrastructure and trading algorithm developers as well as market microstructure and short-term signal researchers. The department:

Is Responsible for all the firm's global trading on exchanges, SEFs and OTC markets

Develops and evaluates algorithmic trading methodologies in many asset classes

Performs transaction cost analysis in markets that the firm transacts in and builds cost forecasting models for use in AQR's investment strategies

Assists Portfolio Implementation and Research Teams in the management of portfolios and the refinement of the investment process

The Portfolio Finance team consists of highly dynamic and multi-faceted professionals with extensive experience at both buy-side and sell-side firms. As one of the most recently formed and actively growing departments at AQR, Portfolio Finance has three primary responsibilities:

Optimizing the traditional and synthetic financing utilization of the firm across all the breath of asset classes traded by the firm, including associated collateral requirements, instrument types (i.e., derivatives or securities), and investment strategies

Investing and portfolio management of domestic and foreign, cash and cash-equivalent instruments

Managing AQR's critical relationships and numerous touchpoints with the largest firms on Wall Street.

Your Role

We are seeking exceptionally talented individuals to join our Trading and Financing team as interns. Candidates should be ambitious and enthusiastic about implementing new ideas, working within the trading desk and with others in the firm to enhance current processes as a self-starter. Interns will experience a 10-week rotational program throughout functions of the team. Interns will fully immerse in the daily functions of high touch and electronic execution trading, portfolio finance, business management and trade support teams. A rotation through some subset of these functions is planned in order to expose the candidate to multiple functions of the team. You will work in a collaborative environment and on an individual capstone project throughout the summer. Mentorship and constructive performance review will be a focus throughout your time as you work towards earning a full-time role.

What You'll Bring

December 2022 or Winter/Spring 2023 graduate in Finance, Economics, Mathematics, Business, Engineering, or scientific related field

Well-organized, detail-oriented, and strong verbal and written communication skills

Hard-working and eager to learn in a highly intellectual, collaborative environment

Demonstrated interest in finance, economics, and capital markets

Strong technical/quantitative skills

Computer science/programming skills preferred

AQR is an Equal Opportunity Employer. EEO/VET/DISABILITY

description:
Full Job Description
About Our Company

Morf3D is a metal additive manufacturing (AM) supplier for the aerospace industry, focused on the manufacture and certification of production flight hardware to customer requirements. Our objective is to support industry growth through the adoption of AM technology into the design lifecycle by providing development and application of AM design and material technologies.
Position Overview

The Software Engineering Intern will assist in the programming and development of internal project management systems. Using Flask, Microsoft SQL Server, and basic front-end (HTML, CSS, JS) technologies, the Software Engineering Intern will be responsible for writing code which supports the front-end, back-end, and optimization of legacy code. Because these internal project management systems are used by teams across the organization, this role requires an individual who can accommodate input, requests, and questions from non-technical employees. This role will also be project-based and will require an individual who can work independently with the support of a small team.

The Software Engineering Intern will report to the CTO, through the Lead Software Engineer.

Responsibilities

Responsible for writing clean code according to best practices

Responsible for collaboration with team members to strengthen personal technical capabilities and developing software solutions which meet the needs of the organization

Responsible for maintaining a professional and friendly manner

Job Duties

Develops web systems by designing, developing, testing, and maintaining software solutions

Documents and demonstrates solutions by developing documentation, code comments, and clear code

Confer with engineers, managers, technicians, quality engineers and inspectors, manufacturing technicians, and other technical and customer related services as needed to develop software solutions or to select appropriate solutions

Reports about project status and updates to management and relevant stakeholders

Skills

REQUIRED: Python (Intermediate level)

REQUIRED: HTML, CSS, JS (Intermediate level)

REQUIRED: SQL (Basic)

PREFERRED: Flask

PREFERRED: Git for version control

Strong logic and reasoning to perform trade-offs and solution complex problems

Strong sense of collaboration, with a spirit towards problem-solving

Education / Experience / General Requirements

In-Progress Bachelor's degree (Computer Systems, Computer Science, Math OR Software Engineering)

PREFERRED: 2+ years of experience in software development

REQUIRED: Compliant with the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) which requires U.S. person status (ITAR defines "U.S. Person" as a U.S. Citizen or U.S. Permanent Resident

Work Environment and Safety Requirements

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounter while performing the essential functions of the job.

Ability to wear personal protective gear correctly for up to one hour, including gloves, hearing protection, eye protection, protective footwear, and respirators

Ability to learn technical material relating to software systems

Ability to remain in a stationary position for up to three hours

Ability to operate digital applications on an interface, such as a tablet or smartphone

Ability to communicate with teammates and internal stakeholders with daily updates, hazard concerns, questions, and issues

Morf3D is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. We believe that a diverse workforce creates an environment in which unique ideas are developed and differing perspectives are valued, producing superior customer solutions. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, age, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, and related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, color, religion, genetic information, marital status, ancestry, national origin, protected veteran status, physical disability, medical condition, mental disability, or disability status and any other characteristic protected by state or federal law.

Before applying, please note: Morf3D is an ITAR-compliant Company. Applicants MUST be a U.S. citizen as defined by ITAR (22 CFR 120.15) or eligible to obtain the required authorizations from the U.S. Department of State.

position: Intern, Hardware in The Loop (HiL), Fall 2021
description:
Full Job Description
Leading the future of luxury mobility

Lucid’s mission is to inspire the adoption of sustainable energy by creating the most captivating luxury electric vehicles, centered around the human experience. Working at Lucid Motors means having a shared vision to power the future in revolutionary ways. Be part of a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to transform the automotive industry.

We are currently seeking an Intern, Hardware in The Loop (HiL). This position requires an experienced professional with an interest in testing, specifically in Hardware in The Loop (HiL), and data analysis. Our ideal candidate exhibits a can-do attitude and approaches his or her work with vigor and determination. Candidates will be expected to demonstrate excellence in their respective fields, to possess the ability to learn quickly and to strive for perfection within a fast-paced environment.

Role/ Responsibilities:
Set up test/hardware-in-loop simulation environment for electric vehicle (EV) controllers
Develop comprehensive test scenarios and test procedures for ECU under test
Verify communication and electrical integration of vehicle controllers matches with system bench
Develop test automation scripts using Python/ ECU-test and debug any script execution error
Review data collected during tests, and run to identify issues or deviations from expectations

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience using Matlab, Simulink, or Stateflow
Experience working with Python or C
Understanding of Digital Electronics
Understanding of embedded and real-time systems

Nice to Haves:
Experience with CAN and/or Ethernet communication
Experience using dSPACE Hardware-in-loop simulations
Experience using Vector tools such as CANape, CANalyzer, CANoe, etc.

Education:
Field(s) of study: Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Automotive, or Mechanical Engineering
Will consider undergrads Sophomore level and above: Associate’s, Bachelor’s, Post-Secondary
Graduates are eligible for this internship up to 12 months after graduation

Programming Timing:
Start Date: September 7th, 2021
End Date: November 26th- December 23rd
Our internship program is 12-16 weeks; end date is flexible based on individual needs.
Some flexibility with start date is available as needed.

Other:
Location: This position is in Newark, CA. You must be prepared to start onsite for your first day of employment
Availability: Full – Time is preferred
Anticipated Hours: 8:30am – 5:30pm
Work Environment: Mix - Split between: Office/ Lab/ Bay
Compensation: Student compensation is based on location and current degree level, non-negotiable.
Visa Sponsorship: Lucid may but is not obligated to sponsor foreign national employees requiring company sponsorship for U.S. employment authorization.
Medical benefits: Dental and vision on day 1 for all interns working 30+ hours a week; medical for interns in California working 30+ hours a week.
Housing: No compensation for housing.
Bonus: No signing bonus, relocation bonus, equity, or other bonuses.
Relocation: Round trip flight from/to permanent residence.
Housing/Transportation: You must provide your own living arrangements and transportation in the local area.
Background Check: All offers of employment are contingent on clearing a background check.
Publications: This internship may involve access to and/or knowledge of Lucid confidential and proprietary information. As a requirement of accepting an offer of employment with Lucid Motors you will agree to keep all such information confidential and not disclose such information to any third party including but not limited to research papers, thesis, dissertation, school papers or any other publication in any form without prior written approval from Lucid Legal Department.
Be part of something amazing

Come work alongside some of the most accomplished minds in the industry. Beyond providing competitive salaries, we’re providing a community for innovators who want to make an immediate and significant impact. If you are driven to create a better, more sustainable future, then this is the right place for you.

At Lucid, we don’t just welcome diversity - we celebrate it! Lucid Motors is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity and expression, marital status, and any other characteristic protected under applicable State or Federal laws and regulations.

To all recruitment agencies: Lucid Motors does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our careers alias or other Lucid Motors employees. Lucid Motors is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

About Streamline:
Streamline’s mission is to build innovative technology solutions that empower people who improve behavioral health and quality of life of those in need. Regression testing of client Smartcare applications as part of the Build Upgrade Process; Testers will utilize testing scripts to determine pass/fail status of complex customer business processes and core Smartcare functionalities.
Under the guidance of a Customer Support Specialist, Interns will manage customer support projects, by reviewing and managing tasks, testing tasks to be verified, and communicating updates both internally and to customers.
Create new tasks based on issues reported by customers, replicate reported issue and communicate status internally and with customers.

Frequent communication and meetings with other team members including project managers, developers, testers and other internal staff.

Associates degree in one of the following fields: Computer Information Systems, Computer Science, Health Informatics, or Business Administration,.Bachelor's degree from four-year college or university preferred.
Complex problem solving skills
Strong attention to detail
Ability to work independently, with minimal supervision
Knowledge of software testing methods, or programming desirable
Medical software experience helpful
Experience with Office Suite Software (i.e. Google Suite or MS Office)
Spreadsheet Software-Microsoft Excel, Google Sheets

Streamline Healthcare Solutions provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Streamline complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities, and shall also follow the requirements of the Human Rights Law with regard to non- discrimination on the basis of prior criminal conviction and prior arrest.

position: College to Corporate IT Internship - Application Development
description:
Full Job Description
Put your technical mind to work

Do you want to work on new technologies? Are you ready to put your classroom experience into action? Vanguard’s College to Corporate Internship Program is an immersive, hands-on experience at one of the world’s leading investment firms. Extensive training, real-world experience, hands-on opportunities and mentorship from professionals will all aid in broadening your technical expertise in Application Development. You’ll receive exposure to a variety of aspects of the software life cycle and positively impact our clients through challenging assignments like LEAN development, UI Design, and cloud computing. Make it count.

In this program you will:
Create high-impact solutions that allow crew to perform at their best and do what’s right for investors
Gain hands-on experience in Agile software development and practice LEAN methodology in a dynamic environment with crew from around the business
Share your insights and make your voice heard in a collaborative and supportive environment
Receive an opportunity to build a network with program managers, alumni, senior leaders and other interns
Participate in developmental activities such as one-on-one feedback sessions, Tips for Success, and Industry Discussions

What it takes

In pursuit of a bachelor's or master's degree with a concentration in computer science, computer engineering, IST, IT, CIS, Security Risk Analysis or related technical/engineering discipline required

Cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher preferred

Proven leadership skills

Effective analytical, communication, interpersonal and problem-solving skills

Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a dynamic environment

Special Factors

Vanguard is not offering sponsorship for this position

This position will begin in the summer of 2022 and last approximately 10 weeks.

About Vanguard

We are Vanguard. Together, we’re changing the way the world invests.

For us, investing doesn’t just end in value. It starts with values. Because when you invest with courage, when you invest with clarity, and when you invest with care, you can get so much more in return. We invest with purpose – and that’s how we’ve become a global market leader. Here, we grow by doing the right thing for the people we serve. And so can you.

We want to make success accessible to everyone. This is our opportunity. Let’s make it count.

Inclusion Statement

Vanguard’s continued commitment to diversity and inclusion is firmly rooted in our culture. Every decision we make to best serve our clients, crew (internally employees are referred to as crew), and communities is guided by one simple statement: “Do the right thing.”

We believe that a critical aspect of doing the right thing requires building diverse, inclusive, and highly effective teams of individuals who are as unique as the clients they serve. We empower our crew to contribute their distinct strengths to achieving Vanguard’s core purpose through our values.

When all crew members feel valued and included, our ability to collaborate and innovate is amplified, and we are united in delivering on Vanguard's core purpose.

Our core purpose: To take a stand for all investors, to treat them fairly, and to give them the best chance for investment success.

Full Job Description
JOB
Salary Information$20.00 per hourThis position is limited to a maximum of 944 hours in a fiscal year. Hours of work are a minimum of 20 hours per week and may not exceed 35 hours per week under normal working situations.The New Jersey Judiciary is seeking an intern to work with the Information Security Unit (ISU). The individuals will work Level 1 information security support. This will include resolving help desk tickets, incident response tickets, and a variety of additional work in information security utilizing latest information security techniques.Note: This position has a non-traditional work week.

EXAMPLE OF DUTIES
Perform Authentication requests and ensure proper authorization is received and follow proper procedure to create/change the account/user IDPerform Application Access requests and ensure proper authorization is received and follow procedure to set up requested level of accessWork with Information Security Unit on research and data gathering needed for automating manual tasksOther responsibilities include Security Administration of various information security systems and help with projects under the guidance of the Information Security AnalystsStrictly adhere to the CIA Triad (Confidentiality, Integrity, Availability), relevant governance standards, and all Judiciary and industry information security best practices

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Thirty credit hours from an accredited college pursuing a degree or certificate in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related field. Other majors interested in Information Security also welcome.Unofficial College or University transcript must be included in your application in order to be considered.

SUPPLEMENTAL INFORMATION
Driver's License: Appointee will be required to possess a driver's license valid in New Jersey only if the operation of a vehicle is necessary to perform essential duties of the position. Authorization to Work: US citizenship is not required. Selected candidate must be authorized to work in the US according to Department of Homeland Security, US Citizenship and Immigration Services regulations. Special Note: Newly hired employees must agree to a thorough background check that will include fingerprinting. All data received will be kept in strict confidence except to inform the individual of the findings and what action will be taken as a result of this information. Residency Law: Pursuant to N.J.S.A. 52:14-7 (L. 2011, Chapter 70), also known as the "New Jersey First Act," all persons newly hired by the Judiciary must establish, and then maintain, principal residence in the State of New Jersey.The NJ Judiciary requires all applicants to complete the application process fully and as instructed. All applicants must complete the work experience and education sections and attach any required documents. Applications must describe all relevant work experience in detail, beginning with your current or most recent job, including military service (indicate rank), internships and job-related volunteer work, if applicable. Use a separate section to describe each position. Applicants who indicate "see resume" or enter their initials to acknowledge that they have skipped the Work History and Education sections will not be considered, unless they do not possess any education history or work experience. Only applicants that follow the application instructions and submit completed applications will be considered.The New Jersey Judiciary consists of: the Supreme Court, the Superior Court including the Appellate Division and the Trial Court of the 15 vicinages in New Jersey, the Tax Court and the Municipal Court System. The Administrative Office of the Courts provides technical assistance, operational support, training, research and development, budget and personnel coordination, and development and operation of information systems for the Courts of New Jersey. The Judiciary of New Jersey is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer Committed to Ensuring an Open Door to JusticeNeoGov applicant support at 1-855-524-5627 (toll free call)Monday through Friday, 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM Pacific Standard Time (PST)

Full Job Description
Tech Systems Intern

The Tech System Intern is responsible for assisting the IT Operations team with installing, monitoring, maintaining, and supporting IT systems, servers, and networks. This individual will provide these services effectively and efficiently, ensuring maximum success with the implementation of technology services and resources. Also, responsible for end-user software and hardware technical and operational support. This individual will also help in conducting studies of IT Infrastructure/Cloud performance and traffic analysis.

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS

Essential duties may include but are not limited to the following:

Identifies, researches, and resolves technical problem that are reported by customers.
Troubleshooting of Windows and Cisco TCP/IP networks and Cisco VPN.
Meraki and/or FortiNet customer solutions. Support, install, maintain, troubleshoot, and coordinate the usage of any Meraki and/or FortiNet technology.
Network Engineering and support of routers, switches, network security devices, and network management systems.
Understanding of networking protocols (SD-WAN, IPSEC, QoS, 802.11, ACLs, DHCP, TCP/IP, DNS, BLE)
Monitor network data traffic patterns to minimize downtime. Assist with cyber security, monitoring, and reporting.
Assist with maintaining, operating, and troubleshooting wireless infrastructure, telephone systems, and infrastructure technologies.
Maintains and monitors helpdesk system for active tickets.
Documents, tracks, and monitors the problem to ensure a timely resolution.
Responsible for installation, patching and upgrading Microsoft Windows 10, Mac OS, and application software packages.

TRAVEL REQUIREMENT

Less than 25% required

QUALIFICATIONS

Experience troubleshooting a variety of technologies, including but not limited to:
Basic understanding of Microsoft Server Operating Systems.
Basic understanding of Active Directory, DNS, DHCP and network ports and protocols
Basic understanding of Virus Scanning software and Vulnerability Scanning Software.
Understanding of Cloud technologies. Azure, AWS, Google
Meraki and/or FortiNet technology.
Network Engineering and support of routers, switches, network security devices, and network management systems
Microsoft Office 2016, 365
Microsoft Windows 10, Anti-Virus

PC/Printer Hardware, Mobile devices

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE GUIDELINES

Education:progression towards bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Science, or related field

Experience: 1-2 years of related experience

Full Job Description
About CCC

CCC is the technology platform for the underwritten assets economy. CCC technology, insights, and support connect industries – insurers, automotive manufacturers, collision repairers, parts suppliers, lenders, fleet operators and more – to advance decision-making, productivity, and customer experiences for thousands of clients worldwide. Clients leverage CCC’s network management, data management, AI, operational workflows and customer experience solutions to efficiently scale, interact, transact and achieve their unique business objectives. CCC was ranked a best mid-sized company to work for by Forbes (2019). BuiltIn Chicago, Austin and LA named CCC a top place to work in 2020. Diverse perspectives and experiences are core to CCC’s success and award-winning culture of more than 2,000 employees worldwide. We hold inclusion as a core value and are committed to celebrating and cultivating the diversity of our team. With a 40+ year track record of innovation, CCC’s tenacious spirit and growth mindset turn next generation technology into real world solutions and empower team members to expand their knowledge and potential. Headquartered in Chicago, CCC has 11 locations worldwide. CCC’s principal PE investors are Advent International, Technology Crossover Ventures, and Oak Hill Capital Find out more about CCC by visiting cccis.com.

Job Description Summary

We're looking for a Data Engineer to join us for Summer and Fall 2021 semester. This role will be located in downtown Chicago at our HQ, but also open to an intern work remote. At CCC, you will work and learn alongside innovative and inspiring leaders and gain valuable experience working on real business solutions in a corporate setting.

Job Duties

Build data platforms using Python, Spark, Hadoop (and more) which will provide insights to CCC's client within auto property damage and repair, medical claims and telematics IoT industries.
Use Hadoop and Spark ecosystem tools and technology for micro-batch and streaming analytics.
Ingestion, standardization, metadata management, business rule curation, data enhancement, and statistical computation against data sources that include relational, XML, JSON, streaming, REST API, and unstructured data.
Modify and maintain complex SQL and PL/SQL for Oracle ETL and BI/DW data flow.
Work closely with product owners, information engineers, data scientists, data modelers, infrastructure support and data governance positions.

Qualifications

Pursuing a Masters Degree in Computer Science, MIS, or some related field

description:
Full Job Description
Orolia, the world leader in Resilient Positioning, Navigation and Timing (PNT) solutions, always has great opportunities for students to intern with our company and work side by side with our innovative engineers.

Our Internship Opportunities:
Orolia is looking for Interns enrolled in a four-year or post-graduate degree program in the following fields:

Electrical Engineering
Computer Engineering
Computer Science
Signal Processing
Radio Communications

What you’ll be doing:
Our technology at Orolia is innovative and cutting edge. A typical day could be…

Working closely with Lead Engineers in in a lab environment designing the latest GPS-based and alternative PNT equipment and software

Testing new products, new features and software releases to ensure our products meet the highest standards and specifications.

Devising test procedures, experiments, test fixtures and software; performing those tests, analyzing the results and generating comprehensive test reports and recommendations.

Analyzing and debugging problem reports and designing fixes

Working with vendors, subcontractors, and customers to understand their needs and applications toward solving problems in deployments

Working in a multi-discipline, multi-cultural environmental with cross-functional teams toward a common design goal.

What does it take to be successful at Orolia?

Global Collaboration: We pride ourselves on personal excellence through global collaboration, communication and team achievement!

Fun: We are at our best having fun and we bring the best out of each other.

Innovation: We love to develop and implement creative solutions!

Commitment: We persevere in all situations.

Agility: Our business, strategies and our people are ready to adapt to evolving needs of our markets.

Continuous Improvement: We’re curious and we always demonstrate the desire to improve results and challenge the status quo.

Why Orolia?

Orolia is an international high-tech company dedicated to improving the safety, compliance and efficiency of its global customers’ remote operations by providing them business solutions and services based on the most advanced positioning, navigation, timing, sensing, information, and communications technologies. At Orolia, we continuously look to go “Beyond the Frontier” in everything that we do. As an organization, we strive to be the market leader and look for employees who have the same passion for their personal careers. If you love working in a multicultural environment where being the best is encouraged, Orolia is the employer for you.

Orolia believes that success in the global marketplace requires a variety of perspectives and individual experiences. At Orolia, we understand, appreciate and strive for new and different thoughts and ideas. A high degree of employee involvement, lifelong learning and diversity are permanent items on the agenda throughout the entire organization.

Please note this description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

Orolia is an equal opportunity employer who does not discriminate based on race, color, citizenship, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, veteran’s status or any protected category. We encourage veterans and people with disabilities to apply.

position: College to Corporate IT Internship - Technology Operations
description:
Full Job Description
Build your skills for the future

Do you want to work on new technologies? Are you ready to put your classroom experience into action? Vanguard’s College to Corporate Internship Program is an immersive, hands-on experience at one of the world’s leading investment firms. Extensive training, real-world experience, hands-on opportunities and mentorship from professionals will all aid in broadening your technical expertise in Technology Operations. You’ll receive exposure to a variety of aspects of our enterprise operations and positively impact our clients through challenging assignments like infrastructure operations, network engineering, end user computing, and enterprise architecture. Make it count.

About this program:
The program is a full-time, paid summer internship available in Charlotte, NC.
You’ll receive exposure to a variety of aspects of the software life cycle and positively impact our clients through one of these challenging assignments:
Networking services and Telecommunications
Supporting Unix & Linux or Windows platforms
Capacity planning
Performance analysis
Supporting video and voice technologies

In this program, you will

Create high-impact solutions that allow crew to perform at their best and do what’s right for investors
Gain hands-on experience that will aid in broadening your technical expertise in technology operations
Share your insights and make your voice heard in a collaborative and supportive environment
Receive an opportunity to build a network with program managers, alumni, senior leaders and other interns
Participate in developmental activities such as one-on-one feedback sessions, Tips for Success, and Industry Discussions

As an intern, you will build skills using some of the latest technology

Databases: DB2, Oracle, SQL Server
Platforms/Servers: zOS, Solaris, Windows, Linux, Web and Application.NET, Spring, Web Services, Web, Mobile apps (iOS, Android)
Languages/Tools: Java, JSF, Ajax, JavaScript, C/C++/C#, XML, XSLT, HTML, XHTML, CSS, Cobol, Maven, Hudson, Subversion, Nexus, JTest, Sharepoint, AngularJS, Selenium
Concepts: Distributed systems, Tiered development, Data Driven decision making. Service Oriented Architecture, responsive design, Automated Testing

What it takes

In pursuit of a bachelor's or master's degree with a concentration in computer science, computer engineering, IST, IT, CIS, Security Risk Analysis or related technical/engineering discipline required
Cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher preferred
Proven leadership skills
Effective analytical, communication, interpersonal and problem-solving skills
Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a dynamic environment

Special Factors

Vanguard is not offering sponsorship for this position

This position will begin in the summer of 2022 and last approximately 10 weeks.

About Vanguard

We are Vanguard. Together, we’re changing the way the world invests.

For us, investing doesn’t just end in value. It starts with values. Because when you invest with courage, when you invest with clarity, and when you invest with care, you can get so much more in return. We invest with purpose – and that’s how we’ve become a global market leader. Here, we grow by doing the right thing for the people we serve. And so can you.

We want to make success accessible to everyone. This is our opportunity. Let’s make it count.

Inclusion Statement

Vanguard’s continued commitment to diversity and inclusion is firmly rooted in our culture. Every decision we make to best serve our clients, crew (internally employees are referred to as crew), and communities is guided by one simple statement: “Do the right thing.”

We believe that a critical aspect of doing the right thing requires building diverse, inclusive, and highly effective teams of individuals who are as unique as the clients they serve. We empower our crew to contribute their distinct strengths to achieving Vanguard’s core purpose through our values.

When all crew members feel valued and included, our ability to collaborate and innovate is amplified, and we are united in delivering on Vanguard's core purpose.

Our core purpose: To take a stand for all investors, to treat them fairly, and to give them the best chance for investment success.

Full Job Description
Leading the future of luxury mobility

Lucid’s mission is to inspire the adoption of sustainable energy by creating the most captivating luxury electric vehicles, centered around the human experience. Working at Lucid Motors means having a shared vision to power the future in revolutionary ways. Be part of a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to transform the automotive industry.

Lucid Motors is looking for a highly motivated Manufacturing Controls Engineering Intern to work in a challenging and fast-paced environment where you will work with highly motivated teams that are dedicated to world-class quality standards on extremely challenging projects. The Manufacturing Controls Engineering interns work with cross-functional teams including Operations, Maintenance and Design Engineering for improving manufacturing equipment and processes throughout the entire product lifecycle. You will learn how to troubleshoot issues with electrical and mechanical systems and controls software. You will participate in creating standards and developing new equipment.

The Role:
Improve Human Machine Interface (HMI) screens and Programmable Logic Controller (PLC) code to make equipment easier to operate, by providing detailed data and notifications to the operator.
Interface automated equipment and manual workstations with the Manufacturing Execution System
Create detailed Manufacturing Instructions to document manufacturing processes
Review supplier designs and code for new equipment development
Create controls hardware and software standards for future equipment

Qualifications:
Pursuing BS/MS in Mechanical Engineering, Manufacturing Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent
Ability to communicate topics/issues clearly with technical details and backed by data
Familiarity with commonly used electrical and mechanical hand tools
Interest in working in a factory environment on automated manufacturing equipment
Interest in learning about a cutting-edge electric vehicle, how it is made and how it works
Exemplary verbal and written communication skills
Graduates are eligible for this internship up to 12 months after graduation

Program Timing:
Start Date: September 7th, 2021

End Date: November 26th – December 23rd
Our internship program is 12 – 16 weeks; the end date is flexible based on individual needs.
Some flexibility with the start date is available as needed

Other:

position: SAP iXp Intern, SAP Intelligent Robotic Process Automation
description:
Full Job Description
Requisition ID: 291330
Work Area: Software-Design and Development
Expected Travel: 0 - 10%
Career Status: Student

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

About the SAP Internship Experience Program

The SAP Internship Experience Program is SAP’s global, strategic, paid internship program that provides university students with opportunities to find purpose in their careers.

Three reasons to intern at SAP

1. Culture of collaboration: meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.

2. Project-driven experience: gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.

3. Gain visibility: with SAP Internship Experience Program in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs, and career development opportunities at your fingertips.

About the team:
The SAP Intelligent Robotic Process Automation (RPA) unit consists of a dynamic, fast-growing, and innovative young team in three locations. The goal with our product is to automate business processes that are by nature tedious and manual. SAP Intelligent RPA as an automation suite provides technology to design, orchestrate, run and monitor software robots. The users of our software are at the center of our development processes.

What you’ll do:
Position Title: SAP iXp Intern, SAP Intelligent Robotic Process Automation
Location: Palo Alto, California
Expected start date to end date: August 16, 2021

In this role, you’ll:
We are looking for an intern with high availability who supports the go-to-market and solution management team mastering the high demand and interest in our fast-growing product. You will be involved in go-to-market content creation for resonating with customer needs in the area of intelligent process automation. This role will include understanding SAP´s product launch processes, how to market the product in detail, how to differentiate and position it to customers and enable commercialization processes around that on reporting, content creation, and stakeholder interaction
Work with the solution management team to consolidate information on customer numbers, adoption, and use cases
Build Robotic Process Automation scenarios, release developed scenarios to a broader audience in the form of presentations, videos, demos, customer stories, and other product material
Get hands-on knowledge on the Robotic Process Automation solution and document the best practices
Consolidate feedback from the solution management team on market requirements and collaborate with product management for influencing product roadmap
Be an active member of the solution management team,
Closely collaborate with international development and product management team and support promoting an innovative SAP solution

Who you are:
We’re looking for someone who can challenge the status quo and likes to stay curious. You enjoy working on meaningful projects and are energized by lifelong learning.
Student (f/m/d) at a university or a university of applied sciences with preferred fields of study: computer science
Knowledge of Robotic Process Automation, workflow scripting, Javascript programming is required
Business process knowledge in one of the functional areas such as finance or procurement or human resources or information technology
Attention to detail, creativity, and problem-solving capabilities
Highly interested in learning cloud software applications and a team player with a passion for understanding,
Documenting use cases and structure them
Ability to work independently; demonstrating commitment and a sense of responsibility; flexibility and readiness to learn new skills at short notice
Ability to plan, prioritize and organize work effectively and efficiently
Previous work experience in a similar position is beneficial but not mandatory

SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT

To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas:Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com). Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status or disability.

WHAT YOU GET FROM US

Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own. A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.

description:
Full Job Description
Company Description

Square builds common business tools in unconventional ways so more people can start, run, and grow their businesses. When Square started, it was difficult and expensive (or just plain impossible) for some businesses to take credit cards. Square made credit card payments possible for all by turning a mobile phone into a credit card reader. Since then Square has been building an entire business toolkit of both hardware and software products including Square Capital, Square Terminal, Square Payroll, and more. We’re working to find new and better ways to help businesses succeed on their own terms—and we’re looking for people like you to help shape tomorrow at Square.

Job Description

Square's Hardware Team builds the tangible connection to Square. We started with a simple Reader that turns any phone or tablet into a mobile point of sale - and we continue to lead this category with advances in technologies that define point of sale hardware (NFC, display, WiFi, Bluetooth, touch). Our hardware engineers design and develop outstanding hardware products. They understand the subtleties of user interaction, robust communication interfaces, and smart product design.

For this 12-week remote internship, you will:
Become intimately familiar with Square's hardware products and manufacturing processes.
Research technologies for our next-generation hardware products.
As part of the Systems Engineering track, you will develop device characterization plans and measurement-setup prototypes for new technologies.
As part of the Electrical Design Engineering track, you will help design and test electrical systems for new Square hardware products
Work with Square's Devices Software Engineering group to understand embedded test access and APIs.
Write and debug engineering automation software for the lab and the factory.
Reach beyond boundaries to make Square's products better wherever you see the chance

Qualifications

You are:
Pursuing a degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or related technical field, graduating between May 2022 and June 2024.
Familiar with Python, MATLAB, or similar programming language
Experience with EE schematics and PCB layout
EE skills including switch mode power supplies, amplifiers, microcontrollers, batteries and charging systems, and high speed digital signals.
Familiar with hardware lab equipment for test, measurement (e.g. oscilloscope, power supply, function generator, spectrum analyzer, DMM), or prototyping (Soldering, Raspberry Pi, Arduino, 3D printing, powertools)
Excited to work on hands-on projects and to make things work in EE or software realms
Eager to apply engineering skills to dig into challenges that are outside of your expertise.
You're collaborative and excited to work as part of a team, ask questions, and share information to solve problems.

Even better:
Experience measurement systems automation.
Knowledgeable of statistics
Familiar with the co-existence of multiple technologies in a unified system.
Experience with Altium Schematic and PCB design tools

Additional Information

At Square, we value diversity and always treat all employees and job applicants based on merit, qualifications, competence, and talent. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. Applicants in need of special assistance or accommodation during the interview process or in accessing our website may contact us by sending an email to assistance(at)squareup.com. We will treat your request as confidentially as possible. In your email, please include your name and preferred method of contact, and we will respond as soon as possible.

Full Job Description
Leading the future of luxury mobility

Lucid’s mission is to inspire the adoption of sustainable energy by creating the most captivating luxury electric vehicles, centered around the human experience. Working at Lucid Motors means having a shared vision to power the future in revolutionary ways. Be part of a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to transform the automotive industry.

We are currently seeking an Intern, Software Quality and Validation. This position requires an experienced professional with an interest in creating the code for diagnostics testing on EV’s, specifically the Engine Control Units (ECUs). Our ideal candidate exhibits a can-do attitude and approaches his or her work with vigor and determination. Candidates will be expected to demonstrate excellence in their respective fields, to possess the ability to learn quickly and to strive for perfection within a fast-paced environment.

Role/Responsibilities:
System level development and regression testing of Engine Control Unit (ECU) software upgrades
Develop test scripts to automate software upgrades of various Engine Control Unit (ECUs)
Develop Graphical User Interfaces (GUIs) to operate scripts
Collaborate with Diagnostic Systems Engineers and Test Engineers to develop, review and implement test cases

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience in Python scripting
Experience using BUS analysis tools such as CANoe, CANalyzer, or VehSpy
Excellent communication skills

Education:
Field(s) of study: Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Computer Science, or Related Major
Will consider undergrads Sophomore level and above: Associate’s, Bachelor’s, Post-Secondary
Graduates are eligible for this internship up to 12 months after graduation

Programming Timing:
Start Date: September 7th, 2021
End Date: November 26th- December 23rd
Our internship program is 12-16 weeks; end date is flexible based on individual needs.
Some flexibility with start date is available as needed.

Other:
Location: This position is in Newark, CA. You must be prepared to start onsite for your first day of employment
Availability: Full – Time is preferred
Anticipated Hours: 8:30am – 5:30pm
Work Environment: Mix - Split between: Office/ Lab/ Bay
Compensation: Student compensation is based on location and current degree level, non-negotiable.
Visa Sponsorship: Lucid may but is not obligated to sponsor foreign national employees requiring company sponsorship for U.S. employment authorization.
Medical benefits: Dental and vision on day 1 for all interns working 30+ hours a week; medical for interns in California working 30+ hours a week.
Housing: No compensation for housing.
Bonus: No signing bonus, relocation bonus, equity, or other bonuses.
Relocation: Round trip flight from/to permanent residence.
Housing/Transportation: You must provide your own living arrangements and transportation in the local area.
Background Check: All offers of employment are contingent on clearing a background check.
Publications: This internship may involve access to and/or knowledge of Lucid confidential and proprietary information. As a requirement of accepting an offer of employment with Lucid Motors you will agree to keep all such information confidential and not disclose such information to any third party including but not limited to research papers, thesis, dissertation, school papers or any other publication in any form without prior written approval from Lucid Legal Department.
Be part of something amazing

Come work alongside some of the most accomplished minds in the industry. Beyond providing competitive salaries, we’re providing a community for innovators who want to make an immediate and significant impact. If you are driven to create a better, more sustainable future, then this is the right place for you.

At Lucid, we don’t just welcome diversity - we celebrate it! Lucid Motors is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity and expression, marital status, and any other characteristic protected under applicable State or Federal laws and regulations.

To all recruitment agencies: Lucid Motors does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our careers alias or other Lucid Motors employees. Lucid Motors is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.
