description:
Full Job Description
Company Information

PACCAR is a Fortune 500 company established in 1905. PACCAR Inc is recognized as a global leader in the commercial vehicle, financial, and customer service fields with internationally recognized brands such as Kenworth, Peterbilt, and DAF trucks. PACCAR is a global technology leader in the design, manufacture and customer support of high-quality light-, medium-, and heavy-duty trucks under the Kenworth, Peterbilt and DAF nameplates. PACCAR also designs and manufactures advanced diesel engines, provides financial services and information technology, and distributes truck parts related to its principal business.

Whether you want to design the transportation technology of tomorrow, support the staff functions of a dynamic, international leader, or build our excellent products and services — you can develop the career you desire with PACCAR. Get started!

Requisition Summary

Peterbilt Motors Company, a PACCAR Company, has an opening for a Data Analytics - Data Engineering Intern to add to our Data Science Team in Denton, Texas.

Job Functions / Responsibilities
Migrate production data to the cloud and develop production dashboards to improve equipment and operations data analysis leveraging tools like SumoLogic, Tableau, AWS and Snowflake (as part of Connected Manufacturing).
Assist with data cataloging to improve data accessibility awareness.
Qualifications
Working on Masters’ degree in Computer Science, Business, or a related field
Familiarity with in large-scale software development with emphasis on data analytics and high-volume data processing
Experience in data engineering development
Experience implementing scalable data architectures
Experience with AWS and related services (e.g., EC2, S3, DynamoDB, ElasticSearch, SQS, SNS, Lambda, Airflow, Snowflake)
Experience in data-centric programming languages (e.g., Python, GO, Ruby, Javascript, Scala)
Proficiency with ETL tools and techniques.
Knowledge of and experience with RDBMS platforms, such as MS SQL Server, Oracle, DB2, IMS, MySQL, Postgres, SAP HANA, and Teradata.
Experience with participating in projects in a highly collaborative, multi-discipline team environment
Education

The candidate we seek will be working on their Master's Degree in an IT, Business, or related program.

Additional Job Board Information

PACCAR is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veteran/Disability. Peterbilt promotes Diversity and Inclusion through mentorship, events, and affinity support groups – The Diversity Council, Peterbilt Women’s Initiative (PBWin), Veterans Group, and ADVOCATE (An LGBTQ support group).

What you will do
Johnson Controls invites you to apply for an internship located out of our Rockville, MD office. This internship is designed to provide you with a positive work/training experience and challenging objectives. You will work with a team of information technology professionals and business stakeholders to support organizational cybersecurity practices and audit readiness.

Full Job Description
Meet MedPro Group. We’re an industry-leading Berkshire Hathaway insurance company with a passion for our clients and our team. We are hundreds of professionals with varied backgrounds and experience levels who came together to achieve one goal: protecting those who have made it their mission to serve and care for others. Never considered the insurance industry before? We think you should.

In this role, you will…

Develop and support the implementation of configurations in Duck Creek Suite Distribution Management and integrations with other applications
Plan, execute, and document unit testing.
Participate in peer reviews.
Support the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and participate in the development sprints.
Develop and support Proof of Concept (POC) projects as required.

A minimum of a sophomore in college pursuing a BS degree, with a 3.0 or better GPA.
A computer science related major.
Year round availability: part-time up to 20 hours during school, full-time during summer if not taking classes.
Experience with XML, XSLT, XPath and JSON.
Experience in development with the Java programming language and an Integrated Development Environment (i.e. Eclipse).

Delta Dental of Michigan, Ohio, and Indiana is a leader in dental benefits, plus so much more.

We improve oral health through benefit plans, advocacy and community support, and our corporate giving builds healthy, smart, vibrant and inclusive communities. Full Job Description
Meet MedPro Group. We’re an industry-leading Berkshire Hathaway insurance company with a passion for our clients and our team. We are hundreds of professionals with varied backgrounds and experience levels who came together to achieve one goal: protecting those who have made it their mission to serve and care for others. Never considered the insurance industry before? We think you should.

In this role, you will…

Develop and support the implementation of configurations in Duck Creek Suite Distribution Management and integrations with other applications
Plan, execute, and document unit testing.
Participate in peer reviews.
Support the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and participate in the development sprints.
Develop and support Proof of Concept (POC) projects as required.
Provide product support and maintenance for products in production.
Participate in developing documentation and job aid documents.

We are looking for candidates with…

A minimum of a sophomore in college pursuing a BS degree, with a 3.0 or better GPA.
A computer science related major.
Year round availability: part-time up to 20 hours during school, full-time during summer if not taking classes.
Experience with XML, XSLT, XPath and JSON.
Experience in development with the Java programming language and an Integrated Development Environment (i.e. Eclipse).
Experience with SQL Database queries and stored procedures.
Experience with SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) is preferred.
Experience with Azure or AWS hosted Cloud environments and Web Services is preferred.
Experience with a version control management system (i.e. Git) is preferred.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
Excellent organizational, leadership and communication (verbal and written) skills.
Ability to work effectively in a team environment or independently.
Proficient in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
Authorization to work in the United States without requiring visa sponsorship, both now and in the future.

Why MedPro?
MedPro Group’s mission is built on a century-old legacy of protecting those who protect others. From our roots in our hometown of Fort Wayne, Indiana, we've worked diligently to become the nation's premier healthcare liability coverage provider, currently insuring more than 300,000 customers. With that growth, we've built a significant presence in all 50 states and internationally. Our team works across the country to provide the best strategies to mitigate risk and preserve the reputations of those who have entrusted their good name to us. That passion – built on a foundation of a culture that values uncompromised integrity, obsessive client focus, great teamwork, and a long-term mindset – make MedPro a preferred employer that many call their career home.

Full Job Description
To reinvent an industry, you have to build the best team. Join Formlabs if you want to bring groundbreaking professional 3D printers to the desktop of every designer, engineer, researcher, and artist in the world.

Formlabs' web team designs and maintains our websites which provide our customers with compelling learning and shopping experiences. We also empower internal users with the tools to manage website content and experiences. We are looking for a curious and motivated intern to help us create data-driven and user-centric experiences for our website.

If you're passionate about driving projects to help solve customer problems, and want to work with a remarkable, interdisciplinary team building a 3D printing ecosystem, we want you on the Form Team as a Software Product Management Intern. You will report to the Software Product Manager for our Websites.

The Job:
Work with stakeholders and various teams to research, gather requirements, design and vet new features for the website.
Define requirements for our development team and then coordinate testing of new features.
Create reporting and analyse the success of new features in order to quickly iterate or test new hypotheses.
Coordinate and prioritize incoming website feature requests or bug fixes from stakeholders.
Analyse data quality and set up reporting for key website metrics and features.
Participate in, and contribute to improvements in, the Web team's scrum ceremonies.

You:
Strong track record of academic excellence in a BA/BS program, majoring in Economics, Finance, Business Administration, Computer Science, Data Science, Math, Physics, Statistics or other technical field. First-year MBA candidates preferred.
Comfortable in a data-driven business environment.
Knowledge of SQL and skilled in Excel and/or Google Sheets.
Ability to think and perform both tactically and strategically.
Strong track record of success with progression in level of responsibility and scope.
Ability to multitask, and pivot readily and react to real-time data.
Excellent interpersonal and team building skills.
Excited to join an experienced team and work on high impact projects.

Bonus:
Familiarity with Test and Learn practices.
Exposure to the agile software development lifecycle.
Experience building reporting in Tableau or similar tools.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Even if you don't check every box, but see yourself contributing, please apply. Help us build an inclusive community that will change the face of 3D printing.

Full Job Description
NVIDIA is looking for a Software Engineering Intern to work in IPP (Infrastructure, Planning and Process).

IPP is a global organization within NVIDIA. This group works with various other groups within NVIDIA Software such as Graphics Processors, Mobile Processors, Deep Learning, Artificial Intelligence and Driveless Cars to cater to their infrastructure needs. These cloud services provide almost half a million automated jobs per day on thousands of servers helping with the efficiency of thousands of NVIDIA's software engineers worldwide.

The cloud hosts heterogeneous mix of machines and devices with various operating systems (Windows/Linux/Android), multitude of hardware platforms both NVIDIA GPUs and Tegra Processors. We’re looking for someone who can thrive in a fast moving environment and love being challenged to learn new things. You’ll come in with a basic understanding of engineering and operational principles and leave with a head filled to bursting with tools, processes, practices, and technology solutions.

What you'll be doing:
Developing and improving cloud automation, reporting, and monitoring

Proactively contribute to documentation, automation, and processes as they evolve

Learn about building and operating services at scale in a fast-iteration setup

Own small projects supporting internal process engineering efforts

Develop a working understanding of some of the common tools and practices used for microservice development and infrastructure

Work on fast paced DevOps engineering team

What we need to see:
Currently enrolled in a graduate program in Computer Science or related subject area. Completed undergraduate degree in Computer Science or Software Engineering is requirement

Strong object-oriented programming background, Java, Python preferred.

Familiarity with Container management solutions (Docker, Kubernetes)

Experience with CI/CD tools (Jenkins etc.) & practice , source code management systems ex: Git , GitLab etc.

Familiarity with Relational Databases such as MySQL, NoSQL DBs such as Elastic Search, MongoDB, HBase

Ability to turn design, compliance, and support references/content into documentation, presentations, and training

Ways to stand out from the crowd:
Familiarity with Windows, Linux operating systems as well as network technologies

Background with AWS or other cloud computing platforms

Ability to analyze situations and utilize troubleshooting skills, systems and tools, and problem solving abilities

NVIDIA is widely considered to be one of the technology world’s most desirable employers. We have some of the most forward-thinking and hardworking people in the world working for us. If you're creative and passionate about developing cloud services we want to hear from you!

NVIDIA is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. As we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression , sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

Full Job Description
Mechanical Engineer Intern-TUC01066

Description

BOMBARDIER

At Bombardier, our employees work together to evolve mobility worldwide - one good idea at a time. If you have a good idea, we’ll provide the environment where it will thrive and grow into a great product or customer experience. Your ideas are our fuel.

With an average of over 300 sunny days per year, Bombardier Business Aircraft’s Tucson Service Center is surrounded by stunning mountain ranges and desert landscapes. Celebrating over 40 years of operations in Tucson, Arizona, the service center occupies almost 1 million sq ft of total hangar space and is the largest of Bombardier’s nine aircraft service centers. The facility services both Bombardier commercial and business aircraft. Since its inauguration in 1976, the facility has been located at Tucson International Airport, a strategic location and a key local partner. The 247,000 sq ft Business Aircraft facility is equipped to perform scheduled and unscheduled maintenance, modifications, including interior modifications, avionics installations, customized exterior paint, and Aircraft on Ground (AOG) support for Bombardier Learjet, Challenger and Global aircraft. The Service Center has received certifications from CAAC, FAA, EASA, Argentina (Military), Bermuda, Canada, Cayman Islands, Hong Kong, India, Mexico, Qatar and South Africa.

Bombardier has an exciting opportunity available for a Mechanical Engineer Intern based in Tucson, AZ.

In your role, you will:
  • Assist with interpreting customer specifications, vendor requirements, company/industry standards, FAA/DOT and foreign regulations
  • Assist with determining mechanical equipment, hardware, antenna and system requirements in all types of Bombardier aircraft
  • Assist with investigating design build issues and help develop structural engineering solutions
  • Release temporary engineering to resolve build issues in a timely manner
  • Assist in dispositioning aircraft non-conformances including rework instructions
  • Perform aircraft and engineering drawing investigation and coordination with affected engineering disciplines, Quality assurance and operations manufacturing representatives
  • Coordinate with vendors to resolve installation interface and reliability problems
  • Author engineering to define structural special instructions or restrictions
Qualifications

As our ideal candidate,

  • You are currently pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Aerospace, Mechanical or Computer Science Engineering
Please note: Relocation or housing assistance is not available for this position. No visa sponsorship is available for this position,

Bombardier is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, age, disability status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by Federal, National, or Local Laws.

We thank all applicants for their interest, however, only those under consideration will be contacted. Please continue to monitor our website and apply for additional positions for which you are qualified and may be of interest to you.

Your ideas move people.

Full Job Description
Alternate Locations: Atlanta, GA (Georgia); Boston, MA (Massachusetts); Durham, NC (North Carolina); Fort Wayne, IN (Indiana); Greensboro, NC (North Carolina); Hartford, CT (Connecticut); Omaha, NE (Nebraska); Radnor, PA (Pennsylvania)

Relocation assistance will be considered/provided for this opportunity within our company guidelines.

Level: Intern

Requisition #65625

About the Company

Lincoln Financial Group, a Fortune 250 company with over 10,000 employees, provides advice and solutions that help empower Americans to take charge of their financial lives with confidence. Our core business areas — Life Insurance, Annuities, Retirement Plan Services and Group Protection — focus on supporting, preserving and enhancing over 17 million customer’s lifestyles and retirement outcomes.

Headquartered in Radnor, Pennsylvania, Lincoln Financial Group is the marketing name for Lincoln National Corporation (NYSE: LNC) and its affiliates. The company had $238 billion in assets under management as of December 31, 2018.

Ranked one of the Best Large Employers in America by Forbes magazine, Lincoln Financial Group makes a serious investment in our employees’ futures through a broad range of wealth accumulation and protection plans, health and wellness programs, and career development resources designed to help each individual reach their personal and professional goals.

General Purpose of Job

Our actuarial interns are a key part of our organization because they perform meaningful work in an environment that supports their learning within various business units of the company. #LI-AE1

Long Description

During the 11-week internship over the summer, our actuarial interns learn about our products while working in a variety of disciplines including financial reporting and planning, valuation, pricing and product development, and asset/liability management across lines of business including life insurance, annuities, group protection, and retirement services.

We offer actuarial internship positions in six locations:
Atlanta, GA Boston, MA Dover, NH
Fort Wayne, IN Hartford, CT Greensboro, NC Omaha, NE Radnor, PA

In addition, interns participate in a series with speakers from business leaders across the organization, as well as attend lunch and learn sessions focused on networking, execution, and agility in the workplace. Furthermore,
the interns enjoy a variety of social events with other interns and Actuarial Development Program participants. We offer both competitive pay and housing support.

Responsibilities:
Compile, categorize and audit data
Document and verify factors used in computations and actuarial models Run models and analyze output for consistency and reasonableness
Gain knowledge about company operations, systems, and actuarial methodologies Depending on area, develop rate filings, in-force files, and experience study results Depending on area, assist in the determination of premiums, benefits, and pricing levels

Requirements:
One or more SOA exams preferred GPA of 3.0 or higher
Pursuing undergraduate degree in Actuarial Science, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or other quantitative major is required.
Demonstrated leadership experience
Strong communication and problem solving skills
Ability to quickly learn and apply new skills and information Strong curiosity and creativity
Authorization to work in the U.S. without employer sponsorship
Other Skills and Abilities
Ability to perform under stress in cases of emergency, critical or hazardous situations.
Ability to work with others in a team environment.
Demonstrated solid relationship management skills with internal clients (e.g. management, peers and colleagues).
Demonstrates excellent organizational skills with the ability to prioritize workload and multi-task while maintaining strict attention to detail.
Demonstrates strong interpersonal skills with a collaborative style.
Demonstrates the ability to use sound judgment and discretion regarding confidential information.
Finds common ground and can gain collaboration among management, colleagues and peers.
Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).
Successfully completes regulatory and job training requirements.
Education
Other: - Minimum Required in Undergraduate degree in Actuarial Science, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, or other quantitative major.
Experience
0 - 1+ Years of experience in actuarial science that directly aligns with the specific responsibilities for this position (Required )
1 SOA exam preferred

This position may be subject to Lincoln’s Political Contribution Policy. An offer of employment may be contingent upon disclosing to Lincoln the details of certain political contributions. Lincoln may decline to extend an offer or terminate employment for this role if it determines political contributions made could have an adverse impact on Lincoln’s current or future business interests, misrepresentations were made, or for failure to fully disclose applicable political contributions and or fundraising activities.

Any unsolicited resumes/candidate profiles submitted through our web site or to personal e-mail accounts of employees of Lincoln Financial Group are considered property of Lincoln Financial Group and are not subject to payment of agency fees.

Lincoln Financial Group (“LFG”) is an Equal Opportunity employer and, as such, is committed in policy and practice to recruit, hire, compensate, train and promote, in all job classifications, without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), age, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, veterans status, or genetic information. Applicants are evaluated on the basis of job qualifications. If you are a person with a disability that impedes your ability to express your interest for a position through our online application process, or require TTY/TDD assistance, contact us by calling 260-455-2558.

Full Job Description
Imagine New Horizons

As a Web Development intern, you will work to improve the online user assistance for both ENOVIA and other Dassault Systèmes products. Create an outstanding user experience to help Dassault Systèmes customers find the information they need to get their work done!

This paid 12 month internship is based at the Dassault Systèmes Waltham campus located at 175 Wyman St. Waltham MA, with some flexibility for a hybrid schedule mixing onsite and remote hours. You and your manager will work together to create a schedule around your coursework.

Do you have dreams? Do you enjoy a challenge? Here at Dassault Systèmes, we empower people with passion to change the world. Shape your career with 3DS! #WeAre3DS

What your role will be?

You will help to develop several major enhancements to our user assistance, including refining, testing, and implementing a full responsive redesign of our main help portals. You will collaborate with user assistance developers, user experience designers, web application developers, tools engineers, and possibly other interns located both in the US and at Dassault Systèmes headquarters in France. You will be mentored primarily by the ENOVIA User Assistance manager, and you might perform additional testing and production tasks for the ENOVIA User Assistance team as time allows.

The Challenges Ahead

Contribute to the responsive redesign of help.3ds.com, primarily working with HTML, CSS, and Javascript.
Contribute to the development of new mechanisms for collecting feedback from our users and for storing, analyzing, and distributing the resulting data
Contribute to work on new and visually engaging presentations of What’s New information, based on an existing prototype built using the PERN stack and other proposals from user experience teams
Assist as necessary with other web development and user assistance development tasks

Your Key Success Factors

Actively enrolled in a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree program in Computer Science, Web Development, or similar area of study for the duration of the internship
A minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0
Ability to work onsite at the Waltham, MA office location for the majority of your working hours
Highly-developed skills in core web technologies - HTML, CSS, JavaScript
Experience with modern front-end tools such as React and Express, and with databases such as PostgreSQL and MongoDB
Some experience with ASP.NET, Visual Studio, and SQL Server a definite plus as our existing web infrastructure uses these technologies
Excellent communication skills in English, both verbal and written
Highly organized and detail-oriented
Ability to work independently and within a collaborative team structure
Positive, self-motivated individual with a high level of enthusiasm and willingness to learn and incorporate coaching and instructions into daily tasks and assignments

position: Photography and Videography Editor Intern (College Credit)
description:
Full Job Description

< WORK REMOTELY DUE TO COVID-19 >>

Division: JacPac - Social Impact Team

Highly self-motivated, detailed-orientated, passion-driven undergraduate and graduate students need only to apply. We are seeking college students in the field of digital media, visual arts, or related fields to assist us in our #100 jobs campaign to help disabled, homeless, disenfranchised clients obtain employment.

The purpose of the position is to be a part of the Social Impact (Client Training) team and complete daily tasks and assignments under the supervision of the campaign lead and/or field supervisor.

This internship will provide an educational experience for Digital Media interns to assist our clients to train for employment with our strategic partner. The major goal of this social impact partnership is to increase the number of disabled working graduates available for future jobs within this organization. Our purpose is to create an atmosphere in which the student is free to explore and learn while focusing on skill development, time management, and practicing methods and models required to perform specific assignments.

Our campaign strategy is to find the right interns that understand and respects our mission to advocate, support, and motivate our clients to meet their career goals and obtain gainful employment.

What you'll do:

  • Organize and string together raw footage into a continuous whole according to scripts or the instructions of the campaign manager.
  • Remain positive and professional and work with the fashion team to attract the younger generation and college student community.
  • Engage viewers and clients with our products and service
  • Select and combine the most effective shots of each scene to form a logical and smoothly running story.
  • Edit films and videotapes to insert music, dialogue, and sound effects, arrange films into sequences, and correct errors, using editing equipment.

What you'll need:

  • Currently enrolled college students
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and multi-task

§ Must be an enrolled undergrad or graduate student.

§ Must be organized and detail-oriented.

§ Answer phone screening questions sent via Indeed email.

§ Must meet a minimum of (5) key job requirements identifiers (application questions).

Full Job Description
Traditional corporate cards were designed to make you spend more with complex rewards programs that encourage wasteful spending. In contrast, Ramp’s mission is to increase the lifespan of businesses with intelligence & automation designed for high-performing finance teams. We make financial rigor easy by enabling real-time visibility and understanding of every dollar spent. Over 1,000 customers are now using Ramp for over $1 billion in annualized transaction volume.

Ramp was founded in 2019 by the same team who built, scaled, and sold Paribus to Capital One. We are the fastest growing NYC startup, having achieved a unicorn valuation of $1.6 billion in less than 2 years. Ramp has raised $320 million in funding from investors including Stripe, Goldman Sachs, Founders Fund, Coatue Management, D1 Capital Partners and Thrive Capital, as well as over 50 angel investors who were founders or executives of leading companies.

About the Role

Ramp is, at its core, an engineering company, and is on a mission to build the best engineering team in NYC! We are looking for frontend and full stack engineering interns (12 weeks) who are excited to be part of our early story and help us build a diverse and vibrant tech community in the city. We hire engineers with a broad set of technical skills, who are highly cross-functional, and eager to solve a wide range of engineering challenges. Our ideal candidate has a strong sense of ownership and enjoys owning projects from inception to scaling it in production. We value people who take pride in their work, and show an aptitude for learning quickly whether they’re familiar with our stack or not. As an early employee, you'll be working with a nimble team of committed and talented engineers and having a large, long-term impact on technical design and engineering culture.

What You'll Do

Build performant, beautiful, and usable interfaces that solve for growing businesses with complex needs
Ship products and services in cross-functional teams
Work with sales and business teams to incorporate and productize customer feedback
Help establish engineering process, tools, and systems that will allow us to scale the code base, productivity, and the team

What You'll Need

Currently pursuing a B.S. (or higher) in Computer Science or a related technical field, with an expected graduation date in 2021 or 2022
Proficiency in Javascript, with a knack for getting the visuals right
Experience with one or more object-oriented programming languages
Track record of shipping high quality products and features or a portfolio of side projects
Ability to turn business and product ideas into engineering solutions
Desire to work in a fast-paced environment, continuously grow, and master your craft
Alignment with Ramp’s core values of enabling businesses to grow more by spending less

Nice to Haves

Proficiency in React v16+
Familiarity with or desire to learn our tech stack which includes, but not limited to: Flask (Python), Elixir, AWS, RabbitMQ, PostgreSQL
Passion for, or curiosity to learn, financial technology

About Our Teams

Card Engineering | Ramp’s Card Engineering team is responsible for shipping products with a singular focus on enhancing the finance team and cardholder experience. Current project areas include accounting, physical/virtual card management, mobile wallets, transactions, reimbursements, spend insights, and vendor/invoice management.
Risk Engineering | Ramp’s Risk Engineering team is pioneering how risk is evaluated and building the infrastructure to scale to millions of business in the United States. Current project areas include application processing, underwriting & KYC, risk data signals, risk limit & exposure management, bank linking, capital markets, fraud, and payments.

Learn more about our problem space and environment at our new engineering blog!

Ramp Benefits

Unlimited PTO
WFH stipend to support your home office needs
Monthly wellness stipend

Full Job Description
Precision Strip, Inc., the leader in the metal coil processing industry, is seeking qualified candidates for an IT Software Co-Op position that is based out of our Headquarters location in Minster, Ohio. The primary responsibility of this position will involve analysis, design and development of new systems, as well as provide maintenance and support to our custom software.

At Precision Strip, our systems are considered a source of competitive advantage in the market space, and our team is often sought after to architect innovative solutions that improve productivity and quality. Qualified candidates will be working towards a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, MIS, Information Technology or an equivalent with a 3.0 or greater GPA requirement. Other qualifications include: a strong knowledge of computer programming, analytical skills, communication skills, teamwork, attention to detail, creativity, and an appreciation of the bigger business picture.

This IT Co-op is for a student interested in working approximately 40 hours per week during the fall semester starting in August 2021.

Precision Strip is a drug free workplace and an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer.

Applications may be completed online at www.precision-strip.com/careers.

Learn more about Precision Strip by visiting www.precision-strip.com.

Precision Strip...Doing The Exceptional

Full Job Description
Becht is a 5 STAR rated Glassdoor, a Top 100 Best Places to Work in New Jersey according to NJBIZ and a Great Place to Work-Certified™ company!

Please attach a recent unofficial transcript with your resume. If you are a Master's degree student, please also upload your Bachelor's degree transcript. Failure to do so will create a delay in the review of your application.

Who is Becht?
Founded in 1964, Becht is a rapidly-growing, multi-discipline consulting firm relied on by customers to relentlessly solve their most difficult and entrenched problems. We combine vast experience through our network of over 1500 technical experts with both engineering expertise and professional experience. Becht is a company founded on excellence, and as such we seek individuals who want to be part of our passionate and energetic team.

Who Do We Want?
Becht is seeking junior, senior, master’s or doctorate computer science/software engineering students with interest in web app development with a database back end who want to learn more by joining our world-class, family-owned engineering organization. Becht is committed to developing young professionals by providing opportunities to explore the dynamic environment of engineering consulting services. Becht strives to provide the student with:
  • Real world experience with a consulting company operating with the latest technology
  • Guidance in the form of a highly trained mentor
  • A positive, team approach work environment
  • Hands on experience with the full SDLC during your internship
At Becht, our intern/co-op program gives students the opportunity to explore the practical applications of their college classes while working with customers from around the globe. We offer full-time student positions for every semester. These positions actively support current projects and are constantly evolving. As a student with Becht, you will learn to develop internal and client facing web apps, web pages, and productivity tools with a team of other software developers and engineers. You will be involved in the entire process from setting application requirements, creating data models, and designing the interface, developing the front and back ends, testing and assisting in deployment. You will be at the forefront of our most advanced and technically rewarding projects to assist clients in improving reliability and profitability while also reducing risks to people and the environment.

Build Your Career with Becht
A creative and innovative work environment isn’t all we have to offer! When you join Becht, you can expect:
  • A positive, collaborative workforce
  • Access to further training and development
  • Mentoring programs
  • Company and family events such as baseball games, go-karting, and bowling
  • Opportunities that provide stability as well as variety
  • Work day events such as birthday lunches
  • Community outreach programs such as Red Cross blood drives, Toys for Tots collections/volunteering, and United Way campaigns
Your Knowledge and Expertise
  • Passion for technology and can navigate across complex and rapidly changing landscapes
  • Detail oriented and organized
  • Creative and confident to express new ideas
  • Proven troubleshooting skills
  • Self-motivated and self-disciplined
  • Should be comfortable working in a virtual team
  • Ability to compartmentalize efforts—put one task down, pick up another, then resume the first with minimal ramp up required
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Object oriented programming experience
  • Database experience
  • MSSQL, Bootstrap, C# and/or .NET Core experience are a plus.
  • Must be enrolled in a Bachelor’s or Master’s Software Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent, degree
  • Must be available to work 40 hours per week for a minimum of one semester
  • Remote or must be local or willing to temporarily relocate to the Medina, OH; Liberty Corner, NJ; or Humble, Houston, TX areas or KC or MO; Northland area.
6 months Internship/Co-op blocks are preferred.

BECHT is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

position: Army CCDC-DAC Data Analysis, Management and Web Development Internship
description:
Full Job Description
Organization
U.S. Department of Defense (DOD)
Reference Code
CCDC-DAC-2021-0001
How to Apply

Description

The Combat Capabilities Development Command (CCDC) Data & Analysis Center (DAC) is offering a Post-Bachelors opportunity at Aberdeen Proving Ground in Aberdeen, Maryland.

What will I be doing?

You will apply mathematical, analytical and computer science principles to develop and improve capabilities for managing data to meet needs of the Data and Analysis Center.

Why should I apply?

Under the guidance of a mentor, you will gain hands-on experience to complement your education and support your academic and professional goals. Along the way, you will engage in activities and research in several areas. These include, but are not limited to:

data assessment
support software, database, and web tool/website development
support conduct of Schedule Risk and performance analyses through various functional areas
apply best practices for quality assurance and quality control
identify opportunities for improvement
support implementation of process improvement

Where will I be located?

Aberdeen Proving Ground, Maryland

What is the appointment length?

The tentative date start for this appointment is July 1, 2021. This date is flexible and is dependent upon the selection of a candidate and start date deemed feasible between the candidate and the mentor. This appointment is a twelve month research appointment, with the possibility to be renewed for additional research periods. Appointments may be extended depending on funding availability, project assignment, program rules, and availability of the participant.

What are the benefits?

You will receive a stipend to be determined by CCDC-DAC. Stipends are typically based on a participant’s academic standing, discipline, experience, and research facility location.

Other benefits may include the following:
Health Insurance Supplement (Participants are eligible to purchase health insurance through ORISE)
Relocation Allowance
Training and Travel Allowance

About CCDC-DAC

The Combat Capabilities Development Command (CCDC) Data & Analysis Center (DAC) is an Army Futures Command organization that conducts a variety of critical analyses to provide state-of-the-art analytical solutions to senior level Army and Department of Defense officials. The Data & Analysis Center's responsive systems analysis supports the "Equipping" and "Sustaining" of weapons and materiel for our Soldiers in the field as well as our Future Army Force. https://www.dac.ccdc.army.mil/home.html.

About ORISE

This program, administered by Oak Ridge Associated Universities (ORAU) through its contract with the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) to manage the Oak Ridge Institute for Science and Education (ORISE), was established through an interagency agreement between DOE and DoD. Participants do not enter into an employee/employer relationship with ORISE, ORAU, DoD or any other office or agency. Instead, you will be affiliated with ORISE for the administration of the appointment through the ORISE appointment letter and Terms of Appointment. Proof of health insurance is required for participation in this program. Health insurance can be obtained through ORISE. For more information, visit the ORISE Research Participation Program at the U.S. Department of Defense.

Qualifications

The qualified candidate will possess a Bachelor’s Degree in mathematics, engineering, statistics, physics, chemistry, computer science, or similar disciplines, with a GPA of 3.0 or higher. Degree must have been received within five years of the appointment start date. MediaWiki, and Microsoft applications experience preferred.

Application Requirements

A complete application consists of:
Zintellect Profile
Educational and Employment History
Essay Questions (goals, experiences, and skills relevant to the opportunity)
Resume (PDF)
Transcripts/Academic Records - For this opportunity, an unofficial transcript or copy of the student academic records printed by the applicant or by academic advisors from internal institution systems may be submitted.

If you have questions, send an email to ARMY@orise.orau.gov.

Eligibility Requirements
Citizenship: U.S. Citizen Only
Degree: Bachelor's Degree, Master's Degree, or Doctoral Degree received within the last 60 months or anticipated to be received by 6/30/2021 11:59:00 PM.
Overall GPA: 3.00

Discipline(s):
Communications and Graphics Design
Computer, Information, and Data Sciences
Earth and Geosciences
Engineering
Environmental and Marine Sciences
Life Health and Medical Sciences
Mathematics and Statistics
Nanotechnology
Other Non-S&E
Other Physical Sciences
Physics
Social and Behavioral Sciences

Full Job Description
Imagine New Horizons

As a Web Development intern, you will work to improve the online user assistance for both SOLIDWORKS and other Dassault Systèmes products. Create an outstanding user experience to help Dassault Systèmes customers find the information they need to get their work done!

This paid, 12 month internship is based at the Dassault Systèmes Americas Headquarters located on 175 Wyman St. in Waltham, MA. You and your manager will create a flexible schedule to accomodate your university coursework.

Do you have dreams? Do you enjoy a challenge? Here at Dassault Systèmes, we empower people with passion to change the world. Shape your career with 3DS! #WeAre3DS

What your role will be?

You will help to develop several major enhancements to our user assistance, including refining, testing, and implementing a full responsive redesign of our main help portals. You will collaborate with user assistance developers, user experience designers, web application developers, tools engineers, and possibly other interns located both in the US and at Dassault Systèmes headquarters in France. You will be mentored primarily by the SOLIDWORKS User Assistance manager, and you might perform additional testing and production tasks for the SOLIDWORKS User Assistance team as time allows.

The Challenges Ahead

Contribute to the responsive redesign of help.solidworks.com and help.3ds.com, primarily working with HTML, CSS, and Javascript.

Highly organized and detail-oriented

Positive, self-motivated individual with a high level of enthusiasm and willingness to learn and incorporate coaching and instructions into daily tasks and assignments

Full Job Description
Imagine New Horizons…

SOLIDWORKS Digital Transformation is responsible for the research and application of new technology, automation, machine learning and analysis capabilities to processes, customer engagement and support with the aim to improve efficiency, enhance customer value and uncover new opportunities.

As a intern within the Digital Transformation team, you will work on innovative analytics and platforms across the Dassault Systèmes SOLIDWORKS services organization, including technical support, customer service, training and certification.

This is a paid, 6 month internship with a flexible start in 2021. Your will work with your manager to tailor your work schedule around your academic schedule. This role is based in the Dassault Systèmes SOLIDWORKS Corp. offices located om 175 Wyman Street, Waltham, MA.

Do you have dreams? Do you enjoy a challenge? Here at Dassault Systèmes, we empower people with passion to change the world.

Shape your career with3DS! #WeAre3DS

What will your role be?

You will be exposed to customized business intelligence dashboards on the revolutionary 3DEXPERIENCE Platform while investigating predictive models and algorithms for our clients and partners. Natural language processing and predictive machine learning will be a significant part of the role, so experience, interest and knowledge in these areas is beneficial.

Example activities include, but are not limited to:
Natural Language Processing Guided Submission: Develop and enhance Natural Language Processing models for a range of applications, such as guided issue submission.

Data Dimensioning and Categorization: Improve the quality of the services data by categorization, analysis and feature engineering. Allowing data to be more useful for machine learning.

Dashboard & Analytics: Assist in the creation of interactive dashboards, joining multiple data sources to create actionable business insights.

Your Challenge ahead

You will be charged with enhancing, further developing and deploying natural language processing models and machine learning. Specifically with the intention to help our valuable partners and clients submit fully qualified technical queries, find solutions automatically, reduce support turnaround time and increase customer satisfaction.

Your key success factors

Actively enrolled in a Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Computer Science , Data Science or equivalent for the duration of the internship
Minimum cumulative GPA 3.0 /4.0 scale
Ability to work onsite in the Waltham, MA office
Demonstrate knowledge of Machine Learning and Models in particular Natural Language Processing (NLP)
Python (Jupyter notebook, Anaconda, MATLAB etc.)
Data pre-processing, enrichment and analysis processes.
Well-developed communication skills in English, both oral and written
Displays enthusiasm, curiosity and the ability to work autonomously or within teams

Full Job Description
Meet MedPro Group. We’re an industry-leading Berkshire Hathaway insurance company with a passion for our clients and our team. We are hundreds of professionals with varied backgrounds and experience levels who came together to achieve one goal: protecting those who have made it their mission to serve and care for others. Never considered the insurance industry before? We think you should.

In this role, you will…

Develop and support the implementation of configurations in Duck Creek Suite Distribution Management and integrations with other applications
Plan, execute, and document unit testing.
Participate in peer reviews.
Support the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and participate in the development sprints.
Develop and support Proof of Concept (POC) projects as required.
Provide product support and maintenance for products in production.
Participate in developing documentation and job aid documents.

We are looking for candidates with…

A minimum of a sophomore in college pursuing a BS degree, with a 3.0 or better GPA.
A computer science related major.
Year round availability: part-time up to 20 hours during school, full-time during summer if not taking classes.
Experience with XML, XSLT, XPath and JSON.
Experience in development with the Java programming language and an Integrated Development Environment (i.e. Eclipse).
Experience with SQL Database queries and stored procedures.
Experience with SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) is preferred.
Experience with Azure or AWS hosted Cloud environments and Web Services is preferred.
Experience with a version control management system (i.e. Git) is preferred.
Strong analytical and problem solving skills.
Excellent organizational, leadership and communication (verbal and written) skills.
Ability to work effectively in a team environment or independently.
Proficient in MS Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
Authorization to work in the United States without requiring visa sponsorship, both now and in the future.

Why MedPro?
MedPro Group’s mission is built on a century-old legacy of protecting those who protect others. From our roots in our hometown of Fort Wayne, Indiana, we've worked diligently to become the nation's premier healthcare liability coverage provider, currently insuring more than 300,000 customers. With that growth, we've built a significant presence in all 50 states and internationally. Our team works across the country to provide the best strategies to mitigate risk and preserve the reputations of those who have entrusted their good name to us. That passion – built on a foundation of a culture that values uncompromised integrity, obsessive client focus, great teamwork, and a long-term mindset – make MedPro a preferred employer that many call their career home.

Full Job Description
Explore the possibilities across our global house of brands.

Defined by inclusivity rather than exclusivity, Tapestry embraces the exploration of individuality and invests in helping you grow personally and professionally. Every individual in our global house has the opportunity to make an impact, learn and be part of our growing and unique story.

At Tapestry, we have the freedom to express ourselves and run with our best ideas across Coach, Kate Spade New York, and Stuart Weitzman. We share a profound belief in both our individual and collective potential, and know that with hard work and dedication, anything is possible.

Primary Purpose: Design test scripts, execute tests for new pieces of software and work out any bugs with the development team before it is put into full production.

The successful individual will leverage their proficiency in Software Quality Assurance:

Review and understand Business Requirements and Functional specifications documents to create test cases/use cases
Perform functional testing and log defects in Jira by accurately adding steps with proper details and documentation
Proficient working with Defect Management Life Cycle

The accomplished individual will possess...

Proactive, can-do attitude
Eager to learn and deep dive in any technology
Strong communication skills
Ability to work independently and as a member of a cross-functional team

An outstanding professional will have...

Very strong analytical skills
Pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related field.

Our Competencies for All Employees

Drive for Results: Can be counted on to exceed goals successfully; is constantly and consistently one of the top performers; very bottom-line oriented; steadfastly pushes self and others for results.
Customer Focus: Is dedicated to meeting the expectations and requirements of internal and external customers; gets first-hand customer information and uses it for improvements in products and services; acts with customers in mind; establishes and maintains effective relationships with customers and gains their trust and respect.
Creativity: Comes up with a lot of new and unique ideas; easily makes connections among previously unrelated notions; tends to be seen as original and value-added in brainstorming settings.
Interpersonal Savvy: Relates well to all kinds of people, up, down, and sideways, inside and outside the organization; builds appropriate rapport; builds constructive and effective relationships; uses diplomacy and tact; can diffuse even high-tension situations comfortably.
Learning on the Fly: Learns quickly when facing new problems; a relentless and versatile learner; open to change; analyzes both successes and failures for clues to improvement; experiments and will try anything to find solutions; enjoys the challenge of unfamiliar tasks; quickly grasps the essence and the underlying structure of anything.
Perseverance: Pursues everything with energy, drive, and a need to finish; seldom gives up before finishing, especially in the face of resistance or setbacks.
Dealing with Ambiguity: Can effectively cope with change; can shift gears comfortably; can decide and act without having the total picture; isn’t upset when things are up in the air; doesn’t have to finish things before moving on; can comfortably handle risk and uncertainty.

Our Competencies for All People Managers

Strategic Agility: Sees ahead clearly; can anticipate future consequences and trends accurately; has broad knowledge and perspective; is future oriented; can articulately paint credible pictures and visions of possibilities and likelihoods; can create competitive and breakthrough strategies and plans.
Building Effective Teams: Blends people into teams when needed; creates strong morale and spirit in their team; shares wins and successes; fosters open dialogue; lets people finish and be responsible for their work; defines success in terms of the whole team; creates a feeling of belonging in the team.
Managerial Courage: Doesn’t hold back anything that needs to be said; provides current, direct, complete, and “actionable” positive and corrective feedback to others; lets people know where they stand; faces up to people problems on any person or situation (not including direct reports) quickly and directly; is not afraid to take negative action when necessary.

position: SAP iXp Intern - Web Speed Performance Engineer (Front-End)
description:
Full Job Description
Requisition ID: 286555
Work Area: Software-Development Operations
Expected Travel: 0 - 10%
Career Status: Student
Employment Type: Intern

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

About the SAP Internship Experience Project:
The SAP Internship Experience Project is SAP’s global, paid internship program that provides university students with the opportunities to find purpose in their careers.

Three reasons to intern at SAP:
Culture of collaboration: Meet with mentors, make new friends across the globe and create a thriving personal network.
Project-driven experience: Gain cross-functional skills from our virtual and in-person learning sessions, diverse subject matter experts, and project deliverables.
Gain visibility: With SAP Internship Experience Project in your title, you’ll have a global network of SAP leaders, entrepreneurs and career development opportunities at your fingertips.

About the team:
The SAP Digital Platforms team, within SAP’s Intelligence Enterprise Solutions group, is responsible for SAP.com and associated external (public-facing) digital web properties. The SAP Digital Platforms team is responsible for the development lifecycle, continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) practices, and overall operational support for 47 country sites globally in 23 languages.

The SAP.com Digital Platforms team is a detail-oriented, in-house services team that is constantly pushing the envelope by working within our creative and technical boundaries to encourage internal customers to build the best user-experiences and blazing-fast websites.

What you’ll do:
Position Title: SAP iXp Intern - Web Speed Performance Engineer (Front-End)
Location: Newtown Square, PA
Expected start date to end date: July 2021 - January 2022

In this role, you’ll:
The SAP.com Digital Platforms team is looking for an Intern to assist the Speed Performance Monitoring Lead to collaborate with the design, development, and other operational leads for SAP‘s digital landscapes. Our on-going objective to improve the online responsiveness of our user-experience on desktop and mobile web browsers in support of SAP’s 2021 Mobile-First strategy.

This role is responsible for assisting in the management of SAP.com and other digital entities including communications, content and assets for various areas of the global website and digital programs. The position provides a main point of contact for assigned requests, driving projects to completion through close collaboration with core platform team members, leadership, and assigned third-party agencies to ensure efficient and timely production of a high-quality digital customer experience.

Who you are:
We're looking for a self-motivated, out-of-the-box thinker who enjoys challenges across a broad range of technology subject areas, is pursuing a career in Computer Science, Front-End Web Development, or User-Experience Design with knowledge and interest in performance and optimization, front-end development, interactive design, application performance industry, and enterprise level projects.

Responsibilities

Audit websites for performance, identify optimization opportunities, and present the results in the cross-functional team environment.
Work in a collaborative environment developing and executing against immediate and long-term incremental programs.
Make effective tradeoffs considering business priorities, but always with the user-experience in mind.
Advise web engineering teams on key technical performance and optimization considerations and best practices.
Work with Data/Analytics team on ensure assets are trackable for reporting and insights initiatives.
Profile performance of JavaScript and layouts for a multitude of devices/platforms.
Work with partners (e.g.: Adobe, Splunk, Google, and other third-party web services) and consulting agencies to ensure each site release or initiative delivers maximum impact to customers across all websites and data platforms.
Generate performance reports, competitive analysis, and benchmarks for internal partners using our best-in-class performance and optimization tool-sets.
Build out and report on synthetic tests with Splunk (a.k.a. Rigor) Synthetic Testing platform.
Build out available real-user monitoring test reports with SAP.com Development Team.
Analyze performance metrics and build plans for improvements with development leads.
Provide an unparalleled customer experience by contributing to new features and technical documentation.
Assist with discovering and debugging issues found on web properties.
Find areas we can optimistically render UI without waiting on a server response.
Police and standardize performance budgets, health-checks, scorecards, and KPIs directed by your main point of contact.
Monitor and measure complex multi-step user flows on our customers’ websites and applications using a full browser and a script recorder.
Track mobile and desktop experiences and performance over time using pre-determined, industry standard network connections.
Monitor and optimize third-party tags and identify slow and error-causing external script risks.
Run tests with highly customizable configurations on any device type, connection speed or viewport
Develop, share, and set the bar within SAP for high quality in web performance engineering.
Assist in the support of planning and project management.
Assist building internal webpages in SAP JAM, Microsoft Teams, and other wiki-based platforms for documentation and communication in support of SAP’s Speed Performance Monitoring program.
Help organize projects in accordance with requirements.
Assist with SAP.com agile ceremonies and planning.
Leverage tools and technology for SAP.com content and asset production.
Have very good communication skills and enjoy communicating challenging technical concepts.
Measure and A/B test site performance solutions.
Mentor, educate and advocate for web performance across our teams.

Qualifications

General knowledge of web speed performance metrics.
General familiarity with Internet technologies and how the web works.
General knowledge of industry standard web speed performance tools; e.g.: WebPageTest.org, Google Pagespeed Insights, and Google Lighthouse.
General to Intermediate knowledge, approx. 1-2 years, of general web technologies experience; e.g.: HTML, JavaScript, CSS, Java/C#/PHP.
Intermediate knowledge of Google Core Web Vitals strategy and metric threshold requirements.
Intermediate knowledge of visual design principles and commonly used tools for optimizing visual page elements; e.g.: images and media.
Have the ability to read and understand code, explore new technologies, and APIs.
General knowledge of modern browsers such as Chrome, Firefox, Safari, and Edge.
General knowledge of project management and, issue tracking and documentation tools; e.g.: JIRA, Confluence, MS Teams, Slack, etc.
Proficiency with converting JSON to MS Excel for in-depth speed performance reporting.
Proficiency with Microsoft Office programs; including Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.
Comfortable working with a geographically-distributed software development team.
Willingness to acquire new skills to meet evolving needs.
Passion and interest in web performance optimization to improve an website’s user-experience across all web devices, internet connection speeds, and geo-locations.
Exceptional organizational and planning skills and a proven ability to multi-task.
General knowledge of Agile methodologies.
General understanding of content management systems such as WordPress or Adobe AEM.
Excellent verbal and written communication and collaboration skills.
Attention to detail with an emphasis on accuracy and quality.
Ability to prioritize effectively to manage multiple projects.
Experience working in a team environment as well as independently.
Ability to collaborate across teams globally.
Ability to complete tasks in a timely manner.
Strong desire to continually learn new technologies.

Technical Experience

A basic knowledge is required for this internship.

Intermediate expertise is required for future employment opportunities.

Full-stack Development
HTML5/CSS3
JavaScript
JavaScript Frameworks
jQuery
DevTools
Responsive/Adaptive Design
Cross-Browser Development
Content Management Systems
Testing/Debugging
Git/Version Control

Bonus Skills:
Solid hands-on understanding of Google Analytics, CDNs and custom HTTP headers.
Intermediate knowledge of advanced web performance profiling tools; e.g.: GTmetrix, Pingdom, SpeedCurve, Rigor, etc.
Experience optimizing React applications.
Knowledge of code splitting and simplification methods.

Education and Professional Experience

In pursuit of degree in a related field or equivalent work experience; such topics of interests are:
Computer Science
Web Performance Analytics
Full Stack Web Development
Front-End Web Development
User-Experience Design
Interactive Design and Media
Marketing & Business
Relevant experience in study or similar position managing production processes and workflow.
Relevant experience in study or similar position monitoring quality assurance testing environments and live production systems.

Follow @SAPiXp on Instagram and don’t miss anything about our experiences worldwide!
